loans.name: Thon

texts.en:
Thon C. is 27 years old and lives with her husband in the Kampong Cham province. She stays at home and raises pigs. Besides doing this activity, she also sells sugar cane. On average, she makes USD $4 a day, while her husband makes USD $4 by running a moto-taxi business. This couple has two children, one of whom is in school and one other is too young to attend school.
Mrs. Thon C. is asking for a loan to expand her livestock by adding more pigs.

loans.use: To buy more pigs

loans.name: Lin

texts.en: Lin C., 27, owns a brickfield used to make charcoal. He sells the charcoal from his house and sometimes customers come to buy at his house. He is married with two teenage children. His wife works as a local farmer and sells desserts out of her home to the neighborhood. C. is applying for a loan to increase his business capital.

loans.use: To increase the capital in his business

loans.name: Alifali

texts.en: Alifali M. is a shop vendor who sells a variety of goods including women's clothing, textiles and kitchen articles. He has more than fifteen years of experience in this field. He reached his original goal two years ago when he realized his dream of building his own store. His one son studies at school, and Alifali dreams of providing him with an excellent education. To continue the growth of his business, Alifali applied for a $2000 loan with the loan term of fifteen months.

loans.use: To purchase more textiles to sell

loans.name: Esmelda María

texts.es:
La señora Esmelda B. se dedica a la venta de mariscos en el Mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua siendo este su negocio con el cual mantiene su núcleo familiar compuesto por sus dos pequeños hijos en edades escolares.

Con el propósito de adquirir los mariscos, ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito y de esta manera continuar su venta en su localidad que tanto necesita de su inversión para crecer.
texts.en:
Mrs. Esmelda B. sells seafood in the wholesale market in Managua. The business maintains her immediate family, comprised of her two small children who are of school age. With the intention of acquiring seafood, she has come to apply for a loan at Ceprodel. This way she can continue to sell in her area, also making investments needed to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase seafood.

loans.name: Sodir

texts.ru:
Ашурматов Содир- парень 23 лет, женат, имеет двоих детей. Он занимается продажей женских платков на «Авган базаре» города Худжанда. За товаром ездит сам в Бишкек. Его оборотный капитал среднего уровня. Поэтому для расширения своего  бизнеса Содир хочет получить кредит.
Он планирует съездить за товаром весеннего ассортимента. У него много знакомых , которые покупают у него платки, при мониторинге  было явно видно. Что у Содира стабильная торговля.
texts.en:
A. Sodir is a young 23 year old man; he is married and has two children. He sells women’s handkerchiefs at the “Avgan Bazaar” in the city of Khujand. He travels himself for products to Bishkek. He has an average level of working capital. This is why Sodir would like to get a loan to grow his business. He plans to travel to purchase spring products. He has a lot of acquaintances who purchase handkerchiefs from him. It was obvious during monitoring that Sodir has stable sales.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of handkerchiefs

loans.name: Consepcion

texts.en:
Consepcion M. is from the village of El Paraiso. She is 52 years old. Consepcion is married and has two school-aged children and two who are now grown. To make a living, Consepcion owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Consepcion has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2005, Consepcion joined PMPC to gain access to financial services. She wanted to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Consepcion has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business.

Consepcion is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Consepcion from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make prepared food items for sale

loans.name: Mamarahim

texts.en:
M. Mamarahim is 51 years old. He is married with six children. Mamarahim has a small restaurant where he sells breakfast, lunch and dinner. When he first started his business he was only open for breakfast because he worked at night. Once his place became more popular he was able to dedicate his whole time to the business. Mamarahim wants the loan to invest in tables, chairs and utensils. He is asking for 5000 Somoni. With this money, Mamarahim will be able to expand his business, to earn more profit and in turn help his children move forward to complete their school studies and further continue studying at the University. The well-being of this family is in your hands. Contribute to the growth of his business and they will be grateful. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase tables, chairs and utensils.

loans.name: Badam-Ochir

texts.en:
Badam-Ochir M. is 19-year-old and is newly married. He lives with his new wife and 1-year-old son in Ovorhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. He has a small business in ice cream-making. He has been running a small ice cream shop since 2008. He finished a tour with the national army and got married to his wife last year. Upon his marriage, he started his first private business--ice cream making.

From the start, his business has been doing well and the sales volume has been climbing from the beginning. This month, his business capital has increased to 850,000 Mongolian (about $590 US). He aims to increase the variety of ice cream products that he offers now. He would also like to add more flavors in his ice cream portfolio. Badam-Ochir says that he would like to expand his ice cream-making capacity as the demand for ice cream surges during this hot summer. He requests a loan to purchase additional freezer and ice cream ingredients for his business.

loans.use: To purchase additional freezer and ice cream ingredients

loans.name: Erna

texts.en:
ERNA B., is a resident of Hda. San Jose 2, Brgy. Luna, Cadiz City in Negros Occidental. She is 54 years old, and married with 9 school age to adult children.

Because of her large family, life has not been very comfortable for the B. family, and Erna dreams of providing her children with a better life. This is why in 2005, Erna joined NWTF-Project Dungganon so that she could also start her own business and become financially stable.

She now owns and operates a General Store which earns on the average PHP 2,000.00 for her family.

This is Erna's 7th loan cycle and she wants to borrow PHP 17,000 to add to her working capital so that she could add more stocks to her General Store and have more goods to sell to her neigbors.

With some of her children still going to school, Erna hopes that by striving hard, she will be able to provide a better life for her children, and save enough so that they could attend college and have comfortable lives in the future.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: ADDITIONAL CAPITAL FOR THE BORROWER'S GENERAL STORE

loans.name: Cephas

texts.en:
Cephas K. is a single parent with two children and has received senior high education. He is responsible for all the financial needs of his family as well as of himself.

Cephas sells provisions in Hohoe and his loan will be used to buy more provisions to sell. He hopes to save the new profits from his expanded business.

loans.use: To buy more provisions to sell

loans.name: Sefulu

texts.en: Sefulu L. (0) is a 39-year-old woman living in the town of Matautu-Lefaga. She is married and has three school-aged children. Sefulu owns and operates a business running a bakery, baking and selling a variety of confectionaries such cookies and cakes in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 350 WST a month. Sefulu joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,500 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase baking equipment. Sefulu is now requesting a new loan of 1,500 WST which will be used to purchase additional cooking ingredients. The loan will be her 4th from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional baking ingredients

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Acheter de l’engrais et  embaucher des métayers

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is fifty years old. She is divorced and has given birth to six children who are in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Dormaa is a commercial and farming town. Elizabeth is a trader. She trades in jewels. She buys her goods from Sunyani. She hawks to sell in her community and also treks to nearby communities to sell. Elizabeth has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy jewels

loans.name: Olohountognin Séraphine

texts.fr: O. Olohountognin Séraphine est née en 1979 à Zoukpa à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin, où elle y réside depuis sa naissance. Mariée à KOUNOU Jérôme, un soudeur, Olohountognin Séraphine est mère de deux enfants tous scolarisés. Olohountognin Séraphine vit seul avec ses enfants ; elle supporte seule les charges de ses enfants. C’est depuis dix ans que Olohountognin Séraphine mène comme activité la vente de tissus et de bassines. Olohountognin Séraphine fait ses approvisionnements à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin.  Olohountognin Séraphine a déjà obtenu deux crédits à ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés. Pour augmenter ses marchandises et sa clientèle, en vue de mieux répondre aux besoins de ses deux enfants, Olohountognin Séraphine sollicite à nouveau auprès de ALIDé un troisième crédit.
texts.en:
Olohountognin Séraphine O. was born in 1979 in Zoukpa in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin, where she has lived all her life. She is married with Jérôme Kounou, a welder, and the mother of two children who attend school. Olohountognin Séraphine lives alone with her children and provides alone for them.

Olohountognin Séraphine has been selling cloths and basins for ten years. She gets her supplies from Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She had so far two loans from Alidé, which she repaid on schedule. Since she wants to increase her inventory and expand her clientele, with the aim to better provide for her two children, she came again to Alidé and applied for a third loan.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloths and basins

loans.name: Mrs. Vanna Huy Village Bank Group

texts.en: A village bank loan consists of twenty seven people who are located in BoE. village in Kandal province. All the members will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Vanna H. is the village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land used to cultivate rice to earn a living. On this plantation she faces an obstacle because her field has infertile soil which badly affects her crops. In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Vanna H. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support the rice field. She is 35 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is a driver while the others are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support the rice field

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more sugar, soap and cooking oil in bulk.

loans.name: Hannington Andika

texts.en: Hannington Andika O. owns O. Investments, a maize-grinding shop.  He has been in the business for thirteen years and has one employee who grinds maize into flour.  His challenges are expensive diesel and the slowness of his grinding machine.  He will be using the proceeds of KES20,000 to buy maize and some parts for the worn-out grinding machine.  He would like in the future to have three other grinding mills at Butere, Monyvlia, and Sebatia.  Hannington has a wife who is a bussinesswoman and together they have six children ranging from nine to eighteen years.  He describes himself as an honest and hardworking person.

loans.use: To buy maize and machine parts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: N. Florence is a businesswoman living in Geregere lugazi. She is married with 3 children. She owns a grocery shop. She has been in this business for over 3 years. She will use this loan to purchase shop items such as match boxes, crates of soda, soap, sugar, and so forth. She would like to increase her stock and expand the business as well. Her dream is to see her children study and complete school and then get good jobs.

loans.use: To purchase items for her grocery shop

loans.name: Soth

texts.en:
Mrs. Soth Y. lives in Kaoh Reah Kraom village in Kandal province and she is 61 years old. She is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare (2.5-acre) field on which she grows crops to support her family living.

In this crop field, Mrs. Soth Y. now faces a problem because her field is far from the irrigation system and she does not have money to support it. Thus, Mrs. Soth Y. decided to request a loan to buy a water pump to support her field to increase her crop yield.

Mrs. Soth Y. is a widow with a child who is a farmer too.

loans.use: To buy a water pump to irrigate her field

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina C., 50, is making sure that her family has enough provision for their daily needs. Married to Erwin C., a jeepney barker, they are blessed with five children. She helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been managing her own buy and sell business for two years now.

Marina has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow four times in CCT’s Cooperative. She has been consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her buy and sell business.

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a loan of PHP 9,000. This amount will be used as added capital for expanding her business by buying more things that she can sell, like cooking pots and pans, electrical appliances and other home utilities.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can establish her own commercial stall and finish her children's schooling so they may have a peaceful and comfortable life someday.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy products for sale, such as cooking pots and pans, electrical appliances, etc.

loans.name: Nkechi

texts.en:
Nkechi is 28 years old, married, and has 3 children. She speaks Ibo and English languages fluently. She owns a palm oil mill where she mills and sells palm oil to her customers in Benin City. She buys palm oil fruit from farmers. Palm oil is derived from palm fruit. This business is very lucrative, as palm oil is used to prepare most local delicacies in Nigeria. She has been in the business for 2 years now. With the profit from the business, she could assist her husband, who is a commercial driver, in providing for her family's needs, like food and clothing, etc.

Nkechi hopes to improve and expand her business. She hopes for a loan in the amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more palm oil fruit to mill and to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more palm fruit to mill and to sell

loans.name: Pigy Lestari Group

texts.en: Ni Komang R. (0) is a 46-year-old female living in the town of Melaya, Bali. She is the group leader of a ten-member group loan offered by MUK. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Pigy Lestari (MUK-0013). Ni Komang is married and has three adult children. She owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over ten years and earns approximately 100,000 IDR a month. In 2009, Ni Komang joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from MUK. Ni Komang is now requesting a new loan of 1,000,000 IDR which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. The loan will be her 2nd from MUK. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. About MUK: The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives. ***************************************************** NI KOMANG R. (0) merupakan 46 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota MELAYA - BALI. NI KOMANG adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 10 anggota. Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar. Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah PIGY LESTARI (MUK-0013). Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. NI KOMANG sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 10 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, NI KOMANG menghasilkan sekitar 100,000 IDR. Dalam 2009, NI KOMANG bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. NI KOMANG telah berhasil melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya dari MUK. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1,000,000 IDR. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 2nd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK. Tentang MUK: Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Gorrett

texts.en:
Gorrett is a 31-year-old single mother of three children, ages 12, 9 and 8 years. She looks after her four-person family. She hopes to educate her children and to finish her residential house. 

She operates a bar in Hoima Town, Uganda and has been in the business for four years. She was once a house maid, then worked in a restaurant and milk shop, after which she started her own bar business with the small capital from the savings she had accumulated. She hopes to improve the standards of her bar so as to attract more customers. 

The purpose of the loan is to construct a chicken house for a poultry business so she can diversify her sources of income.

loans.use: To build a chicken house for a poultry business.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Mrs. Pov N. is a villager in Krang Roluos village in Kandal province. She was born in 1950.  She and her husband, Mr. Soeurn Sok, are farmers who own 3-hectares of land to cultivate rice which they sell to support the family.  They try to work hard but still earn insufficient income. Therefore, Mrs. Pov N. is asking for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. 

Mrs. Pov N. is the mother of four children.  Two children are seamstresses in a garment factory, another is a dentist and another is studying in local public school. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Maxiama

texts.en:
Maxiama B. is from the village of Agunod, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 62 years old, married, and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Maxiama owns and operates a retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as diapers, sugar, coffee, milk, sugar, noodles, shampoo, soap, toothpaste etc. in the local community. Maxiama has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Maxiama joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nih

texts.en:
Nih P. is married and he is the father of three children. He lives in Wumngang-Mbengwi, Momo Division, in the northwest region of Cameroon. As a very hard-working man, he has faced some major challenges in life, such as being unable to meet the educational needs of his children, ill health, and death of close relatives. In 2004, he saw GHAPE as a source of relief. He has received loans from GHAPE four times and his previous repayments were satisfactory. His community is privileged to have someone like him. Most of them are learn from him how to keep fish and good pigs.

With the loan he is requesting now, he plans to invest in his pig and fish businesses. With the profit from the loan, he will pay for his children's educations, clothe them, and give them good food and good medication whenever they are sick.
	
He prefers to receive loans from GHAPE, rather than other financial institutions, because of the training GHAPE offers and because proper follow-up is done to ensure that the loan is properly managed.


About GHAPE
The Grounded and Holistic Approach for People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement

loans.use: To buy better piglets and a variety of fish

loans.name: Slyvia

texts.en: Slyvia M. N. is 32 years old.  She runs Mama Cikui retail shop in Kiambu.  She sells foodstuffs and cooking gas in her shop. Slyvia started this business in 2004.  She joined the Ikinyana Mbere group of entrepreneurs to save  money.  She can get a loan from Faulu Kenya through the group.  Slyvia uses her weekly savings with the group to invest in her business.  She is requesting for a loan of Kes. 50, 000 to add stock of maize flour, rice and cooking gas.  She hopes to become financially stable in the future.

loans.use: To buy maize flour, rice and cooking gas

loans.name: Adiyisem Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Petty trading like the sale of groceries is widespread in Ghana because it is easy to start up the business. It usually begins with table-top selling and then grows to become a kiosk and eventually becomes a supermarket. Isheitu is one of such entrepreneurs; she has been trading in groceries like biscuits, bottled water, candies, canned foods, rice, cooking oil, toiletries, etc. for the past 6 years. She is hoping that, one day, she will be able to rent a bigger shop to expand her business. 

Isheitu is excited to be taking the loan which she plans to invest in purchasing groceries in bulk to serve her customers. She anticipates increasing her profit level and also expanding her market. 

Isheitu is married to a farmer and they have two children, ages 7 and 13. She describes herself as an excellent group leader of 'Adiyisem' Borrower Group, made up of 6 members. As the leader of the group, she ensures regular meeting attendance and repayment of loan installments.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk

loans.name: Sodji

texts.fr: E. exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale, il fait  ce commerce depuis 5 ans  déjà et s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé, il souhaite gonfler son stock raison pour laquelle il sollicite de WAGES un crédit  pour s’approvisionner et augmenter son stock. Il est marié et a 2 personnes à sa charge.
texts.en:
To earn his living, E. has been selling groceries for five years. He buys his stock in the big market in Lome. He wants to build her stock, and that is why he is asking for a loan from WAGES. He is married with two dependents.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy grocery products

loans.name: Clara Elizabeth

texts.es:
Clara Elizabeth V. A. tiene 26 años. Es casada y vive con su esposo y 3 hijos de 1, 3 y 7 años, en el cantón de Ventanas, en la provincia de Los Ríos. 

Clara es una socia de la ventanilla rural Recinto San Ramón, que esta ubicada en Nuevo San Ramón, a 12 Km. de Ventanas. Son 20 socios en total, que están trabajando en la agricultura de corto ciclo (cosecha en 6 meses). Esto es el primer crédito que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa.

Clara se dedica a la agricultura, cultivando maíz y arroz. Hace sus ventas en Ventanas, cada 6 meses para maíz y arroz.

Solicita el préstamo para trabajar maíz y arroz: comprar fertilizantes, semillas, y abonos. Piensa que este crédito le ayudara a sembrar por los ciclos cortos y porque sale más económico que las otras opciones de crédito que tienen. Su sueño es ayudar a sus hijos en los estudios.

Le gusta escuchar música en su tiempo libre.
texts.en:
Clara Elizabeth V. A. is 26 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and three children, ages 1, 3, and 7, in the Ventanas hamlet, located in the Los Ríos province. Clara is part of the “La Ventanilla Rural Recinto San Ramón,” which is located in Nuevo San Ramón, 12 kilometers from Ventanas. There are a total of 20 members who work in short cycle farming (harvest within six months of planting). This will be the first loan they obtain through the cooperative. Clara raises corn and rice and makes her sales of rice and corn in Ventanas every six months. She is asking for this loan in order to buy seeds, and fertilizer. She believes that this loan will help her to be able to plant in the short cycles and that it is more feasible than other methods of finance that she has available to her. She wants to be able to help her children with their education. She likes listening to music in her spare time.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy corn and white wheat.

loans.name: Benso 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe Benso 1 sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans et en moyenne  3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Maban, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités  hivernales. 
Les spéculations cultivées sont le petit mil, l’arachide et le haricot. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne et tous les deux prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, WASSA T. compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de main d’œuvre pour entretenir environs 1,5 hectare de petit mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Dioïla après les récoltes à une clientèle composée de revendeurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 75.000FCFA environ en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benso 1 group are married women on average 39 years old with three children. Most live in polygamous families in Maban, one of the villages belonging to the Dioïla Prefecture in the Koulokoro region, part of the 2nd administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso MFI to better organise their winter activities. Their cash crops are millet, peanuts and beans. This is their third farming loan and the two preceding ones have been duly repaid. With this new loan Wassa T. intends to buy seeds and fertilizer, small farming equipment and pay laborers to cultivate approximately 1.5 hectares (3.7 acres) of millet and peanuts. After harvesting the crops are sold in Dioïla to mainly retail merchants. She hopes to reach average earnings of 75,000 FCFA by the end of the farming season.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Seeds and fertilizer, labor costs and small farming equipment.

loans.name: Aquila

texts.en:
Aquila W. is from the village of Bago. She is 52 years old, married and has five children. To make a living, Aquila owns and operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Aquila has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 5,300 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Aquila joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Aquila is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be her third from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Shodigul

texts.ru: Каримова Шодигул проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 27 лет. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Образование среднее. Вместе с мужем занимается животноводством. Разводит скот у себя дома. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 4 года. Кредит берет для закупа крупно - рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Shodigul K. lives in the city of Kulob. She is 27 years old, married and has 3 children. She has a secondary education. Together with her husband, she is involved in animal husbandry and breeds livestock at home. Shodigul has been involved in this business for 4 years. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of cattle.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Pagamjav

texts.en:
Pagamjav V. is 39 years old and lives with her husband and five children in Harhorin, the ancient capital city of Mongolian Empire, in Uvurhangai province in central Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Her oldest daughter attends university and her two daughters and two sons all attend a local school. Her husband operates a ger's wood making business and also he drives a taxi between neighboring sub provinces to supplement his family's income. 

Pagamjav and her husband have been producing framing for ger's, according to customers' orders, since 1991 and they started to operate a used clothing trading business in their town as well. Over the years, the couple has gained much experience and have built a stable operation. Moreover, they made a motorized land drilling machine and rents it to people daily at 50,000 MNT. 

For the future, Pagamjav hopes to grow her businesses further and says, "We are working hard to provide for our children's education." She is requesting a 1,700,000 MNT loan to purchase winter clothes for her second hand clothing sales business as well as to make some exterior construction on her house.

loans.use: To purchase winter clothes

loans.name: Blanca Beatriz

texts.es:
Blanca vende y comprar productos Avon (empresa que ofrece a mujeres emprendedoras comenzar con sus ventas independientes), vive en Paraíso de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y las casas están ubicadas en montañas). 

Ella trabajaba en una casa pero le pagaban muy poco para poder mantener a sus hijos ya que es madre soltera. Para conseguir mas ingresos decidió invertir en productos de uso personas de Avon y empezar a vender a sus conocidos y amigos. Desde ese tiempo trabaja vendiendo productos como perfumes, cremas, desodorantes, maquillaje, etc. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar perfumes para poder incrementar su negocio . En el futuro quiere tener una cartera de clientes fija.
texts.en:
Blanca buys and sells Avon products (a business that offers enterprising women the chance to start their own independent sales).  She lives in Paraíso de Guayaquil (a semi-urban area, with dirt roads and houses located in the mountains).  

She used to work in a house, but was paid too little to support her children, as she is a single mother.  To earn more income, she decided to invest in Avon products and began to sell to her acquaintances and friends.  From that time she has sold products such as perfumes, creams, deodorants, makeup, etc.  

With the loan she would like to buy perfumes to grow her business.  In the future, she would like to have a chart of regular clients.

loans.use: To buy perfume for resale

loans.name: Rosa Elva

texts.es:
Rosa, reside en San Rafael Oriente departamento de San Miguel, tiene 46 años de edad, ella vive con su madre, una hermana, sus dos hijos un hijastro y su esposo; se dedica a la venta de medicinas ofreciéndola de forma ambulante por los alrededores del lugar, no tiene un horario fijo, y actualmente está en la necesidad de invertir al negocio pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario, por lo solicita un préstamo que le solvente esta situación que atraviesa por el momento.
Su propósito es abastecer de más medicinas para tener mayor oportunidad de vender ya que si ofrecer diferentes clases de medicina podrá atender las necesidades a sus clientes.
Quiere que sus clientes se sientan satisfechos y proveerles de las medicinas que necesitan para sus enfermedades, ayudándoles de esta manera para que gocen de salud; también sus propósitos son ser mejor madre cada día y cubrir con las necesidades del hogar.
texts.en:
Rosa lives in San Rafael Oriente in the Department of San Miguel. She is 46 years old and lives with her mother, a sister, her two children, her husband, and a stepson. Rosa sells medicines as a street vendor in the surrounding neighborhoods. She does not work on a fixed schedule and currently needs to invest in her business but does not have the necessary funds. For this reason, she is requesting a loan so that she can resolve her present situation.

Her goal is to be stocked with more medicines so that she will have more opportunities to sell and be able to offer different types of remedies that can meet the needs of her customers. She wants to satisfy her customers and provide them with the medicines they need for their illnesses, thereby helping them experience good health. In addition, she strives to be a better mother each day and provide for the household needs.

loans.use: Purchase medicines to sell

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es:
la señora Concepcion Y. U. es soltera y vive en la ciudad de Nacaome, Concepcion se dedica al comercio 
y tiene una bodega de abarroteria y granos basicos en el interior del mercado de Nacaome. Concepcion vive en la colonia Rotaria.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mercaderia y granos basicos para surtir su negocio ya que se acerca la epoca de navidad y quiere ver su negocio fuerte y surtido para cubrir con todas las exigencias de sus clientes.
la señora Concepcion necesita comprar arroz, maiz, frijoles, refrescos, aceites, manteca, margarina, papel higienico entre otros productos de mayor venta en su negocio.
 
Concepcion es una mujer luchadora y con grandes pricipios morales y eticos, es capaz de lograr lo que se propone.
texts.en: Concepcion Y. U. is single and lives in the city of Nacaome.  She is a merchant who has a store in the Nacaome market where she sells groceries and staple grains.  Concepcion lives in the Rotaria neighborhood.  She will use this loan to buy merchandise and staple grains to restock her business, since the Christmas season is approaching and she wants to see her business strong and well-stocked so that she can meet all the needs of her customers.  Concepcion needs to buy rice, corn, beans, soft drinks, cooking oil, butter, margarine, toilet paper, and other products at wholesale to sell in her store.  Concepcion is a tenacious woman who has great moral and ethical principles, and she is capable of achieving what she proposes.

loans.use: to buy butter, cooking oil, soups, cereal, soaps, toilet paper, soft drinks, margarine, beans, corn, rice, sugar and coffee.

loans.name: Scovia

texts.en:
Scovia N. is 16 years old and lives in the town of Njeru in the Jinja region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children.  Scovia has a  retail shop, which she has had for one year.  She sells clothes.  

To help expand her business, Scovia has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase  clothes.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Scovia hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees.  In the future, Scovia hopes to become a teacher.   Scovia is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to sing and dance.

loans.use: To purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA LUZ DEL MAÑANA NRO II”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ofelia; ella tiene 29 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda bazar de regalos, ella vende diferentes tipos de regalos como peluches, juguetes y adornos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7.00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de regalos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería para el bazar de regalos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Ofelia is a member of the 'NUEVA LUZ DEL MAÑANA NRO II' (New Light of Tomorrow Number II) community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Ofelia is 29 years old.  She is married and has two children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her gift store business.  She sells different types of gifts such as cuddly toys, toys and decorations.  She works from 8.00am to 7.00pm and would like to expand her business.  She is requesting this loan so that she can buy more merchandise for her gift store.

Ofelia is happy to be receiving this loan and she pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her gift store

loans.name: Tasi

texts.en:
Tasi R. is 56 and married with six children between 15 and 28. She owns a business planting and harvesting taro for sale and has four years of experience. Tasi needs a loan of WST$3900 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the earnings from her business —estimated to be 800 talas or US $350 per week — to improve and expand the business.

Tasi joined SPBD in 2006 and this is her seventh loan. SPBD's loans are Tasi's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 29 years old and lives with one of his family members.

In 2009, Ahmad opened a small food market since he has a good experience in this field. Now he is well know in his local area and has a good reputation.

He is requesting $1,800 to renovate his shop. He is planning to extend his business and increase his revenues.

loans.use: To renovate his shop

loans.name: Garyahandere

texts.en: Garyahandere Y. is an individual client from Rukungiri. He has a retail shop in Bwambara Trading Centre that has been in existence for over seven years. He operates his shop with the help of his wife, and most of their customers are people in their locality. On average, he is able to make monthly profits amounting to 220,000 UGX, although he has other sources of income, like the sale of coffee, maize, and other cereals. He is trustworthy, and his dream is to expand his businesses fully.

loans.use: Restocking his business with more goods and general merchandise.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby is a married woman who lives in Talisay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures:  a general store, an electronic shop and a mineral water sales business. Her husband Marino, who is 60 years old, works as a technician to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have four children who are between 26 and 32 years old. Ruby joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 28 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Ruby has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,400, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 29th loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,500, which she intends to use to buy items for her store and mineral water so that she can continue to save up for the future expansion of her business. Ruby is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Nkonge

texts.en:
Nkonge J. is an individual client from Mubende.  He is 40 years old and married with 6 children.  J. has a produce selling business where he buys and sells beans and maize.  He also has a store out of his home from which he sells as a wholesaler.  He is able to make 200,000 UGX in weekly profits and these help in in his other business ventures. 

He also has a milling machine and he is a farmer, providing some of the produce that he sells, as well as being a driver.  He has been in the business for 10 years and he needs a loan to be able purchase more stock.  He started the business using some capital that he had from driving and farming and his hard work has made him successful.  His dream is to be able to expand his business as well as educating his children.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for more profitability.

loans.name: Sylvia Raquel

texts.es:
Sylvia tiene 40 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos de 10 y 12 años de edad. Viven en el distrito de La Victoria, a unos treinta minutos de Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque. 

Desde hace más de 8 años, cuenta con un negocio en el Mercado Modelo donde alquila acrílicos y vende artículos de piñatería y decoración. Ella elabora ella misma parte de la arte en su mercadería. Tiene un puesto fijo en el mercado adjudicado por la municipalidad. Ha solicitado un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles para invertir en la compra de más mercadería y materiales para elaborar su arte. También, desea utilizar una parte de su crédito para gastos escolares para sus dos hijos menores. Edpyme Alternativa le ofrece el crédito a una tasa más baja que otras entidades y prestamistas informales. Con el préstamo, puede continuar a invertir en su negocio y solventar sus gastos familiares sin perjudicar su liquidez diaria. Por ello, Sylvia les agradece mucho a los prestamistas de Kiva por su apoyo.
texts.en:
Sylvia is 40 years old, married, and has two children (ages 10 and 12). They live in the District of La Victoria, which is thirty minutes away from Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

For more than eight years, Sylvia has managed a business at the Modelo Market where she rents out acrylic stands and pedestals and sells decorations and supplies for making piñatas. She also produces some of these artistic decorations as part of her merchandise. Sylvia has an established location at the market that was awarded to her by the city. She is requesting a loan of 1000 PEN to invest in the purchase of more merchandise and materials for making her crafts. In addition, part of the loan will be used to pay the school expenses of her two young children.

Edpyme Alternativa offers this loan at a much lower rate than other institutions and informal lenders. With this loan, Sylvia will be able to continue investing in her business and cover her family’s expenses without jeopardizing her daily liquidity. For this reason, she is extremely grateful for the loans supported by Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise and materials for making decorations.

loans.name: Gladiz

texts.es:
Gladiz, de 25 años, es una mujer muy humilde y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su querida hija Gisela de 10 años y esta dispuesta a trabajar muy duro con tal de brindarle una mejor calidad de vida.

Con mucho esfuerzo Gladiz a logrado trabajar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas, ella cultiva plátano, cacao, café y palta, las cuales luego lleva a vender hasta el mercado de la ciudad de Pichanaki, donde las vende al por mayor. Sus cultivos le han dado los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia, es por eso que desea poner todas sus ganas en sacar adelante este negocio.

Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, lleva 6 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta Tarma, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. Para más adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras, para incrementar su producción.

Este es el primer préstamo de Gladiz con MFP, espera ser muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. En su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa y siempre esta al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en su grupo.

Con los quienientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono para sus tierras.
texts.en:
Gladiz, 25 years of age, is a very humble and hard-working woman.  She lives in her own house, along with her beloved daughter Gisela, who is 10 years old.  She is prepared to work diligently in order to provide a higher standard of living for her daughter.

With great effort, Gladiz has managed to work her farmland and made it very productive.  She grows bananas, cacao, coffee and avocado.  She takes her products to the market in the city of Pichanaki, where she sells them at wholesale.  Her crops have provided her with the necessary income to support her family, which is why she has a great desire to take steps to help her business get ahead.

What she enjoys most about her enterprise is caring for her crops.  She has been in business for 6 years, and considers the most difficult aspect of her work to be transporting her products to Tarma.  The sacks she moves are heavy and make her very tired.  In the future, she would like to buy additional land in order to increase her production.  

This is Gladiz’s first loan with MFP, and she hopes to be very punctual in the payment of her installments.  She participates actively in her cooperative bank, and goes along with the agreements reached by the group.

She will use the five hundred soles requested to buy fertilizer for her land.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her crops.

loans.name: Loise

texts.en: Loise is 41 years old and a single mother. She runs a mobile phone money transfer business. She also sells beverages in the same business premise. She has been in this business for 2 years. In addition, she does farming. She believes that through Faulu Kenya she will open other branches of her business in the future. She has requested 20,000 KES to buy mobile phone credit cards and add capital in her mobile phone money transfer business.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone credit cards and add capital in her mobile phone money transfer business

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es:
Jessica forma parte del banco comunal “Pocuro” perteneciente a la ciudad de Coronel.
Ella tiene un almacén en el cual vende provisiones, artículos de librería, servicio de teléfonos y venta de frutas. Jessica se dedica a éste rubro desde hace un año, además su horario laboral es de lunes a domingo y su almacén está ubicado en su misma casa.
Su mercadería la compra generalmente en distribuidoras, supermercados mayoristas y a los proveedores de productos.
Con éste préstamo comprará mercadería para abastecer su almacén.
Sus metas son abrir un local para vender frutas y verduras, además de abastecer completamente su actual negocio con diferentes productos. Respecto a sus sueños a nivel personal, son que sus hijos disfruten de un buen estado de salud. 
Jessica vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 8 y 26 años de edad. 
Ella está muy agradecida del crédito otorgado por Fondo Esperanza, ya que con éste podrá invertir en su negocio y generar mayores ganancias. Además participa de los talleres de ventas que se realizan en las reuniones, conocimientos que ha podido aplicar en su negocio. Respecto a las reuniones con los demás socios, Jessica se siente muy a gusto, ya que éstas son muy gratas y se ha generado una mayor comunicación y solidaridad entre los integrantes del banco comunal. 
Coronel es una comuna ubicada al sur de Chile, cerca de la ciudad de Concepción, región del Bíobío. Posee una economía basada en servicios, explotación forestal, agricultura. Cuenta también con una importante tradición minera en carbón, actividad que ya no se realiza, pero de la cual quedó la mina de carbón “Chiflón Puchoco”, convertida ahora en museo minero.
texts.en:
Jessica is part of the "Pocuro" communal bank in the city of Coronel. She has a store where she sells groceries, stationery items, telephone service, and fruit. Jessica has been working in this business for a year. Her work schedule is from Monday to Sunday and the store is located in her house.

She generally buys her merchandise from distributors, wholesale supermarkets and the product providers. She will use this loan to buy merchandise to stock her store.

Her goals are to open a place to sell fruits and vegetables, as well as to fully stock her current business with different products. On a personal level, her dream is that her children will enjoy a good quality of life.

Jessica lives together with her husband and their two children, ages 8 and 26 years old.

She is very grateful for the loan offered through Fondo Esperanza, since with this she will be able to invest in her business and generate better income. She also participates in the sales workshops that take place at their meetings, where she has learned things she has applied to her business. Regarding the meetings with the rest of the group members, Jessica feels very pleased because they are enjoyable and have created better communication and solidarity between the members of the communal bank.

Coronel is a community located near the city of Concepción in southern Chile, in Bíobío region. It has an economy based in services, forestry, and agriculture. It also has an important history of carbon mining, though that activity no longer happens there. However, the "Chiflón Puchoco" carbon mine remains and has now been converted into a mining museum.

loans.use: to stock her store with merchandise

loans.name: Duo Eva Group

texts.es: Duo Eva: este Grupo esta Formado por dos señoras, Ana leticia D. 23 años D. edad es dueña D. una tortilleria el su comunidad donD. vive desD. hace mas D. 3 años ella nos cuenta que nececita este credito para la compra D. maiz y leña para continuar con su negocio. tambien eta doña Rosa Maria,D. 42 años D. edad y se dedica a la crianza D. animales en su comunidad donD. vive ella nos cuenta que nececita este credito para la compa D. pollos para la venta ya que por este tiempo los compra mas barato ella nos cuenta que tambien quere comprar gallinas D. granja para poder vender huevos y asi obtener mas ganacias y apoyar a sus hijos que estan estudiando ya sque nececitan muchas cosas y pasajes todos los dias para ir a la escuela su sueño es que sus hijos puedan ser buenos profecionales para tener mejores oportunidades en un futuro.
texts.en: Duo Eva: this group is maD. up of two women:One is Ana Leticia, 23, who owns a tortilla store in the town where she has lived for the last 3 years.  She tells us that she needs the loan to buy corn and firewood so she can continue with her business.  The other is Maria, 42, who raises animals in the village where she lives and she tells us that she needs the loan to buy chickens to sell since it is the period when they are cheaper.  She also says that she wants to purchase laying hens so the she can sell eggs and earn more and support her children who are in school.  The children need many things as well as transportation fare every day to go to school.  Her dream is that they can become successful professionals to have better opportunities in the future.

loans.use: To buy corn and firewood for a tortilla shop and to buy chickens to sell

loans.name: Jose Elmer

texts.es:
Jose tiene 34 años de edad esta casado y vive con sus dos hijos en una comunidad pequeña y rural ubicada a 15 minutos del distrito de Mórrope en Lambayeque. Esta es una comunidad cuya actividad principal es la agricultura y ganadería.

Jose se dedica desde hace 5 años a la crianza y venta de animales, actualmente cuenta con un ganado ovino y caprino. Jose cría sus animales en la parte exterior de su domicilio y quincenalmente los negocia en Chiclayo y Lambayeque. Adicionalmente José se dedica a la agricultura.

Jose solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles que destinará en la compra de alimento balanceado para sus animales  y en sus labores agrícolas. Esto le permitirá a José crecer en su actividad y por lo tanto tener mayores ingresos para brindarle comodidades a su familia.
texts.en:
Jose tiene 34 años de edad esta casado y vive con sus dos hijos en una comunidad pequeña y rural ubicada a 15 minutos del distrito de Mórrope en Lambayeque. Esta es una comunidad cuya actividad principal es la agricultura y ganadería.

Jose se dedica desde hace 5 años a la crianza y venta de animales, actualmente cuenta con un ganado ovino y caprino. Jose cría sus animales en la parte exterior de su domicilio y quincenalmente los negocia en Chiclayo y Lambayeque. Adicionalmente José se dedica a la agricultura.

Jose solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles que destinará en la compra de alimento balanceado para sus animales  y en sus labores agrícolas. Esto le permitirá a José crecer en su actividad y por lo tanto tener mayores ingresos para brindarle comodidades a su familia.

loans.use: Comprar alimento balnaceado e invertir en agricultura.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. She has a shop that sells a variety of fish. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more fish to sell.

Elvira has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Elvira hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Zuurakan's Group

texts.en: Zuurakan, 51, is a leader of this group. She is a widow and has three grown kids. She pursued a profession of a dentist after studying several years in medical school. She works shorter hours due to her age, so she has time for watching the household. Zuurakan owns several heads of livestock, which keeps her busy. All of her colleagues are sure in the success of Zuurakan, because she is brave to take risks and eager to work hard and face challenges. Zuurakan addresses Kiva lenders for receiving a loan in order to purchase additional heads of livestock and broaden the business. She thanks the lenders for assistance because it helps her financially and in staying confident about the future of her business. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel Angel tiene 25 años, Es soltero vive con la madre tiene un hijo pero no vive con el, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. EL PROGRESO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías de Mocache, perteneciente al Cantón Mocache, esta ventanilla se dedica a laborea de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz

Miguel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz . Compra sus productos en Comercial Peña y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes .   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueño es comprar terrenos para cultivar.

Le gusta dormir .
texts.en:
Miguel Angel, 25, is single and lives with his mother in the Ventanas Canton in the province of Los Ríos.  He has a son who does not live with him.

The communal bank V.R.C. EL PROGRESO is located in the Aguas Frías de Mocache community, which belongs to the Mocache Canton.  This group is involved in short-cycle corn and rice crop growing.

Miguel grows corn and rice, and buys what he needs in Comercial Pena and sells his produce at the wholesale market in Ventanas.

He is requesting a loan to buy supplies and fertilizer to begin planting.  This will help him economically to purchase what he needs.  His goal for the future is to buy crop land.

He enjoys sleeping.

loans.use: To buy supplies and fertilizer.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita de cincuenta y seis años de edad vive con su madre y su hijo en casa propia. Ella posee una tortillería en su residencia, ya tiene muchos años con el negocio y se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues tiene un excelente servicio, es muy amable con las personas que la visitan siempre tiene una sonrisa en el rostro para ellos, además tiene gran agilidad para la elaboración de las mismas y atiende a los clientes en poco tiempo. Margarita es muy dedicada en su trabajo para ella las batallas más importantes de la vida son las que peleamos diariamente para alcanzar nuestros sueños y ella está dispuesta a esforzarse por su objetivo es por eso que le solicita a ITNEGRAL  un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor para seguir produciendo. Margarita tiene la esperanza que de esta forma le dará a su familia una seguridad económica en el hogar.
texts.en:
Margarita is 56 years old and lives in her own home with her mother and her son. She has a tortilla shop in her home and has been in business for many years. Margarita has many customers since she provides excellent service. She is friendly to everyone who visits her and always has a smile on her face. Margarita possesses great agility since she is able to make tortillas and attend to her customers in a short amount of time. She is very dedicated to her work since the most important battles of life are fought on a daily basis in order to achieve one’s dreams. For this reason, she is willing to work toward that goal.

Margarita is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral so that she can buy corn in bulk and continue her production. She has hopes of providing her family with financial security.

loans.use: to purchase corn in bulk.

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
This is Lucena, 53, a resident of GMA, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Manolito, a "tricycle" driver, and mother to their two children. By the grace of God, Lucena has managed to support her children's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Lucena has a ginseng farm in Cavite  were she grows and sells ginseng products. She also have one "tricycle" unit that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. Her regular customers in her business are neighbors and the local community. Lucena earns a minimum of Php800 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan for farm inputs like fertilizer and also for the maintenance of their tricycle. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Lucena dreams of being able to have a wide market for her products. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for farm inputs and for spare parts and maintenance of her "tricycle".

loans.name: Muzaffar

texts.ru: Музаффар житель Яванского района. Ему 35 лет. Женат. Имеет 4 детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам он занимается животноводством. Он в основном откармливает и продает скот. Этим видом деятельности занимается восемь лет. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Muzaffar lives in the Yavan region.  He's thirty-five, married, and has four children.  His wife is a homemaker.  He makes a living raising livestock, mainly cattle, for sale.  He's been in the field for eight years.  He plans to use his loan to buy long-horned cattle.

loans.use: to buy long-horned cattle.

loans.name: Saikou

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un fleuriste qui a aménagé son jardin au bord de la route qui mène vers une grande station balnéaire. Il fait des plants de divers fleurs et d'arbres fruitiers qu'il vend à une clientèle composée en majorité d'européens.Il a démarré cette activité après avoir arrété il y'a dix ans ses études au collège.Il est marié et père de 3 enfants.Il sollicite un pret de 200000F pour acheter 80 sachets de plastique et des plants d'arbres fruitiers.Son ambition est d'acheter un terrain et d'y construire sa maison.
texts.en: The loan seeker is a florist who has constructed a garden on the roadside near a large seaside port. He grows flowering plants and fruit-bearing trees that he sells to a customer base mainly consisting of Europeans. He entered this trade 10 years ago after finishing his college studies. He is married and has three children. He is seeking a 200,000F loan in order to purchase 80 plastic bags and fruit-bearing plantlings. His goal is to purchase some land on which to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase 80 plastic bags and fruit-bearing plantlings

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with three children. 

Merly has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, beverages, noodles, and breads. She has had this business for 17 years. She requested a loan for 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Merly has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Merly hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Zacarias

texts.en: Zacarias is 52 years old and married. He earns a living through farming. Zacarias tills land located in Trinidad, Bohol. He primarily grows rice crops to sell. Zacarias has requested this loan to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and other farm inputs. He hopes to continue supporting his family through his business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 38 years old and single. He has been active in farming in his hometown of Litein for the last eight years. His farm produces milk and tea which go to the local market. He also runs a motorcycle transport business (on which he is pictured above).

Charles has requested a loan of 60,320 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He anticipates more growth in his farming business with the availability of the loan to purchase a dairy cow to add in his farm. He says the additional income will improve his standards of living as well as spread his business risks by getting income both from dairy and transport.

He sees challenges in sourcing funds, but is glad Juhudi Kilimo is mitigating the limitation.

loans.use: purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Boaz

texts.en: Boaz is a married man.  He describes himself as a focused business man. For the last two years, he has been selling shoes to make a living. He is also employed as a caretaker. He has employed one person to help him manage the business.  In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business.  Boaz dreams of managing a boutique in the future.  He is requesting for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy shoes for resale.

loans.use: buy shoes to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more timber.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is a married woman having three children. Maribel is 32 years old, residing at Calamba, Misamis Occidental: Philippines. 

Maribel owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products including soft drinks, soaps, and many other items to earn a living and she's been in this business for four years. Each month, she earns 3,600 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase products to resell. Maribel has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Maribel wants to expand/improve her business and to finish the education of her children.

loans.use: To purchase products to resell.

loans.name: Roxana Elizabeth

texts.es:
La Sra. Roxana Elizabeth pertenece al Banco Comunal “Amor y Paz”,  del Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia Moyobamba y Departamento de San Martín. Tiene 28 años, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijas, de 8 y 10 años en edad escolar.
Desde joven trabajaba como vendedora de prendas de vestir debido  a sus necesidades económicas. Por iniciativa propia decide  trabajar en la venta de verduras y frutas en el mercado Modelo de su localidad.  Inició su negocio con un capital de S/.200.00 nuevos soles. Actualmente ella continúa vendiendo verduras y frutas contando con una buena clientela gracias a su carisma y el buen trato que les brinda.
Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, comprará variedad de verduras y frutas, como sacos de papas, cebolla, tomates, sacos de repollo, naranjas, plátanos en racimos, y otros  para implementar su negocio  y así conseguir nuevos clientes y sobretodo cubrir la necesidad de su clientela.
Roxana es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora,  anhela progresar e incrementar  su negocio con nuevos productos y más adelante incursionar en la venta de prendas de vestir, está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindar la oportunidad a mujeres como ella y así poder hacer realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Roxana Elizabeth belongs to the “Amor y Paz” communal bank in the Moyobamba district and province, located in the San Martín department. She is 28 years old. She is a single mother and she has two school aged daughters who are eight and ten years old. 
Since she was a young woman, she has sold clothing for her economic needs. Through her own initiative, she has decided to work selling fruits and vegetables in her town’s market.  She started her business with S/.200.00 nuevos soles of working capital. Now she is continuing to sell fruits and vegetables and she has a good customer base thanks to her charisma and the good customer service offered to her customers.
With this loan of S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, she will purchase a variety of fruits and vegetables like bags of potatoes, onions, tomatoes, cabbage, oranges, bunches of bananas and other produce to set up her business and to obtain new customers. More than anything, it will meet the needs of the customers. 
Roxana is a hard-working and enterprising woman. She longs for progress and to expand her business with new products. In the future, she wants to enter into clothing sales. She is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for providing opportunities for women like her to make their dreams come true.

loans.use: purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Tet Trankil De Saillant 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.fr:
Marc est le coordinateur de son groupe tet trankil.  Il est pas marié il a 5 enfants. Marc habite dans la ville de trou du nord d’Haiti où de l’éléctricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée.

Marc a dirigé son business pendant les 2 dernières années. Il voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans l’achat du charbon.

Marc espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business.

Des autres membres de Marc ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vendre du charbon, du riz et du poisson.

Marc dit que ses buts principals sont l’augmantation du bussiness. Son rêve est l’achat d’une moto pour transporter les materiels.
texts.en:
Marc is the coordinator of the group “Tet Ttrankil”. He is the unmarried father of five children. He lives in the town of “Trou du Nord” in Haiti, where electricity is scarce and water supplies are very limited.

Marc has been selling charcoal for the past two years. He would like to use his loan to invest in the purchase of charcoal. He hopes that this credit will help him to expand his business. Other members of the group require a loan for such businesses as the sale of charcoal, rice and fish.

Marc’s main goal is to expand his business. His dream is to buy a motorcycle to transport supplies

loans.use: to buy charcoal for resale

loans.name: Jose Rigoberto

texts.es:
José, quiere incrementar el negocio, comprando mercadería para ofrecer mayor cantidad y variedad de estilos a los clientes, comprara sandalias, ropa nueva, artesanía, aprovechando la temporada que se avecina para mantener de todos los posibles demandantes de productos.
Debido a su buen manejo con el anterior préstamo, sus ganancias han sido mejores y logro pagar a tiempo el préstamo.
texts.en:
José wants to grow his business by buying merchandise to offer a larger quantity and a variety of styles to his customers.  He’ll buy sandals, new clothing, and crafts to take advantage of the coming season and be able to meet any possible demands for his products.

Because of his good management of the previous loan, his income has been better and he was able to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: to buy inventory for the upcoming season.

loans.name: Dairo

texts.es:
Dairo es un hombre de 21 años que se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte público en su moto taxi por la ciudad de Ica, reconocida actualmente en el país como una de las principales ciudades en las que se pueden realizar inversiones, esto se ha logrado gracias al ingreso de nuevos centros comerciales de distintas partes del país, a su vez estas grandes empresas han permitido que muchas más personas tengan oportunidades de empleo, así mismo también se ha beneficiado a comerciantes ajenos a estos grandes centros comerciales, entre uno de esos casos se encuentra la historia del señor Dairo, que gracias al incremento de la afluencia de público y la gran necesidad que tienen de transportarse le han permitido tener mayores ingresos con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación.

Dario es un joven al que le gusta mucho jugar futbol en sus tiempos libres, lo que le permite pasar momentos agradables con sus amigos. Él trabaja en promedio 8 horas al día y esto le permite tener un ingreso de S/.45 al día, debe tomarse en cuenta que el pago por viaje en este transporte equivale entre S/.1 a S/.1.50 dependiendo de la distancia que se deba recorrer. Él piensa que su negocio tiene éxito porque empieza a trabajar desde temprano y le pone mucho empeño.

Su madre lo incentivo para que incursionara en este negocio y pueda obtener sus propios ingresos. Con ayuda de los prestatarios Kiva, Dairo podrá pagar las últimas cuotas de la moto taxi con la que trabaja. Esta ayuda le permitirá que en algunos meses gracias a su empeño y desde luego al apoyo de los prestatarios Kiva, él pueda comprarse otra moto taxi y también poder trabajarla. Su gran sueño es poder terminar de estudiar su carrera y tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
Dairo is a 21-year-old man who provides a public transport service in his motorcycle taxi.  He works in the city of Ica, which is currently known as one of the main cities in the country in which to invest.  This has been achieved thanks to the opening of new shopping malls with retailers from different parts of the country.  These big companies have given work opportunities to many more people.
