But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase spring fabrics

loans.name: I Wayan Buda

texts.en:
I Wayan Buda is a 66 year-old man living in the town of Ds. Tuwed, Melaya.  He is married and has 9 adult children.  To make a living, I Wayan Buda owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting fruits & vegetables for sale.  I Wayan Buda has been engaged in this business for over 7 years and earns approximately 500,000 - 600,000 IDR a month from these activities.


In 2007, I Wayan Buda joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,500,000 IDR from DINARI.  This previous loan was used to purchase general farm supplies & equipment.  I Wayan Buda is now requesting a new loan of 1,500,000 IDR which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.  The loan will be the 3rd loan he has taken out from DINARI.  I Wayan Buda plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family.


About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


I Wayan Buda - (DNR.M-0645) merupakan 66 tahun pria.  Dia (laki-laki) tinggal di kota Ds. Tuwed, Melaya.  Dia (laki-laki) menikah dan memiliki 9 anak usia dewasa.  Untuk membiayai hidup, I Wayan Buda memiliki & menjalankan usaha.  Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian.  Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah membudidayakan tanaman.  Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari menanam & memanen buah & sayuran untuk dijual.  I Wayan Buda sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 7 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, I Wayan Buda menghasilkan sekitar 500,000 - 600,000 IDR sebulan.


Dalam 2007, I Wayan Buda bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  I Wayan Buda meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari DINARI.  Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membeli pasokan & peralatan pertanian/peternakan umum.  Dia (laki-laki) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1,500,000 IDR.  Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli benih, bibit, & tanaman muda tambahan untuk dipelihara.  Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 3rd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI.  I Wayan Buda berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis  untuk mendukung keuangan anggota keluarga langsung peminjam.


Tentang DINARI:

Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil.

*Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. .  Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam  Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Ets Ecomin Group

texts.fr: ETS ECOMIN est une pharmacie détenue par un groupe de personnes. Ils résidents tous à Wome, un village situé à environ 130 kilomères de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. leur ambition est de répondre aux besoins pharmaceutiques de la population et des villages environnants. Avec ce crédit ils pensent approvisionner leur magasin afin de satisfaire aux exigences de la clientèle. Ce crédit leur permettra d’augmenter leurs recettes et par conséquent améliorer leurs conditions de vie respectives.
texts.en:
ETS ECOMIN is a pharmacy run by a group of people. They all reside in Wome, a village situated 130 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. Their ambition is to respond to the pharmaceutical needs of the population and of surrounding villages. With this loan, they intend to stock their shop so as to satisfy the demands of their clientele. This loan will permit them to increase the money they earn and thus improve their respective living conditions.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: stocking their little pharmacy

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
T. Nguyễn Thị (139961939) is a 63-year-old female living in the town of Sóc Sơn. She is married and has five adult children. 

T. owns and operates a specialized retail store, primarily selling bamboo products in the local community. T. has been engaged in this business for over ten years and earns approximately 4,000,000 VND a month.

T. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in renovating her business.

T. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be her 6th loan from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Prossy's Group

texts.en:
N. Prossy is the leader of Kikoma group in Mubende. She is a hardworking and honest lady and married with six children in secondary and pre-primary schools. She also helps to care for three dependents, all in school.

Prossy is a businesslady with a salon that she has been running for ten years in Kikoma. She is able to make weekly profits of UGX 50,000 and this is attributed to her good customer care and good business skills.

Prossy has a dream of building commercial houses and making sure that all her children attain the best education possible. She needs a loan to help invest in her business so as to expand it further by buying wigs, weaves (hair extensions), hair oils and chemicals for her customers.

loans.use: To buy wigs, weaves, hair oils and chemicals for her customers

loans.name: Adelanta

texts.en:
Adelanta is a day care worker in the village of Research Minante 1 Cauayan, Isabela. She is 57 years old, already a widow, and blessed with five children. Her voluntary work as a day care teacher only gives her small honorarium from their city hall, thus for her to earn extra income, she brings biscuits and packaged juices to sell at the school. That way, the parents of her students are also assured that their children eat nutritious foods during break time.

Adelanta wants her business to become productive for her children’s future because she knows that the time will come when she will be quitting her profession, thus she is hoping that Kiva will lend her a loan amounting to PHP 15,000 as additional business capital.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Dos De Mayo Group

texts.en:
The communal bank "Dos de Mayo" (Second of May) was founded on July 13th, 2009. The bank members live in Yarinacocha, a small town next to the city of Pucallpa. This will be their first loan from Kiva partner Manuela Ramos. Ynes V. L. is the official president of "Dos de Mayo" and has a business selling soft drinks and fruit.

This communal bank has 10 members (the extra person in the photograph, second from the left in the top row, is not a member; she attended the meeting together with her daughter, who is a member). The members of "Dos de Mayo" are requesting a total loan of 2800 Nuevos Soles; each member will invest her share in her respective business. The women dedicate themselves to selling the following different items: candies, charcoal, cooked food, fruit, hot dogs and French fries, fish, soft drinks, cheese, and basic grocery goods.

The members of "Dos de Mayo" are grateful to Manuela Ramos for their loan and are pleased that the organization has confidence in them. They are dedicated to furthering their businesses and making their loan payments responsibly and on time.

loans.use: Goods for respective businesses of the communal bank members.

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es:
La señora Emiliana es socia del Banco Comunal “Diana de Gales”, en el distrito de Puno, provincia de Puno, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y es madre de 05 hijos (3 de ellos están a su cargo). Tiene estudios de educación primaria completa.  Vive en el Barrio Chacarilla Alta.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace mas de un año, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para su negocio de venta de artesanías, ella elabora máscaras de lata.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional, por ello viene solicitando la suma de S/. 1200.00 nuevos soles, el préstamo le servirá para poder comprar latas, pinturas, y demás complementos para la elaboración de mascaras de lata.

Su deseo es poner  un taller de elaboración de solamente mascaras de todos tipo.

A ella le gustan las facilidades en los préstamos y pagos.
texts.en:
Emiliana is a member of the Community Bank "Diana de Gales" located in the district and province of Puno. She is 47 years old and is married, with 5 children (3 of them are still in her care). She completed primary school. She lives in the district of Chacarilla Alta. She has been with the Manuela Ramos movement (Kiva Field Partner) for more than a year. Her first loan of S/.500 neuvos soles was used as capital funds for her crafts business. She makes tin masks. Currently she requires an additional loan in the amount of S/.1200 neuvos soles. The loan will be used to purchase tin, paints, and other items used to make tin masks. Her dream is to set up a shop where she will make masks of all kinds. She enjoys the ease of payments.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase tin, paints and other craft items.

loans.name: Yaqueline

texts.es:
La señora Yaqueline es socia del Banco Comunal “Jesús de Nazareth”, ubicado en el Centro poblado de López del distrito de Ilave, provincia de el Collao, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 26 años de edad, es soltera y sin hijos, ella estudio secundaria completa, y  vive  en el Centro poblado de López.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela R. hace 6 meses, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para la compra de ovinos.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional, por ello viene solicitando la suma de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, este monto ella lo invertirá en la compra de ovejas para engorde y venderlos en las ferias semanales de su zona.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando y comprarse mas ganado.

A ella le gustan las facilidades en los préstamos
texts.en:
Mrs. Jaqueline is a member of the “Jesus of Nazareth” Community Bank located in the population center of López, in the Llave District, in the province of Collao, in the department of Puno. She is 26 years old. She is single and doesn’t have any children. She has completed her secondary studies and lives in the population center of López. She has worked with the Manuela R. Movement for six months. Her first loan was for 500.00 new soles. This amount she used to invest in the purchase of sheep. Actually, she is asking for an additional loan. For this loan she is asking for the sum of 800.00 new soles. This amount she will use to invest in the purchase of sheep so that she can fatten them up and sell them at the weekly fairs in her zone. Her desire is to continue working and buy more livestock. She appreciates the loan facility.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy livestock (sheep)

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 30-year-old married mother of three children. Her husband works as an artisan. She lives with her family where she also runs a cereal business. Mary initiated her small enterprise in 2006 from her small savings. She believes with a loan of Kshs 30,000 she will be able to improve her business by buying stock in bulk.

loans.use: Buy cereals in bulk

loans.name: Carmen Delia

texts.es: Carmen Delia D. D. tiene 52 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos y todos trabajan de forma independiente. Carmen se dedica a la compra-venta de ropa en general, ella ha logrado obtener clientes fijos desde que inicio su negocio y esto le ha permitido obtener ganancias que le han ayudado a solventar gastos en su hogar pues ella es madre y padre para sus hijos quienes han sabido corresponder al esfuerzo de su madre. Ella solicita un financiamiento que le permita comprar ciertos artículos como: trajes para niños, jóvenes, adultos y ancianos, además comprar tallas grandes y extra grandes ya que estas  cuestan encontrarlas y sus clientes las requieren, pues ella desea aumentar sus ventas. Su deseo es obtener su propia tienda de ropa.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Lydia Wangeci

texts.en: Lydia Wangeci W. has owned the Lydia Barber Shop for five years and has one employee.  Her store is well located in a busy area and her clients are men and children. Her business challenges are local competition and a lack of funds for expanding her small room.   She is using the loan of KES 20,000 to buy two machines for her barber shop and some fruits to sell over the holidays. She is married with four children ranging from four years to twenty-two years. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to expand her business in a way that she will be serving prominent people.  She is friendly, humble and loyal.

loans.use: To purchase two machines for the barber shop and fruit for the holidays

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma T. is from the village of Misom in Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old. Emma is single and has one adult-aged child. To make a living, Emma owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling specialty food products in the community. Emma has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP per month for these activities.

Emma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Emma is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional ingredients for cooking. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Emma from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for cooking

loans.name: Tina

texts.en: Tina is a LAPO woman and has been a member for four years without any repayment defaults.  She is hair dresser.  Tina intends to expand her business and add fish selling.  The demand for fish is high. She has a deep freezer and can preserve the fish, but her main constraint is funding.  Tina requests a loan of N100,000 to purchase cartons of fish to sell to increase her profit and for business capital. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Valeria

texts.es: La Srta.valeria se dedica a la produccion de mantas para cholitas (mujer del pueblo)en su domicilio, las mantas las confecciona de tela de seda, a eso le pone las flecaduras; sus ventas son al credito que generalmente deja a las  vendedoras de los mercados de la zona sur de la ciudad de La Paz. Con esa actividad  ayuda a sus padres a mantener su  hogar y a los estudios de sus hermanos, tambien cubren sus estudios de la universidad ya que le falta solo un año para poder egresar, podemos indicar tambien que la cliente es muy trabajadora y responsable con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
Valeria produces shawls for “cholitas” (village women). She works at home, making the shawls from silk and adding a frill. She sells on credit, generally to the stallholders in the markets in the south of La Paz city. This provides income to help her parents maintain the household and enable her siblings to study; she also helps pay for her own university studies; she has just a year left before she graduates. Valeria is very hard-working and fulfils her obligations responsibly.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials (cloth)

loans.name: Togtohsuren

texts.en:
Togtohsuren T. is the single mother of four children. She currently lives in Omnugobi province with her youngest son who is a student at the local university called Od (Star). The other children have already grown up and live separately with their families.

Togtohsuren started a small retail business since her retirement money was not enough to support her family expenses. She has sold tobacco, candy and chewing gum at the local market since 2003. Later, during summer time, she used to sell ice-cream that was brought from Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.

Togtohsuren now would like to enter the clothing retail business. Since May 2009, she has started renting a small stall at the local black market where she aims to sell women’s and men’s clothes for all ages. She requests a loan to purchase retail clothes from Ereen, China, a border town from where many cheap Chinese products are imported.

Togtohsuren says that she will work hard to make this business successful and eventually open a clothing store for locals.

loans.use: To purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Savilla

texts.en:
Savilla D. C., 55, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. She is married to Benjamin D. C., a company driver, and they are blessed with two children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been direct-selling branded clothes for seven years.

Savilla has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than six years now. She regularly attends the weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently.

Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, Savilla was able to borrow several times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used almost all the money she borrowed to increase the stock of her product line. Her business lets her earn a profit of PHP 28,000 per month.

Now, with your help, Savilla would like to apply for a PHP 10,000 loan. This amount will be mostly used as a source of added capital for her expanding business and used to buy assorted clothes and shoes to sell.

Savilla dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can have enough money for her children’s schooling.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and to repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy assorted clothes and shoes for her direct-selling business

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is 52 years old and is married with six children aged between 4 and 20 years. Bernard and his family live in Burera, in the Northern Province of Rwanda. There, Bernard operates his business of selling leather. This is his twentieth successful year in this business and the hours of his business are from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day.

Bernard is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding his business through purchasing more leather, which hopefully will increase his profits. If this plan is successful, Bernard will continue to pay school fees as well as take care of his family. He will also save some profits, which in turn will allow him to make his business more stable.

loans.use: To buy more animal skins to sell

loans.name: Kigarama Women's Cooperative Group, Ibanda

texts.en:
S. Mariat is 31 years old and married with three children. She also takes care of five dependents.

Mariat is a hardworking and friendly lady with a strong drive to succeed. She has been involved in the sale of produce at Kigarama trading center for ten years and she is grateful that she has always been able to earn profits that enable her take care of her children.

Mariat’s business location is strategic and she hopes to expand her business further and educate her children to the highest level. She needs a loan to be able to buy more produce to sell so that she can generate more profits.

loans.use: To buy more produce to sell

loans.name: María Emilia

texts.es:
En el municipio El Sauce, la señora María Emilia C. tiene su propia pulpería que ella misma atiende con el fin de obtener los ingresos para el mejoramiento de su nivel de vida. Ella ofrece variedad de productos como cosméticos y ropa. Ella siempre ha buscado la manera de cómo salir adelante y por ello busca el apoyo en los créditos.

Actualmente está solicitando un crédito el cuál será invertido directamente en la compra de la mercadería como cosméticos y ropa para surtir la pulpería ya que lo necesita mucho para salir adelante y así mejorar cada vez más el negocio.
texts.en:
María Emilia C. has her own store in El Sauce. She tends to it herself in order to earn income to improve her standard of living. She sells a variety of merchandise like cosmetics and clothes. She has always sought ways to get ahead in life and this is why she seeks help from these loans. Currently, she is asking for funding to buy merchandise like cosmetics and clothes to stock her store; she needs it in order to get ahead and improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and clothing.

loans.name: Tohirjon

texts.ru: Ашуров Тохиржон проживает в районе Дж. Руми. Возраст, 29 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Живет вместе с родителями. Занимется животноводством. Разводит крупно- рогатый скот у себя дома. В этом ему помогает жена. Кредит берет для закупа скота. Он в основном откармливает и продает скот.
texts.en:
Tohirjon A. lives in the J. Rumy district. He is 29 years old, married and has 3 children. He lives together with his parents. Tohirjon is involved in animal husbandry. He breeds cattle at home. His wife helps him with this business. He is requesting the loan for the purchase of livestock. Tohirjon primarily raises and sells livestock.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah O. is 37 years old. She is married and has six children.

Monicah started her tailoring business in 1998 after managing to buy a sewing machine. Before, she used to make table mats to sell.

With her business, Monicah has been able to generate income in order to provide for her family with little help from her husband. She lives in Nyalenda, Kisumu, Kenya, and buys her stock within the town every fortnight.

Monicah wants to expand her business in future and to do this she needs something to boost her business with. It is for this reason she has applied for a loan of Ksh 20,000 to increase her stock so that she will see her income increase.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Yanjintseveg

texts.en:
Yanjintseveg is 43 years old and lives with his wife and child in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. His child attends a university. His wife is an x-ray technician at a general hospital, and during her spare time she helps with Yanjintseveg's business.

Yanjintseveg receives a disability payment from the government. However, his physical disability is not a significant impediment, and he forges ahead to ensure a good future with his wife. Yanjintseveg was an electrician with a local energy center between 2003 and 2008. Since 2008 he has operated a movie rental business from a shipping container at a local market.

He plans to expand his business in the future. Yanjintseveg is a very hardworking person and is focused on the future. He says, “I would like to grow my business in the future, and improve my family's quality of life.” He is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug (~ 722 USD) loan to increase his working capital for his business.

loans.use: To increase his working capital

loans.name: Pakk's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sreyneang C. is a 28-year-old married woman and the leader of a group loan. She was selected by four members who are located in Lech Pram village in Kandal province. Each member of this group loan will use it for a different purpose. Mrs. Sreyneang C. is a seamstress in a garment factory and her husband is a construction worker. In both of these positions, they earn a small income to support the family. Mrs. Sreyneang C. is now requesting a loan to buy vegetable to sell. With this loan, she hopes to increase her income to improve the family standard of living.  This couple has two children; one is attending a local school and one is too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Maria Reina De La Paz(Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal María Reina de la Paz se encuentra formado por once  socias que siempre están en la búsqueda de oportunidades día a día para mejorar la economía de su hogar y salir  adelante junto a su familia, viven en la ciudad de Cuenca localidad  ubicada a 2.500 metros de altitud sobre el nivel del mar y está asentada en un gran valle dentro de la cordillera de los andes. Está rodeada por cuatro  ríos que nacen en el  nudo del Cajas como son el Tomebamba,  Yanuncay,  Machángara y  Tarqui determinando espacios dentro de la ciudad  desde la existencia de  Guapondelig localidad  Cañari invitando a sus  residentes y visitantes a disfrutar de éstos majestuosos ríos y recrearse en ellos. 

Carmen A. con  37 años de edad,  divorciada hace seis a causa de infidelidad de su cónyuge es madre de cuatro hijos que se encuentran de 23, 18, 15, 13 años, sus dos primeros hijos trabajan y ayudan económicamente tanto para los gastos del hogar como para el estudio de sus hijos menores que cursan la secundaria en un colegio de la ciudad, la casa en la que viven es arrendada y su sueño es llegar a tener su vivienda propia.
 
Carmen se dedica al comercio de  edredones, sábanas,manteles,  joyas etc., recorriendo las calles de la localidad dejando a crédito para captar  más clientes nos comenta que  antes laboraba en un bar de su propiedad pero debido a problemas en su salud tubo que dejar este negocio,  es nuestra socia hace cuatro años y los préstamos obtenidos ha invertido en su negocio, con el nuevo  crédito  comprará sábanas, edredones, manteles y algunas joyas para tener un stock suficiente para sus clientes y dar un buen servicio.

La señora  Luisa Solórzano es una socia carismática y con muchas ganas de crecer económicamente en su vida para ayudar a su familia, se encuentra en el  segundo ciclo trabajando con  su  bankito,  ella se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos  en casas ajenas  hace 8 años, labor que realiza  de lunes a viernes de 8 a.m. a  2 p.m. y  el resto del tiempo lo dedica a su familia  mientras que los fines de semana se dedica a la venta de  jugos, espumillas, granizados (hielo con colorantes de varios sabores y leche condensada) recorriendo su sector.
Su nuevo crédito invertirá en la compra de  azúcar, leche condensada, guayabas, conos, unas bandejas  y algo más que necesite para su negocio. Su meta es llegar a tener un bar para trabajar desde allí con su negocio y no tener que recorrer las calles de la urbe.

Luisa tiene 48 años  vive con su esposo que  no trabaja debido a su estado de salud pues sufre de insuficiencia renal y trombosis vascular  y sus cuatro hijos de  21, 19, 13, 11 años, sus tres primeros hijos estudian en el colegio y  la  última hija estudia en una escuela de la ciudad. 
Viven arrendando porque no tienen casa propia
texts.en:
The María Reina de la Paz Communal Bank is comprised of 11 members who are always looking for daily opportunities to improve the economy of their households. They do this to get ahead with their families. They live in the city of Cuenca, which is 2,500 meters above sea level. It is situated in a great valley within the Andes mountain range. It is surrounded by four rivers; Tomebamba, Yanuncay, Machángara and Tarqui; that start at the Cajas junction. The rivers create spaces in the valley of Guapondelig in the town of Cañari. They invite its residents and visitors to enjoy the majestic rivers and to take pleasure in them. Carmen A., age 37, has been divorced for six years due to her spouse’s infidelity. She has four children; ages 23, 18, 15, and 13. Her first two children work and help economically with the household expenses. They also help with the educational expenses for the two younger children. The two younger children are in the city’s high school. The house they live in is rented, and her dream is to have her own house. Carmen sells comforters, sheets, tablecloths, and jewelry, etc. She sells along the streets of her area giving credit in order to get more customers. She tells us that she previously worked in a bar that she owned. But, due to health problems, she had to leave this business. She has been a member with us for four years. The loans she has received have been invested in her business. With the new loan she will buy sheets, comforters, tablecloths, and some jewelry. She will buy these things to have sufficient stock for her customers, and to give them good service. Luisa Solórzano is a charismatic member with a great desire to grow economically in order to help her family. She is in her second cycle of working with her bank. She has been doing domestic work in other people’s houses for eight years. She does this from Monday through Friday from 8 a.m. until 2 p.m. She spends the rest of her time devoted to her family. On the week-ends she sells juices, “espumillas” (a frothy drink made from beaten egg whites and fruit), and “granizados” (colored ice in various flavors with condensed milk). She sells these traveling her area. She will use the new loan to buy sugar, condensed milk, guavas, cones, some dishes, and other things she needs for her business. Her goal is to have a bar. She could work her business from there and not have to travel the streets of the city. Luisa, age 48, lives with her husband. He does not work due to the condition of his health. He has renal insufficiency and vascular thrombosis. Her four children are 21, 19, 13, and 11 years old. Her last daughter goes to a school in the city. Her first three children attend a different school. They live in a rented house because they do not have their own house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sheets, comforters, tablecloths, jewelry, sugar, condensed milk, guava, cones, and dishes

loans.name: Kabungo Women's Group, Ntungamo

texts.en:
As they say, hard work pays, and a very determined T. Pelly has gained from the fruits of her hard work. Having started up her hotel and lodging enterprise twelve years ago in Omungyenyi, Ntungamo, a common stopover for long-route drivers from Rwanda, Pelly has no regrets.

Due to Pelly’s good management and esteemed customer care, her business has maintained customers for a long time, thus creating the hotel a good market. With this loan, Pelly wants to put in place a pool table as it is a favorite game for many. She will also use the loan to buy foodstuffs for the hotel. This will enable her to earn more profit and enable her to cater for the requirements of her four fatherless children as she was widowed at a tender age.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs and a pool table for her hotel

loans.name: Fanni Rosa

texts.es:
Fanny Rosa, tiene 41 años, es casada, tiene dos hijos y es natural del Cusco. Ella es cantante de la discoteca la Rustica de la ciudad del Cusco, ella empieza a trabajar a la media noche hasta las tres de la mañana todos los días y ya son más de 10 años que se dedica a esta profesión. Ella empezó su carrera musical en la Orquesta Dilema, Sentimiento Perú, Berbe latino, etc. A parte de ser cantante también se dedica  a la venta de ropa por campaña navideña. Fanny requiere el préstamo para uso personal y para su negocio, el 50% utilizara en el negocio y la otra parte para el tratamiento de su hijo que sufre de glaucoma ceguera avanzada. 
El sueño de la socia Fanny es producir su propio musical discográfico con canciones inéditas y propias de ella. La socia se encuentra agradecida y contenta con los microcréditos pues le ayudan mucho para tener un ahorro para cualquier emergencia de su hijo.
texts.en:
Fanny Rosa is 41 years old. She is married, has two children, and is from Cusco. She is a singer at the “Rustica” dance club in the city of Cusco. She works from midnight until 3:00am everyday and she has been working in this profession for more than 10 years. She began her musical career in Orquesta Dilema, Sentimiento Perú, Berbe Latino, etc. In addition to being a singer, she also sells clothing for the Christmas holidays. Fanny needs the loan for personal use and for her business. She will use 50% in her business and the other half for medical treatment for her son, who suffers from advanced glaucoma. Fanny’s dream is to produce her own music album of her own unpublished songs. She is very grateful for and happy with the micro-loans because they help her to have savings for any emergency that her son might have.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fanny needs the loan for personal use and for her business.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Sabina se dedica a la venta de comida; es viuda y la única que solventa los gastos de alimentación, ropa y estudios de su hija. 
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Achumani de la urbanización concepción de la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito será destinado para la compra insumos (papa, arroz, fideo, aceite). Para continuar con su negocio de venta de comida.
Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. Su historial la califica como cliente buena en el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Sabina is dedicated to the sale of food. She is a widow and the only one who covers the expenses of diet, clothes and studies for her daughter. Her residence is located in the Achumani zone of the housing complex of the city of La Paz. The loan will be used to purchase supplies (potatoes, rice, noodles, oil) to continue with her food sale business. This is the second time that she has requested a loan from Impro. Her record qualifies her as a good client in making her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy potatoes, rice, noodles and oil for her food sale business.

loans.name: Boek

texts.en: Mrs. Boek S. 45 years old and she is a villager who lives in Trapeang Snao village, Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 1.50-hectares of land to cultivate rice. For this farm, she decided to ask for a loan to add her saving to buy agri machine to support her farming crop. Aside from farmer she is also rice middleman who is able to earn a small income to support her three children. Her husband, Mr. Hen Un, is a laborer who is also able to receive a little salary to hold up his family living. This couple has three children, who all are students in the local school.

loans.use: To add her saving to buy agri machine

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita D. is from the town of Tawi-tawi. She is 36 years old and is married with four adult children. Teresita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store and also runs a business making Nipa huts (native houses constructed out of bamboo with a thatched roof made from the leaves of the Nipa palm). She has been engaged in her businesses for almost a year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Teresita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her sari-sari store business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nusrat's Group

texts.en:
Nusrat lives in a historic city called Lahore. Lahore is the second largest city of Pakistan and known for its history and culture. She has been living in a three-room brick house with her family in an area named Saddar Cantt for the last 20 years. She is the mother of three children, two sons and a daughter. All of them are getting their education. Her eldest son is in 9th standard (grade) and the younger one is in 8th standard, while her daughter is studying in 7th standard. Nusrat knows the importance of education very well and wants to give the best possible education to her children. 

Her husband does a job in government sector. After his day job, he operates his shop in the market from where he sells spare parts of cars and motorbikes. Nusrat herself performs her duty of a seamstress. She sews clothes for her neighborhood clients. She is well-known person in her area for her sewing, which helps her to get regular orders. 

Nusrat has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband’s spare parts business. With the loan amount, he will buy spare parts of different vehicles and increase his sales by selling them to his customers. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and is in her 2nd loan cycle.

loans.use: Purchase spare parts of vehicles for her husband's business

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina C. is from the village of General Balao, Solana, Cagayan. She is 34 years old. Marcelina is married and has five infant children. Marcelina owns and operates a livestock business. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Marcelina has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4000 Philippine pesos (PHP) whenever she sells one of her grown animals.

In 2009, Marcelina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Marcelina has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. Marcelina is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Marcelina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisher-folk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchasing livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda B. is from the village of Poblacion, Salay, Misamis Oriental. She is 35 years old. Erlinda is separated from spouse and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Erlinda owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling specialty food products like tocino and home made sausage in the local community. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Erlinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchased additional ingredients of making and selling food products like her tocino and homemade sausage. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Erlinda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make product for sale

loans.name: Ziyodullo

texts.en: Ziyodullo O. is 55 years old. He is married and has five children of school age. Ziyodullo is producing the national cradles. The national cradles in Tajikistan are very colorful. They are made of wood. As a rule, the national cradle is presented by the grandparents when the baby is 40 days old and this event is celebrated in the family circle. Ziyodullo has been in this business for 11 years. The finished products are purchased from the house of Ziyodullo. The business stability has allowed an income to ensure the family has the possibility to improve their living conditions. Ziyodullo has been working with IMON for two years. For the entire period of time, he had shown himself as a successful client, managing his loans with accuracy and precision. Today, Ziyodullo requests a loan in the amount of 6900 Somoni in order to purchase planks and paints for producing the cradles. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road, and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing raw materials: planks and paints

loans.name: Ayawa

texts.fr: ayawa est une femme de 37 ans, elle est très dynamique. l'activité qu'elle exerce est le commerce de produits d'alimentation générale. elle a une expérience de plus de 10 ans dans ce commerce et s'approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. elle a déjà obtenu de WAGES un crédit qu'elle a bien remboursé, elle sollicite de WAGES son second crédit pour pouvoir s'approvisionner avec divers produits d'alimentation générale. elle est mariée et vit avec son époux dans le quartier de kpota.
texts.en:
Ayawa is a very dynamic 37-year-old woman. She makes a living selling general food products. She has over ten years of experience in this business, and buys her stocks at the big market of Lomé. 

She has obtained one previous loan from WAGES, which she has fully repaid. She is seeking a second loan to buy various food items. 

Ayawa is married and lives with her husband in the neighborhood of Kpota.

loans.use: To buy general food items

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 45 años tiene 3 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. Su actividad es la venta de artesanía. El tiempo que tiene con este negocio son 17 años, esta alternativa de trabajo es muy necesaria para sobrevivir. Ella sale todos los días a vender sus productos, sus clientes es una persona muy humilde pero muy trabajadora. Ella se caracteriza por proporcionar a sus clientes un buen servicio y ofrecer calidad en sus productos. El crédito esta destinado para la compra de artesanía que es necesaria.
texts.en:
Rosa is 45 years old and has 3 small children under their care. She is a vendor of handicrafts. She has been in this business for 17 years, and needs this activity to survive.

She leaves home every day to sell her products. Her customers are quite humble but hardworking. She is well considered as she provides her customers with good service and offers quality products.

The loan will be used to purchase the needed craftwork.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Simenis

texts.en:
Simenis is the mother of 3 children. She used to be a member of 'Nueva Esperanza' (New Hope), a group of borrowers that have appeared on Kiva.org more than once and have always successfully repaid their loans. Simenis is now asking for a loan as an individual because she requires a larger amount than is usually offered to borrowers that are members of a group. 

Simenis lives in the Hato Mayor region of the Dominican Republic, located in the east of the country. Hato Mayor is a fairly mountainous region where the principal industry is agriculture. Simenis' community, like nearly all impoverished areas in the Dominican Republic, suffers from a constant shortage of running water and electricity. As well as Dominicans, Haitian immigrants make up a large proportion of Simenis' community.
  
Simenis requires her loan to invest in stock for her clothing business. As well as clothes, Simenis sells a variety of footwear - shoes, trainers and slippers. Simenis started this business 12 years ago and actually lists her favourite pastime as trading with customers! Simenis is very excited about taking out another loan so that she can continue to grow her business. She hopes to finish off the construction of her house with the profits that she makes, something which she also says is her biggest current challenge.

loans.use: To invest in her clothes business

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy N. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Njeru in the Jinja region of Uganda.  She is married and has two children, one of whom attends school. Teddy has a business of selling shoes, which she has had for two years.         

To help expand her business, Teddy has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase shoes.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Teddy hopes to generate greater profits and buy food.  In the future, Teddy hopes to own another business.   Teddy is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to work hard.

loans.use: To purchase shoes

loans.name: Tari Mai

texts.en:
Tari mai M.  is 34 years old, and married, with a 5-year-old child.  In 2000, she established her religious statue-making business.  Working 7 days a week and 6 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 5 loans from Patan BPW.  Tari mai used her most recent loan to buy raw materials such as bronze, wax and silver for her work.  In the future, Tari mai plans to improve the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.   

Nepal has a long and rich history of traditional handicrafts.  Throughout the Kathmandu Valley, skilled artisans produce unique pieces of art that reflect Nepal's cultural diversity.  Terra cotta pottery comes from the red clay of the surrounding Himalayan foothills.  Bronze and silver statuettes are formed using wax molds and intricate hand tool finishing.  

In Patan, Newari culture and traditions are reflected in the images and symbols etched into metal or formed in stone.  With the help of a Kiva loan, Nepal's artisans are able to purchase raw materials in greater volume.  This increase in volume allows a single artisan to work on several pieces at the same time while increasing her profit margin.  

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates.  Also, join our lending team: BPW Lending Team.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her business

loans.name: Alatasi

texts.en:
AlaT. T., age 56, is a farmer, planting and harvesting bananas and offering them for sale. AlaT. has five years of experience in this business. AlaT. needs a loan of WST $2,500 to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 320 talas or US $133 per week) to improve and expand her business. She and her husband have two children, ages five and nine.

In 2007, AlaT. joined SPBD. This is her fifth loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are AlaT.'s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana vive en  la casa de su hermana en la zona de Villa Ingavi, de la ciudad de  El Alto, tiene un hijo, la señora es comerciante y se dedica a la venta de chuño y tunta (son derivados de la papa) en los restaurantes de la ciudad de El Alto. Con los ingresos que obtiene mantiene a su familia. Es el primer crédito con IMPRO, de la misma manera con KIVA.

El crédito será utilizado para la compra de chuño y tunta en mayores cantidades para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Juana lives in her sister's home in Villa Ingavi district, in the city of El Alto.  She has one child.  Juana is a saleswoman who sells 'chuño' and 'tunta' (potato derivatives) to restaurants in the city of El Alto.  She uses her income to support her family.

This is Juana's first loan from IMPRO and her first KIVA loan.  She will use her loan to buy 'chuño' and 'tunta' in larger quantities to meet her customers' demand.

loans.use: To buy 'chuño' and 'tunta' wholesale for her business selling these products to restaurants

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a businessman who runs a grocery store.  Its eight years since he started the business.  So far, he has managed to employ one person.  He works hard in his business to provide for his family.  He previously bought a piece of land on which he is planning to build a home for his family.  Thanks to Faulu Kenya for funding him.  He hopes to stabilize his business in five years.  He has requested a loan of 40,000 KES to buy beans, maize, potatoes and onions.

loans.use: To buy beans, maize, potatoes and onions.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa A. is from the village of Antonino, in the municipality of Labason, in the province of Zamboanga del Norte. She is 60 years old, is married, and has 8 adult children. To make a living, Elisa owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Elisa has been engaged in her business for more than 3 years and earns approximately 2000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elisa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC of 3000 PHP, which was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Elisa is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 2nd loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Liloy - Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 36-year-old single man.  He sells second-hand clothes so as to earn a living.  He has been running the business for two years.  He joined Faulu Kenya so that he would easily access loans.  He has also developed a culture of saving.  He hopes to grow his business and sell wholesale in the future.  He has requested 20,000 Kes to add to his stock of clothes.

loans.use: To add to his stock of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Sebastian

texts.es:
Sebastián tiene 26 años de edad y es soltero. Vive en casa propia con su familia en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz en Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque. Su comunidad es rural, joven y en vías de desarrollo. 

Desde hace 4 años, se dedica a la compra y venta de quesos y aceitunas. Cuenta con su puesto propio ubicado estratégicamente en el Mercado Moshoqueque, un mercado grande, muy conocido y con bastante movimiento. Cuenta con una clientela ya establecida y fiel. Compra sus productos de pequeños comerciantes que llegan de la sierra a expender sus productos. Ha solicitado un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar una congeladora y así mejorar la calidad de sus productos. Desde que se inició, su negocio ha crecido notoriamente, lo cual está reflejado en el incremento de sus inventarios. Sebastián es muy trabajador y responsable. Ha manejado otros préstamos y cumplió con sus obligaciones en manera puntual.
texts.en:
Sebastián is 26 years old and is single. He lives in his family’s house in the district of José Leonardo Ortiz in Chiclayo, the capital of the region of Lambayeque. His community is rural, young, and on the way to development.

Since he was 4 years old he has been selling cheeses and olives. He has his own strategically located place in the Moshoqueque Market, a large market that is well known and sees a lot of business. He has an established and loyal customer base. He buys his products from small-scale merchants who come from the mountains to sell their products. He has requested a loan of PEN 2,000.00 to buy a freezer so that he can improve the quality of his products. Since he started, his business has grown notably, which is reflected in his increased inventories. 

Sebastián is very hard-working and responsible. He has had other loans and lived up to his obligations in a punctual manner.

loans.use: to buy a freezer for his products

loans.name: 1Ro De Mayo Group

texts.es: Banco D. emprendimiento 1º D. Mayo esta entrando a su segundo  ciclo conformado por 8 integrantes que viven en la zona del jorochito y tiquipaya los 8 clientes todos cuentan con negocio y actividad. La Presidenta es la Sra., Adelaida D. edad D. 44 años oriunda D. la localidad D. jorochito vive en la zona hace 30 años,  su actividad es la venta D. verduras en el mercado D. la zona hace 5 años, su Estado civil convive con el sr. Luis y tienen 2 hijas  que se encuentran en edad escolar la Sra. Adelaida es una persona muy trabajadora ayuda a su esposo en los gastos del hogar y con el dinero del crédito comprara mercadería verduras por cantidad para y así surtir su puesto D. venta. La secretaria la Sra. Virginia D. 28 años D. edad vive en la zona D. jorochito hace 2 años, su actividad es la venta D. bisutería cuenta con esta actividad hace 1 año en el mercado D. la zona. Su estado civil es soltera y tiene 3 niños que se encuentran en edad escolar, con el dinero del crédito comprara mercadería para ofrecer a sus clientes, todas las socias son personas responsables y trabajadoras que están agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: The First of May community bank is entering its second loan cycle and consists of eight members who live in the Jorochito and Tiquipaya area. All eight members have their own business. The group president is Adelaida, a 44-year-old native of Jorochito who has lived in the area for the past 30 years. She makes a living selling vegetables at an area market, which she has done for the past five years. She's married to her husband, Luis, and they have two school-age children. Adelaida is a very hard-working woman who helps her husband with household expenses. With the money form the loan she plans to purchase vegetables in bulk and thus stock her sales post. The group's secretary is Virginia, who is 28 and has lived in the Jorochito area for the past two years. She has maD. a living selling jewelry at an area market for the past year. She is single and has three school-age children. With the loan, she plans to purchase merchandise to offer her customers. All the members are responsible and hard-working people who are grateful for the support they are provided.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables in bulk

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN RAFAEL”; Este banco está ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac,  provincia de Cusco y  departamento de Cusco.

La Sra. Edith, es soltera y tiene 38 años de edad,  tiene una hija de 12 años de edad, ella es secretaria en una institución privada y también tiene un pequeño negocio  propio la socia tiene un cafetín en el poblado de Limatambo, ella  suele invertir el dinero que se presta en la compra de servicios, vajillas, sillas, insumos, frutas del día, azúcar, café, y otros. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de insumos y servicios para implementar su cafetín.

La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to San Rafael Communal Bank, located in the District of Huanchac, part of the Province and Department of Cusco.

Edith is single and is 38 years old. She has a 12-year-old daughter and is a secretary at a private institute. She also has a small business – a café in the town of Limatambo. She often invests the money borrowed in the purchase of services, dishes, chairs, supplies, fruits of the day, sugar, coffee, and other items. She is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of supplies and services for her café.

Edith values and appreciates the loan granted and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and services for her café.

loans.name: Florentina

texts.es:
FLORENTINA J. Y.
Doña Florentina J. Y., ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, cosméticos, regalos etc. Es su segundo crédito kiva en fape y nos comenta que gracias a dios su negocio a marchado porque se encuentra en un lugar céntrico y que atraves de sus amistades sus clientes la buscan, ella nos comenta que también da crédito a sus clientes seleccionado hoy es segunda vez que trabaja con crédito, anteriormente no lo había hecho pero ase el comentario que esta oportunidad que se le dio, le sirvió para poder invertir mas su negocio y el deseo que tiene es seguir creciendo en el negocio y surtir mas de lo que tiene la clave de su éxito ha sido la amabilidad que tiene para atender a sus clientes y la buena administración que ella tiene con el dinero del negociO.
Solicita el credito para la compra de cosmeticos en bariedad.
texts.en:
Florentina J. Y. sells clothes, cosmetics, gifts, etc.  This is her second Kiva loan through Fape and she tells us that, thanks to God, her business has done well because it is in a central location.  Her customers seek her out after learning about her through their friends.  She tells us that she provides products to selected customers on credit.  This is the second time that she has had a loan.  She hadn't taken out loans before but she tells us that the opportunity that she was given helped her to invest more in her business.  She would like to continue growing in her business and stock it some more.  The key to her success has been the kindness that she shows when serving her customers and the way in which she manages the money in her business well.

Florentina is requesting a loan to buy a variety of cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy a variety of cosmetics

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José Luis nació en la ciudad de Puno  y tiene 38 años. Él es casado y fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos. Actualmente, José Luis vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco (Cusco denominada "Capital Arqueológica de América").   

José Luis desde hace 12 años que se dedica a la venta de autopartes y adornos para automóviles en el centro comercial de “Auto Partes San Pedro”, él tiene un puesto de venta alquilado y está equipado con la mercadería necesaria pero esta vez quiere surtir un poco más.

José Luis trabaja diariamente atendiendo el puesto de venta. Su esposa le ayuda con los ingresos del hogar trabajando en la casa y hay veces en el cuidado del puesto de venta. 

José Luis quiere darle una buena vida a su familia aunque no tiene un puesto de venta propia porque lo primero que quiere es educar a sus hijos. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Juntos Unidos” de la Asociación Arariwa donde tiene crédito por ser una persona responsable con los pagos. En esta oportunidad José Luis requiere el préstamo para compra mercadería como por ejemplo adornos para automoviles.
texts.en:
José Luis was born in the city of Puno and is 38 years old.  He is married and has two children.  Currently José Luis lives in the beautiful city of Cusco which was named the "Archaeological Capital of America".

For 12 years, José Luis has been selling car parts and decorative accessories for vehicles, in the "Auto Partes San Pedro" shopping center.  He rents a sales location which is equipped with the merchandise he needs.  However, he would like to stock his business a little more.

José Luis works in his business every day.  His wife helps him with the household income by working at home and sometimes helping take care of the store.

José Luis would like to provide his family with a good life even though he does not own his own sales location.  His main priority is educating his children.  He belongs to Asociación Arariwa's "Juntos Unidos" community bank and is noted for being responsible in making his repayments.  On this occasion, José Luis needs a loan to buy merchandise such as decorative accessories for vehicles.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as decorative accessories for vehicles

loans.name: Mercy

texts.es: Mercy tiene 23 años, es una joven madre de familia muy amable y trabajadora, vive en casa de sus padres junto a su esposo Wilson de 24 años y sus 2 queridos hijos Jean de 7 y Katsumi de 2 años, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. El puesto de comida de Mercy es el más concurrido D. mercado Bellavista de la ciudad de Pucallpa, todos los días sus clientes se dan cita en su puesto para degustar los deliciosos platillos que prepara. Ella es una cocinera muy hábil y es que desde muy pequeña aprendió a cocinar observando a su madre y ahora se siente muy feliz realizando este trabajo. Lleva 6 años realizando esta actividad y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cocinar, sin embargo no se abastece sola para atender a toda su clientela. Con el paso de los meses, espera mejorar la infraestructura de su puesto de comida y así tener más clientes. Este será el cuarto crédito con MFP, espera ser muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, ya que desea acceder a más créditos, en su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará nuevas ollas y utensilios, pues las que usaba se han deteriorado con el paso D. tiempo.
texts.en: Mercy, 23, is a friendly, hard-working young woman.  She and her husband, Wilson, 24, and their 2 children--Jean, 7, and Katsumi, 2--live with her parents.  Her children are very dear to her and what she most wants in the world is to give them a better quality of life.  Mercy's food stall in Pucallpa's Bellavista market is one of the market's busiest.  Her customers come back over and over to enjoy the delicious meals she makes.  She learned to cook watching her mother when she was young and now she's a very skilled cook.  She likes to cook and operating a restaurant suits her very well.  She's operated the restaurant for 6 years and the thing she most likes about the business is cooking.  She wants to grow and improve the business and provide a better service for her customers.  This will be her fourth MFP loan and she is committed to repaying it in the agreed-upon time.  Mercy is an active member of her community bank.  She will use this one-thousand new soles loan to buy pots, pans and other cooking utensils to replace the worn-out equipment that she has now.

loans.use: to buy pots, pans and other cooking utensils for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 
Perla has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 4 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Perla is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, (Name) hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Kandahar Clusters Group

texts.en:
Marion, 37 years old, is a happily married mother of 5 who began her general merchandise retail business in 2000, having taken it over from her deceased parents. At first, there was apprehension and disquiet from the rest of the family over her decision to take over the business so hastily. With time, however, she has been vindicated as she provides for not only her 5 children but also for some other members of her family with the business's earnings. The many successes she has registered are due to her diligence, determination, steadfastness, tenacity and prayers.   

Marion has a fondness for farming, an activity she did before she took up retailing. She still finds time, especially on the weekends, to do some farming and she normally delegates the responsibility of running the shop to her sister. Her monthly sales profits total up to UGX 200,000. The purpose of this loan is to enable Marion to make substantial purchases of more retail commodities such as sugar, rice, plastics, salt, beans, toothbrushes, Colgate, soap, bread, etc. to ultimately resell.

loans.use: to purchase more retail commodities to resell

loans.name: Marjorie Noemi

texts.es:
Marjorie Noemi tiene 20 años, Es soltera vive con los padres, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. No tiene hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. CIUDADELA LOS ANGELES, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto los Ángeles, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores como siembre de maíz y arroz.

Marjorie se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz  . Compra sus productos en Comercial Procan y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos, fertilizantes y semillas.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrenta desafios como la falta de dinero para pagar a los trabajadores. Su sueño es tener dinero para salir de viaje, formar una familia y tener un buen esposo.

Le gusta bailar y ser una persona muy divertida.
texts.en:
Marjorie Noemi is 20 years old.  She is single and lives with her parents in the Ventanas Canton in los Ríos Province. She has no children.

The community bank CIUDADELA LOS ANGELES is located in the Los Angeles area, which is part of the Ventanas Canton.  The members of this community bank are engaged in work such as growing corn and rice.

Marjorie works in agriculture, growing corn and rice.  She buys supplies at Procan Commercial, and sells her products in the wholesale market of Ventanas.

She is requesting the loan to buy supplies, fertilizers and seeds so she can plant corn and rice.  The support of the loan will help her financially to meet her needs. She faces challenges such as lack of money to pay her workers. Her dream is to have money to take a trip, and to create a family and have a good husband.

She likes to dance and have fun.

loans.use: to buy supplies, fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Comlan Janvier

texts.fr: Comlan Janvier est âgé de 37 ans et est marié à un certain Yollande. Le couple a trois enfants à charge, tous scolarisés, dont deux sont les leurs. Comlan Janvier vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Comlan Janvier subvient ensemble avec sa femme, aux besoins de la famille. Comlan Janvier a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire, puis a appris l'électronique, une activité qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Comlan Janvier s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. C’est la troisième fois que Comlan Janvier sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un crédit. Ce crédit lui servira à mieux équiper son atelier par l’acquisition de pièces de rechanges électroniques, ce qui lui permettra de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle et donc d'accroître son revenu.
texts.en:
Comlan Janvier is 37 years old and married to a woman named Yollande. They support three children, who are all in school. Two of the children are their own. He lives together with his wife and children. Together with his wife, he meets the needs of his family. 

Comlan Janvier dropped out of secondary school and then learned about electronics. This work enables him to support himself and his children. He gets his supplies from a city in Benin. 

This is the third time that he has requested an ALIDé loan, which will serve to acquire electronic replacement parts allowing him to respond better to the demands of his customers and therefore to increase his revenues.

loans.use: to buy electronic replacement parts

loans.name: Marigen

texts.en: Marigen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has had a fishing business in the Philippines for three years and earns additional income selling prawns and crabs. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF, and is now requesting a loan of PHP 10000 to buy additional materials for her fishing business. Marigen dreams of repairing and renovating her family home in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her fishing business.

loans.name: Karupe

texts.en:
Karupe is a resident and a farmer in the Lelan area of Kitale and is married with 5 children. He has been farming for 18 years, producing and selling milk, potatoes and cotton to the local market.

He has requested a loan of 62,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says he will use the farming income to educate his children as well as to improve their living standards in terms of meals. He is also focusing on improving the breeds of cows he buys to increase the output.

He appreciates Juhudi Kilimo's services, but he laments that animal diseases are too costly to manage.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Caroline is a married woman with two children. One of her children attends school and one is still too young for school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and clothing.

For the past two years, she has operated a food café business. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other food café operators in the area. She dreams of establishing a clothes-selling business in the future.

With the KSHS 35,000, she wants to purchase three bales of clothes and pay for transport. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase three bales of clothes and pay for transport.

loans.name: Rama

texts.en:
Rama is a married man with two children, both attending school. He lives in his own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His [greatest] monthly expense is school fees.

For the past ten years, Rama has been operating a palm wine business, selling to neighbors and passersby. His major challenge is the high cost of transportation. He dreams of establishing a big pub in the future. With this 40,000 Kenyan shilling loan, he wants to purchase furniture and benches for the customers. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase furniture and benches for the customers.

loans.name: Bevita

texts.en:
Bevita is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Bevita has a shop that sells fruit, vegetables & bananas. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy fruit, coconuts & vegetables to sell.

Bevita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Bevita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fruit, coconuts & vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 29 years old, single, and has one child.  She runs a mobile-phone / money-transfer business to earn a living.  She also sells clothes and runs a salon.  As a single mother, she works hard so as to raise her child.  Her desire is to see her child through school.

Susan hopes to become financially stable in the future.  She has requested 50,000 Kenya shillings to open another mobile-phone / money-transfer business.

loans.use: To open another mobile-phone / money-transfer business.

loans.name: Vilda Rosario

texts.es:
Vilda,Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de pollos y concentrado para alimentarlos, este préstamo le ayudara para aumentar la granja y tener alimento para poderlos engordar.
Este es su segundo prestamo, en busca de crecer el negocio, ella se apoya de la institucion a traves de los financiamientos, los cuales hasta el momento han servido para mantener la fuente de trabajo para Vilda, ya que por medio de este negocio logra mantener a su familia.
texts.en: Vilda is currently requesting a loan to buy chickens and concentrate with which to feed them.  This loan will help her to increase the size of her farm and have feed with which to fatten her animals.  This is her second loan.  She is looking to grow her business and receives support from the institution through loans.  Up to now, the loans have helped her to maintain her source of work.  Through this business she manages to support her family.

loans.use: to buy chickens and concentrated feed

loans.name: Cira Silva

texts.es:
Cira sigue participando en el banco comunal “Qorichaska del Cusco” D. la Unidad D. Micro finanzas D. la Asociación  Arariwa. Cira sigue enseñando en un colegio en la ciudad del Cusco y también se dedica a elaborar tejidos D. forma artesanal. 

Cira con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien y pudo obtener buenos beneficios y por ese motivo desea otro préstamo pues le ayuda mucho. 

Cira requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercedaria como por ejemplo lana. 


Cira se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
