Cira continues to participate in the Communal Bank “Qorichaska del Cusco”, which is part of the microfinance organization Asociación Arariwa. She continues to teach at a high school in the city of Cusco, but she also makes hand-knitted articles.

With her previous loan, Cira did very well and was able to obtain good benefits. For this reason, she wants another loan since it will be of great help. Cira needs a loan to buy more supplies, such as wool.

Cira is grateful for the opportunity that has been provided. Therefore, she promises to complete her payments according to schedule.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Suuranbubu's Group

texts.en:
Suuranbubu is the leader of this group. She is 50 years old and together with her husband who is a farmer, she has raised three children. Suuranbubu works in a factory in order to earn money to meet the daily needs. The family cultivates agricultural products. They started this activity eight years ago with an initial investment of 5,000 soms. At the moment, Suuranbubu needs money for processing the land. For this purpose, she applied for the loan. With money received from the loan, she will buy mineral fertilizers. In the future, with the profits gained from selling the harvest, she wishes to save money to purchase a vehicle.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Justina tiene 59 años D. edad, es casada y fruto D. esta unión tiene seis hijos. Justina nació en la ciudad D. Quillabamba y  actualmente vive en la ciudad del Cusco. Justina desarrolla sus actividades cotidianas y económicas en la ciudad del Cusco.   

Justina compra y venta D. cuyes en unos D. los mercados más populares D. la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son varios que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 
  
Justina pertenece al banco comunal “Ñahupacman Purisun” D. la Asociación  Arariwa D. la ciudad del Cusco. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más cuyes. 

Justina se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Justina is 59 years old, married, and has six children.  She was born in Quillabamba and currently lives and works in Cusco.

She buys and sells Guinea pigs in one of the most popular markets in Cusco.  She has been doing this for several years and things are going well for her, thanks to the effort she puts forth.

Justina is a member of the “Ñahupacman Purisun” communal bank of the Arariwas Association in Cusco.  She needs this loan to buy more Guinel pigs.

Justina is grateful for the opportunity given her through this medium and is committed to making her payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy animals.

loans.name: Leonardo Rene

texts.es:
Leonardo de 39 años, empezó la actividad de elaboración de cadenas y anillos junto a su padre quien le enseño este oficio.

Trabaja desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, pero las horas varían dependiendo los pedidos que realicen sus clientes.

Su dificultad solo son las enfermedades que recaen por el trabajo. No está casado y tiene 2 hijos de 1 y 11 años, su último hijo estudian en una escuela fiscal. Quiere el prestamo para comprar plata y cobre. 

Su meta es poder seguir adelante en su negocio y desearía enseñar esta actividad a demás personas.
texts.en: Leonardo, 39, started making chains and rings alongside his father who taught him this occupation.  He works from 8am until 6pm but is hours vary according to customer orders he has.  His only difficulty is illness caused by the work.  He’s not married but has two children who are 1 and 11 years old; his oldest son attends public school.  He wants the loan to buy silver and copper.  His goal is to be able to stay in business and he’d like to teach this activity to others.

loans.use: to buy silver and copper

loans.name: Fanny Mabel

texts.es:
Fanny, vive con su esposo y tres hijos de 25,20 y 16 años de edad, ella  se dedica a vender panes con pollo,  en el centro de la ciudad hace dos años lo inicio por iniciativa propia debido a la demanda de los clientes vende todos los días de lunes a domingo.
El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar materia prima como: salchichas, pan, aceite, repollo, pollo, condimentos, gaseosas y de esa forma podrá cubrir las necesidades de su familia puesto que tendrá lo necesario para la venta y obtener más ingresos.
El sueño de Fanny es crecer su negocio y luego tener más variedad para ofrecerles a los clientes y darles lo necesario a su familia.
texts.en:
Fanny lives with her husband and 3 children aged 25, 20 and 16. She engages in selling chicken sandwiches in the city center. She started this activity two years ago out of her own initiative because of her customers’ requests. She works every day, Mondays to Sundays.
The loan she is requesting will be used to buy basic ingredients such as sausages, bread, oil, cabbage, chicken, dressings and fizzy drinks;  in this way she will succeed in providing for her family’s necessities, as she will have what she needs to for her activity and will therefore increase her earnings.
Fanny’s dreams are to make her activity grow, to have a wider variety of products to offer to her customers and to provide her family with the basic necessities.

loans.use: To buy sausages, bread, oil, cabbage, chicken, dressings and fizzy drinks.

loans.name: Princesitas Del Amor Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PRINCESAS DEL AMOR” iniciará su cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Blanca. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de comida, venta de chamarras, tienda surtida, taller de costura, confección de chamarras, venta de pan.

La señora Blanca,  indica que hace cuatro ciclos que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio que viene trabajando hace años atrás.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de teléfono para su tienda) que adquirirá de la Ceja y posteriormente lo instalará en su tienda. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación de salud y de crédito.

En al fotografía no esta la señora María por razones culturales
texts.en:
The communal bank "PRINCESAS DEL AMOR" is starting its fourth cycle in Pro Mujer, part of the Los Andes social center.  It is comprised of eight members and has a board of directors that is chaired by Mrs. Blanca.  The members of the group have different businesses among which are food sales, jacket sales, general store, seamstress shop, jacket making and bread sales.

Mrs. Blanca has been in the Pro Mujer program for four cycles and joined through an invitation from a representative.  Currently she runs a neighborhood general store where she has been for several years.

The loan she has requested is to increase her working capital to buy a telephone for the store.  She will buy it at Ceja and install it in the store.  Her work generates an income that allows her to help the family.  She has a common-law husband and three children.

When asked what she enjoys most about Pro Mujer she says that it is the health and credit training.

María is not in the picture for cultural reasons.

loans.use: To buy a telephone for her store.

loans.name: Mamuka

texts.en:
Mamuka is 43 years old. He is married and lives in the village of Kindzati with his family: his wife Dinara, three children (16, 15 and 13 years old) and his mother. Dinara works as a teacher in the village. Mamuka earns his living through agricultural activities. In particular, he runs a small dairy farm with three milk cows. 

Mamuka produces cheese and sells it at Khashuri (nearby town) market. Also the family owns 2 hectares of land, where maize, haricots, garlic, onions and beets are grown. Harvested products are sold on the same market. The total average monthly income of the family is 846 Laris, including the monthly pension of Mamuka’s mother. 

Mamuka requested credit for purchasing a milk cow. He will get more milk for cheese production and the sale of cheese will increase. The income of the family will grow and the family will be able to spend more on satisfying their needs. It will improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Marvin Noe

texts.es:
El señor Marvin tiene 28 años de edad, esta casado y no tiene hijos, vive con sus padres y se dedica a prestar los servicios de reparacion de bicicletas, motocicletas y cambio de unas piezas de automovil, en su negocio vende llantas de carro usadas, aceites para carro y moto, todo tipo de repuestos para bicicletas etc.
su negocio funciona en su casa de habitacion, tiene muchos clientes ya que sus precios son bajos y los productos que vende son buenos.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de llantas, aceite, repuestos para bicicletas y repuestos para motocicletas, desea tener mas repuestos en inventario para atender mejor a sus clientes.
las ganancias las necesita para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Marvin is 28 years old, married, and doesn’t have children.  He lives with his parents, and dedicates himself to providing repair services for bicycles, motorcycles, and some automobile parts.  In his business, he sells used car tires, oil for cars and motorcycles, and all types of bicycle replacements parts.  He runs his business from his home, and has many customers due to the fact that his prices are low and because he sells quality products.

He will use the loan to buy tires, oil, as well as bicycle and motorcycle replacement parts.  He wishes to have more parts in inventory to better service his customers.  

He needs the earnings to get ahead.

loans.use: buy tires, oil, and replacement parts for bicycles and motorcycles.

loans.name: Romuald

texts.fr: Romuald est marié à une marchande du nom de Christine et père de quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à sa charge. Romuald est âgé de 42 ans. Romuald vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Romuald subvient ensemble avec sa femme aux divers besoins du ménage. Romuald a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire mais a appris la couture. Pour assurer ses diverses charges, Romuald exerce son activité dans son atelier sise dans sa maison depuis douze ans et cette  activité lui permet de contribuer aux diverses charges de sa famille. Afin de renforcer ses équipements, Romuald sollicite un sixième crédit auprès de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des fournitures de couture et une marchine à coudre.

loans.name: Hường's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hường is 59 years old and she is married.
 
She has operated a food stall selling vegetables in the market for 5 years.
Hường lives in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. Hường's circumstances is the most difficult in this group. Her husband has passed away since 10 years ago, when her 3 children were very young. Her family is living in a small house in village. Her main income is from her vegetable stall in the market.
The main hardship that Hường faces is lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more vegetable to resell.
This is Hường first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
With her business profit, Hường hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find a good job, and to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetable to resell

loans.name: Massan

texts.en:
Born in 1969 in Togoville, Mrs. Massan K. is married and is the mother of two (02) children. Having abandoned her studies very early due to lack of support, she quickly launched herself into the trade of fresh and smoked fish with her aunt. For 11 years, she has led her own project with her first two loans of $150 and $350, obtained and repaid without incident. Very often, she faces a disruption in supply because her loan capital always seems insufficient to satisfy her clientele, which in turn makes her lose customers. A confident woman with a bright future, she deserves to be supported financially in enlarging her business.

To achieve this, Mrs. K. is asking for a new loan of $850 which will allow her to strengthen her business. With this loan, she will be able to stock up on cartons of fish to respond to market demand and thereby contribute to the household expenses with her income.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1969 à Togoville, Madame K. Massan est une femme mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants. Ayant très tôt abandonné ses études par manque de support, elle s’est lancée aussi vite dans le commerce de poissons frais et fumés avec sa tante. Depuis 11 ans, elle a initié son propre projet à partir de ses deux premiers crédits respectifs de $150 et $350 obtenus et bien soldés. Très souvent, elle fait face à une rupture de stock, car son fonds de crédit paraît toujours très insuffisant pour satisfaire les demandes de sa clientèle, ce qui lui fait perdre de la clientèle. Femme de confiance pleine d’avenir, elle mérite d’être soutenu financièrement pour accroître ses activités.

Pour ce faire, Madame K. sollicite un nouveau financement de $850 qui lui permettra de renforcer son commerce. Avec ce crédit, elle pourra s’approvisionner en cartons de poissons pour pouvoir répondre à la demande du marché et ainsi avec elle pourra contribuer aux charges du ménage avec son revenu.

loans.use: To build up a supply of cartons of fish

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther has a small store where she sells many different types of products for the home. She started her business by borrowing from informal lenders who charged very high interest rates. She is happy that she is now dealing with a financial institution after receiving her first loan with Kiva and MIFEX.

Once she had the money, Esther immediately began investing in many different products. She is now selling clothing and children’s toys from her store. These items have helped her increase profits substantially. She used part of the loan and part of the profits to improve her store as well. She has made her storefront about double the size it was before. She also paved the floor in her home and her store which were dirt before.

There has not only been a noticeable change in the physical appearance of Esther’s store, there has also been a change in Esther’s view about the future. She is now thinking bigger as she plans to begin selling domestic appliances from her store. Her daughter will start studying at the university in the next couple of months and she hopes she can continue to help her.

loans.use: Invest in domestic appliances

loans.name: Juan Felipe

texts.en:
"I am constructing additional rooms for my home which is already incredibly small with many of us living there. I would love to be able to finish the rooms but it is still missing the floor, the doors and the windows before we can live there." He is asking for a loan of $1200,00 in order to finish the construction.

Translated from French by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

“Estoy haciendo unos cuartos enseguida de mi casa ya que es muy pequeña y somos muchos los que vivimos ahí, me gustaría poder terminar los cuartos me falta poner el piso, las puertas y ventanas para poder habitarlos”. Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para terminar mi construcción.

loans.use: Build floors, windows and doors of two additional rooms

loans.name: Sarkhan

texts.en:
Sarkhan was born in 1985. He is single and lives in Khachmaz region, Gusarchay village. He started his farming business two years ago.
Now he needs a loan of $725 to buy fertilizer to improve his business and generate more income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a trader who makes his living selling childcare necessities. He has been in the business since 1980 and he is a dedicated LAPO client.

Michael is married with 7 children of his own. He hails from Igueben in the Edo State of Nigeria.

He wishes to expand his business by buying more wears for sale. To do this, he is requesting a loan of $400.

loans.use: To increase his inventory

loans.name: Estrella Adelaida

texts.es:
EstrelL. is a very hardworking woman and knows that each day she has to give her best effort and all her courage. She works raising animals and feeding them with the goal of later selling them. This activity created in her feelings of satisfaction because it allows her to proviD. for a considerable amount of the household income. She began making a living in this way when she invested money from a loan over ten years ago to get started and with the dedication that she puts forth, she has seen her little stable grow. The care that she takes to feed the animals and supply them with occasional medical visits from the veterinarian has increased their population and so now she guides them into the field each day for feeding. She makes sure not to neglect her role as a mother, because she’s also very dedicated to lovingly raising her five children, who also help out in caring for the animals during their free time. She wants to improve her stable stalls and produce milk in a quantity sufficient for selling it commercially. It is for this reason that she’s requesting a loan to buy fodder for her many animals. Please support this woman who is determined to change the course of her life with dedication and hard work.

Translated from Spanish by Johnny and Jay of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteers

EstrelL., es una mujer muy esforzada y sabe que a cada día le tiene que otorgar esfuerzo y coraje, trabaja criando sus animales y alimentándolos para después D. un tiempo venderlos. Esta actividad ha generado en elL. sentimientos D. satisfacción porque le permite aportar sumas considerables a L. economía D. su hogar; comenzó a dedicarse a este rubro cuando invirtió el dinero D. un préstamo hace ya más D. 10 años a esta actividad y con L. dedicación que pone ha visto crecer su pequeño establo.Los cuidados que elL. tiene para alimentarlos y también las revisiones periódicas con un médico veterinario ha aumentado L. población D. sus animales y ahora cada día los lleva al campo sin descuidar el rol D. madre que tiene ya que también se dedica con mucho amor al cuidado D. sus 5 hijos que también en sus tiempos D. recreación apoyan con el cuidado D. sus animales.Quiere mejorar las instalaciones D. su establo y producir leche en cantidad para comercializarL. es por ello que solicita un préstamo para comprar forraje para sus animales.Apoya a una mujer decidida a cambiar el curso D. su historia con dedicación y esfuerzo.

loans.use: Stocking her little stable and buying food for her dear animals.

loans.name: Mario De La Cruz

texts.es:
Mario resides in the modest Laureles Sur neighborhood and sells scrap metal. Currently his home does not have flooring due to his lack of money. He is requesting the loan in order to install a floor in his house and thus avoid the problems and illnesses that the dirt floor causes for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer

Don Mario habita en el humilde barrio Laureles Sur y es vendedor de desperdicios metálicos, actualmente su vivienda no cuenta con piso debido a la falta de dinero, solicita el crédito para ponerle piso a su vivienda y así evitar los problemas que trae el piso de tierra y que le provocan enfermedades a su familia

loans.use:
Purchase of bricks for the living room in his small home.

Comprar ladrillos para la sala de su pequeña vivienda

loans.name: Kawala 1A (Ii) Group

texts.en:
Cotilda is a single mother of five children. Currently she sells dry fish in the market. She wants to use the profits of the expanded business to pay school fees for the children and to buy a calf.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To increase the inventory of fish for the market stall

loans.name: Lucia's Group

texts.en:
Lucia and Gabriela have been part of the “Gracias Morenita” community bank for a little over one year. In that time, they have learned to manage their business efficiently, to save, and to be responsible. They feel that the community bank has given them support they need and helped them to progress rather than remain stagnant.

Lucia is 48 years old. She is married and has six children. Lucia has a piece of land outside of the city where she grows a variety of grains. She also makes cheese and cuts firewood. She sells all of these things at the market in Ayacucho.

Gabriela owns a small store with her sister, who is also a member of the community bank. They sell a variety of food staples such as flour, sugar, beans, and cheese.

Lucia and Gabriela need loans of 600 and 200 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use to buy seeds, milk, wood, flour, noodles, and bread.

One of the most important aspects of the community bank are the interest-earning savings accounts that each associate has. Lucia and Gabriela plan to use their savings to build a house, open a day care, and pay for their children’s educations. Their dreams are to study nursing, to be secure economically, and to hope that their children will have a better life.

loans.use: Lucia and Gabriela need loans of 600 and 200 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use to buy seeds, milk, wood, flour, noodles, and bread.

loans.name: Namayemba Central B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Frida N.. She is currently in the business of selling vegetables and is requesting a loan to uplift business. Frida is 40 years old and is a widow. She has 4 children ranging from age 6 to 12 and her children go to school. Each week, Frida makes approximately UGX 10000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children and cater for their household needs.

Frida is joined in her small group by Ruth A., Ruth N., Mwajib N., and Mariam K.. Ruth A. has a business in clothing sales and wants to increase her purchases. Ruth N. is currently operating a business selling tomatoes and wants a loan to put up a stall. Mwajib N. operates a business selling maize and wants to add to the business. Mariam K. is currently in the business of selling cassava and is requesting a loan to start a business selling fruit.

loans.use: To increase vegetable purchases

loans.name: Mary Nambalirwa`s Group

texts.en:
Mary is the leader of the group. She is 44 years of age and married with four children. They are ages 20, 18, 17, 15, years old. Three of them are in school and one dropped out due to lack of school fees.  The community she lives in is urban in a slum wetland area that floods in the rainy season.

She buys clothes and displays them in the market and has done this since she joined MCDT. She will use her loan to purchase a bale of clothes. 
There is market for her merchandise because of her low prices. The main challenges are working in the open space and residing in an area, which is prone to flooding.
Her benefits include being able to take her children to school and fending for her family. 
Plans include starting a wholesale shop for hardware and educating her children up to university level.
Mary has successfully paid back more than 10 MCDT loans.

loans.use: To buy a bale of clothes.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Mrs. Stella A. is 54 years of age.  She lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria, and is married with 6 children.  She sells drinks and is a hairdresser, a skill that she learnt for 2 years and then started her own business in 1980.  Now she needs a loan of $700 to purchase supplies for her salon. She has been a LAPO client for the past 6 years.

loans.use: To buy salon supplies

loans.name: Dzigbodi

texts.fr:
Madame Dzigbodi E. is 34 years old, married with three children. She earns a living selling yams. With this loan, Madame E. wants to buy lots of yams in the surrounding villages to sell in the market in Adéta, a village about 150 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. The profit from these sales will allow her to meet the needs of her children at school. She is very happy to have a chance to improve her standard of living.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva volunteer.

Madame Dzigbodi E. est âgée de 34 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Pour gagner de l’argent, elle vend les ignames. Madame E. espère avec ce crédit acheter beaucoup d’ignames dans les villages environnants pour revendre dans le marché d’Adéta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale Togolaise. Avec les profits qu’elle va dégager de ses ventes elle sera capable de subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants à l’école. Elle est très contente de l’opportunité d’améliorer ses conditions de vie.

loans.use: To buy yams to resell

loans.name: Faasu

texts.en:
Faasu V., 38, is married with five children.

She has two years of experience in the Taro plantation business. She sells to the village people and public three days per week.

She has two previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~$166 USD).

SPBD loans are Faasu’s only access to capital, because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The loan will be used to maintain her business. Her husband works as a taxi driver to lend financial support.

loans.use: Purchase a fence, weedkiller and chemicals

loans.name: Rosas De Ballivian Group

texts.es:
The Rosas de Ballivian group is in its fourth loan cycle and is made up of returning members and new members. The group's members have an excellent payment history with no payment problems and the group's meetings have always taken place on time. In the current loan cycle we expect the same excellent payment behavior. This group is almost a family with each member working in a different business. The group's president, Elsa, works selling prepared food, Patricio is a chauffeur who owns his own car service business, Armando sells sports clothing and Angélica is a street vendor. Yovana, Violeta, Viviana, María Elena, Dominga and Emma own stores whileTrinidad sells prepared food and Felicidad sells sweaters.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

El grupo ROSAS DE BALLIVIAN se encuentra en su cuarto ciclo, conformado por antiguos y nuevas, con excelente comportamiento pagaron sus cuotas sin ningún problema, las reuniones se llevan a cabo en hora exacta, por la temporada algunas socias del grupo se rebajaron el monto, con la esperanza de que en el próximo desembolso o ciclo se solicitará montos de acuerdo a su categoría correspondiente, en este ciclo que va en marcha se espera el mismo comportamiento del grupo, son casi un grupo familiar que tienen diferentes actividades. Su presidenta Elsa se dedica a la venta de comida, Patricio es chofer propietario, Armando vende ropa deportiva, Angélica en vendedora ambulante, Yovana, Violeta, Viviana, Maria Elena, Dominga y Emma se dedican al comercio en general, Trinidad vende comida y Felicidad vende chompas.

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La señora Martha, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Moralinas”, vive en la Región y Provincia San Martín, distrito de Morales. Se dedica desde hace 3 años a la venta de Salchipapas, pollo broster, arroz chaufa y refrescos. Vende frente a la casa de su mamá, ubicado en el Jr. aviación c-3, lugar donde  acuden diariamente los comensales, los cuales son estudiantes de la UNSM, vecinos y amigos. 

Con el préstamo de S/ 800, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará arroz, azúcar y papas en sacos, aceite en galones, cremas como salsa de tomate (ketchup), mostaza en baldes, carne, verduras, huevos y otros insumos que necesita para la preparación de sus platos, también quiere comprar un licuo extractor, mesas, sillas y contar con lo necesario para aprovechar las fiestas patronales de su comunidad. 

Martha tiene 51 años, es una mujer decidida, alegre y buena administradora. Tiene como meta implementar el negocio con más mesas y sillas porque la clientela va en aumento.
texts.en:
Ms Martha, who belongs to the group "Las Moralinas," lives in the province known as San Martin in the district of Morales. She has been selling Salchipapas ( a dish of sliced beef hot dogs and French fries), fried chicken, and arroz chaufa (a rice dish with chicken, bacon and ham ) as well as various drinks, for three years now. She sells her products in front of her mother's house, located near a local market where they sell daily to many customers, most of whom are students at UNSM (the University), other are neighbors and friends.

With this loan of $275, which will be repaid in a period of 6 months, she will purchase rice, sugar and potato sacks as well as vegetable oil by the gallon and condiments such as ketchup and mustard. She will also purchase meats, vegetables, eggs and other groceries that she needs to prepare her dishes. She also needs to buy a liquid extractor, tables, chairs and plan to stock necessary items for the parties that are held in her community.

Martha is 51 years old, she is dedicated, happy and a good administrator. She would like to meet her goal of seeing her business grow and expand with more tables and chairs to attract more customers.


Translated from Spanish by Kristin Connor, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, potatoes, vegetable oil, eggs and vegetables

loans.name: Suon

texts.en: Mrs. Suon T. owns a small store where she can sell drinks in Preak Thom village in Kandal province. Because this business is going well, she wants to expand it; so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more drinks to re-sell to her customers. She hopes she can increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. She is a 38-year-old widow with three children – two of whom are construction workers, while the other is four years old and thus too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy more drinks to re-sell to her customers.

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en:
Mr. Thorn N. is a villager in Samraong Village in Takeo Province. He is a construction worker who can make only a small income to support his family. His wife, Mrs. Thil Noeurn, is a farmer who can get a small rice revenue to support her household. Although they have different businesses, the family still lives in poor conditions.

In order to improve their living conditions, Mr. Thorn N. has decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow to start a breeding business. Mr. Thorn N. is 45 years old and the father five children, three of whom are enrolled in the local school while the remaining two are too young to work or study because they are three and five years old. Husband and wife are both in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a cow to start a breeding business

loans.name: Editza

texts.es: La Sra.  Editza M. está solicitando a AFODENIC refinanciamiento de su 2do crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (construcción de una habitación), vive en la zona # 6 de la zona Ubana de Nueva Guinea, trabaja como bibliotecaria de la Univesidad URACCAN Recinto Nueva Guinea desde hace 9 años, tiene dos hijos, el niño mayor tiene 11 añitos de edad estudia su tercer grado, la niña tiene 9 años estudia tercer grado, su esposo trabaja como albañil y ayuda con los gastos del hogar ,  Editza es una mujer  con alto espiritud de superación personal, muy responsable, es una mujer que ama su trabajo,   su sueño  es  terminar de estudiar la carrera de Ingenieria en Zootecnia, salud para ella y su familia, ademas anhela terminar de construir su  vivienda para así darle  mejores condiciones a su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Editza M. has asked AFODENIC to refinance her second loan to invest in home improvements (construct an additional room). She lives in the #6 zone of Nueva Guinea, and has worked in the library in the URACCAN Recinto Nueva Guinea University for nine years. She has two children. Her son is 11 years old and he is in the third grade. Her daughter is 9 years old and is also in the third grade. Editza's husband works as a bricklayer and helps cover the costs of keeping a home. Editza is a woman of high spirits and a desire to get ahead. She's very responsible, and loves her work. She dreams of finishing her studies as a zoologist, keeping herself and her family in good health, and finishing construction on her house in order to provide better living conditions for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construct a room

loans.name: Lesbia De Los Angeles

texts.es: La Sra. Lesbia tiene 28 años de edad, habita en el  barrio Villa  Reconciliación, casada, tiene dos hijos de 1 y 9 años de edad, el niño mayor cursa la primaria, los planes para su familia es mejorar su nivel de vida y ofrecerle un patrimonio para su hijos. Doña Lesbia tiene su pequeño negocio de comediría desde hace cuatro años de brindarle a publico en general el servicio de comediría con ricos y variados platillo de comida, inicio confundo propios, pero requiere de una remodelación en  la infraestructura. Sus objetivos para su negocio es crecer creando nuevo locales siempre en la región de Managua aumentando sus utilidades. Con la solicitud  del  préstamos de Afodenic lograra comprar materiales de construcción como: cemento, hierro, bloques y zinc para brindarle a sus cliente mayor seguridad y protección obteniendo preferencia.
texts.en:
Señora Lesbia is 28-years-old, lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood, and is married. She has 2 children who are 1 and 9, and her son is in elementary school. Her plans for her family are to improve her quality of life and to build an inheritance to leave to her children. Doña Lesbia has had a small restaurant business for 4 years in which she offers delicious and varied dishes to the general public. She started with her own funds, but she needs to remodel her location. Her goals for her business are to grow, creating new locations in Managua and increasing her profits. With her request for a loan from Afodenic, she will purchase construction materials like: cement, iron, brick, and metal for her roof to offer her customers better protection so they will prefer her restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to remodel her location

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy O. has a restaurant where she sells cooked foods like rice, beans, plantains, yams, etc. She has been in this business for a long time. She needs the loan amount of N120,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell to her customers. She is 37 years old and married with 6 children. Her husband is a farmer. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Victor Hugo

texts.es: VICTOR HUGO TIENE 50 AÑOS Y SU ESPOSA TIENE 51 AÑOS DE EDAD RESPECTIVAMENTE, ELLOS SON ESPOSOS TIENEN 3 HIJOS, QUE ESTUDIAN EN LA UNIVERSIDAD, SU VIVIENDA ES PROPIA, LOS CLIENTES SE DEDICAN AL FAENEO Y COMERCIALIZACION DE POLLOS,CHORIZO, HUEVOS, ETC. TIENE SU PUESTO PROPIO DENTRO DEL MERCADO GERMAN MORENO, LLEVA VARIOS AÑOS TRABAJANDO EN ESTE NEGOCIO, TIENE BASTANTE EXPERIENCIA ADEMAS QUE EL NEGOCIO SE ENCUENTRA UBICADO EN LUGAR ESTRATEGICO. HAY COMPETENCIA DENTRO DEL MERCADO PERO ELLOS TIENE BASTANTE CLIENTELA POR LOS AÑOS QUE LLEVA TRABAJANDO EN EL MISMO LUGAR, ADEMAS QUE EN ESTE MERCADO HAY BASTANTE DEMANDA, EL CREDITO FUE INVERTIDO PARA EL MANTENIMIENTO DE SU VEHICULO EN EL TRANSPORTA LOS POLLOS DE SU PROPIEDAD A SU VENTA, TIENEN BUENOS ANTECEDENTES CREDITICIOS, ESTE ES SU OCTAVO CREDITO DEL SOLICITANTE CON UN EXCELENTE COMPROTAMIENTO CREDITICIO EN TODOS SUS CREDITOS, ACTUALMENTE TIENE DEUDA EN OTRAS ENTIDADES FINANCIERAS QUE SE ESTAN PAGANDO CON NORMALIDAD. YA QUE SU NEGOCIO QUE ELLOS TIENEN ES RENTABLE.
texts.en:
Victor Hugo, 50, and his wife, 51, have 3 children currently in college. They own their home, and devote themselves to the hard work of selling chicken, chorizo, eggs, etc. Mr. Hugo has his own stand within German Moreno market that he has worked at for many years. Through this experience, a strategic location within the marketplace, and the popularity of the market itself, the stand has managed to continue attracting many customers despite competition. This loan will be used to invest in the maintenance of the vehicle Hugo employs to transport his chickens from his home to the stand. The family has an excellent credit history (this will be their 8th loan!). Previous loans have been paid back in full, and, due to the profitability of their business, they are currently right on schedule for repayment of those loans that are still outstanding.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle mantenance

loans.name: Khoin

texts.en:
KhO. O., 29, is married and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. She and her husband are farmers and recyclers and typically make a combined US$ 5 every day. This couple has three children, two of whom are enrolled in school and one who is too young to attend school.

Mrs. KhO. O. would like to take out a loan to purchase a motorbike as well as utensils to re-sell.

loans.use: motorbike and utensils

loans.name: Faizullo

texts.ru: Кароматов Файзулло проживает в районе Гиссар. Возраст 49 лет, женат и имеет четверых детей. Занимается разведением крупно-рогатого скота.Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 20 лет. Этот бизнес является единственным источником дохода его семьи. Для того, чтобы увеличить поголовье скота он решил получить кредит . Таким образом он сможет увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Fayzullo K. lives in the Gissar region. He is 49 years old, married and has four children. He raises cattle and has been in this business for more than 20 years. This business is the only source of income for his family. To increase the headcount of cattle he decided to apply for a loan. This way Fayzullo can also increase his turnover. He can pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase head count of cattle

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria has been growing vegetables for more than 4 years. She has two greenhouses with a total area of 180 m2, and raises tomatoes, cabbage, eggplant, radishes, watermelons and carrots. This year she wants to buy seeds for the already advanced business in Chisinau City. Now she wants to buy film for her greenhouses, which will be procured from Odessa. Victoria decided to borrow a sum from Microinvest to purchase film and seedlings necessary for vegetables. For the future she plans to grow fruits that also are requested by her customers.

loans.use: increase working capital

loans.name: Ni Wayan Winarti

texts.en:
Ni Wayan Winarti - (DNR.M-0653) is a 50 year-old female living in the town of Tukadaya - Melaya. She is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To making a living, Ni Wayan Winarti owns & operates a business making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling fried foods in the local community.  Ni Wayan Winarti has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 500,000 IDR (~USD 45) per month from these activities.

In 2008, Ni Wayan Winarti joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation. Ni Wayan Winarti has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000,000 IDR from DINARI.  This previous loan was used to purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business. Ni Wayan Winarti is now requesting a new loan of 5,000,000 IDR which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from DINARI. Ni Wayan Winarti plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to pay the tuition fees of the her children.

About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Ni Wayan Winarti - (DNR.M-0653) merupakan 50 tahun wanita.  Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Tukadaya - Melaya.  Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 2 anak usia sekolah.  Untuk membiayai hidup, Ni Wayan Winarti memiliki & menjalankan usaha.  Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pangan.  Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah membuat & menjual makanan.  Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari menjual makanan kering di tengah masyarakat setempat.  Ni Wayan Winarti sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 3 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Wayan Winarti menghasilkan sekitar 500,000 IDR sebulan.


Dalam 2008, Ni Wayan Winarti bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  Ni Wayan Winarti meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari DINARI.  Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membeli kendaraan pengangkut untuk meningkatkan bisnis.  Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 5,000,000 IDR.  Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli produk tambahan untuk dijual.  Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 2nd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI.  Ni Wayan Winarti berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis  untuk membayar biaya sekolah anak-anak peminjam.

Tentang DINARI:

Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil.

*Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. .  Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam  Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita H. is 58 years old. She lives happily with her seven children. She is a widow. Since her husband passed away, Rita has worked hard for her family by running a variety store, a business she started with her first loan cycle.

She is now applying for a third loan cycle. If granted, the loan will be used to procure additional items for sale in her variety store. She is expecting a much higher income from this investment.

Rita is looking forward to increased profits and a better standard of living for her family, thanks to the assistance rendered by this lending organization.

loans.use: To procure additional items for her variety store

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel O. is forty-nine years old, married, and has five children: three sons and two daughters who are all currently in school – senior high, junior high and primary school. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a town in Ghana called Suhum, a busy business centre in the Eastern Region. The majority of the inhabitants are into one particular type of business activity or another. His wife trades to support him financially.

Emmanuel runs a pharmacy shop in his community. He buys his drugs from the distributers who come round to supply in vans. He has been in business for over twenty-three years and wants a loan to procure drugs in bulk to increase his stock. He is hopeful to give his children the best education.

loans.use: To procure drugs in bulk

loans.name: Annonciata

texts.en:
Greetings from M. Annonciata, a 41-year-old widow who lives in Muhima sector, Nyarugenge district in Kigali city, capital of Rwanda. She has one child, 14 years old.

M. is an entrepreneur running her business in Nyarugenge district where she owns a small shop selling different kinds of vegetables such as onions, cabbages, etc. She starts her daily operations at 7:00 a.m. and finishes at 7:00 p.m. and has one worker who helps her to run her business. She has been running the same business since 2003 and earns a monthly profit of approximately $165.

M.’s first loan was while she belonged to the group called Abahuje (Together as One). She is seeking her second loan, worth 500,000 Rwf, from Vision Finance Company and it is her first loan with Kiva. With this loan, M. intends to buy more merchandise for her store and will reinvest the increased profit in the same business and will create more savings.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Zakaui Group

texts.en: Zakaui is the group leader of Zakaui group. There are three members in this group. They all want to take out a loan to further their business and make it larger. So they are requesting a group loan of 42000 Afghani. Zakaui wants to take a loan for her husband who has a general store. Zhiu Gul wants take a loan for the business of quilt-making. Mawonsa wants to take a loan for her husband who is a taxi driver, so they are very happy with this process of small loans in Afghanistan.

loans.use: For expanding their businesses

loans.name: Mujeres De Debora Group

texts.en:
Marta P. is the group leader of Mujeres de Debora in Llano de Perez, a small town west of Puerto Plata. At the age of 48, Marta is happily married to her husband, Elvis, and is the proud mother of two boys, Emmanuel and Laurie. Recently, Emmanuel began studying at a university in Puerto Plata. Marta is grateful that her son was accepted into a university; however, the costs are a substantial burden on her family.

Marta believes that the best way for her to ease the financial load is by expanding her small but successful underwear business. Once a month, Marta’s niece drives six hours from La Romania to Llano de Perez and delivers clothes to Marta. After receiving the clothes Marta spends a couple of hours a day selling them until she is out of inventory. With the help of Kiva partner Esperanza, Marta hopes to be able to buy more clothes for resale. She believes that although she will have to spend more time working, the extra profit she will make from having a larger inventory will be worth it.

Marta is excited at the thought of borrowing from Esperanza. She hopes that with the money Esperanza provides she will eventually be able to open a clothing store. Although she believes that owning her own store will take a while, she says that if she works hard she knows her dreams can come true.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Ines' Group

texts.es:
La señora Inés es socia del Banco Comunal “Señor de la Justicia”, ubicado en la cuidad de Puno, provincia de Puno, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y es madre de 04 hijos, ella tiene educación superior (Profesora).  Vive en el Barrio Bellavista.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 2 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para adquirir papel para su librería.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, con este dinero ella comprará cuadernos, lapiceros, papelería en general y papeles de regalo, para aumentar en su negocio de librería.

Su deseo es poner una librería grande y bien surtida.

A ella le gustan los bajos intereses y la confianza que les brindan a las socias.
texts.en:
Inés is a member of the Señor de la Justicia Community Bank, which is located in the city of Puno, province of Puno, department of Puno. She is 38, married, and has four children. She has a college education (teacher). She lives in the Bellavista neighborhood. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for two years. With her first loan for 300 PEN she bought paper for her bookstore. She currently needs a loan for 1,000 PEN to buy notebooks, ballpoint pens, stationery, and gift paper to increase the inventory in her bookstore. Her wish is to set up a large, well stocked bookstore. She likes the low interest and the confidence given to the members.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy notebooks, ballpoint pens, stationery, and gift paper, etc.

loans.name: Lotis

texts.en:
Lotis D. C. has been helping her husband in their furniture making business. She does canvassing in different villages while her husband is busy in producing different kinds of furniture. Lotis also aims to be progressive in their business. She is now asking for financial support to further expand their business. They need to purchase more woods so that they could produce more products. She hopes that her PHP 6, 000 loans will be provided because it can make their business grow further. 

Lotis already has three children. She is married to Gabriel D. C. and they are peacefully residing at the village of Alinguigan 3rd, Ilagan, Isabela. Their eldest child, Diland is now ten years old and is studying in primary school, same with their second child who is Francies who is six years old. Their youngest child is just four years old.

loans.use: business expansion

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en: Roberto A. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. He is 28 years old and single. Roberto owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over six years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Roberto joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be his first from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en:
Mrs. Vanna C., 48, and her husband, Mr. Peam Thou, 49, have been married since 1980 and have five children: two sons and three daughters. On of them was married and lives in separated home, one daughter is a silk weaver and other three assist their parents in the business. They are living on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. 
Vanna is a silk weaver and assists her husband in producing Khmer noodle business. She wants to supplement another raising pigs business and after they grow big enough, she will get more extra income from the selling pigs. 
Therefore, Vanna is asking for a loan of 1,000 UDS to purchase piglets to raise.

loans.use: To use for raising pigs.

loans.name: Bolanla

texts.en: Bolanla is 42 years old and married with four children. She lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells all types of sarongs on a wholesale and retail basis to her customers. This is the high season for her business and she hopes to meet the requirements of her clients. Bolanla hopes for the loan amount of 150,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for the financial support

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Eveline

texts.en:
Eveline is married to Frank Peter and they have four children. She and her entire family are living in a house with five bedrooms. She is a very hard-working woman and has encountered some expenses in the family, such as the death of family members. 

She runs a scotch-egg selling business and a farming business with the support of her children and her changed husband. She will invest the loan in buying eggs, flour and seedlings for farming. With the previous loans she succeeded in providing her community with white stuff (a drink of white liquid from raffia palms) for their social activities. 

This will be her third loan from GHAPE, which she joined in 2007. She has been quite successful in the past with her business due to her location in the school campus (progressive college), the quality of her food and her reasonable prices. She has a strong customer base and is confident that she will be able to increase her sales. 
 
Part of the profits from this loan will be used for the school fees of her children. And the other part will be used to buy a plot of land. Eveline does not foresee a problem with her loan repayments. She intends to start repayment in the fourth month after taking the loan. 

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works toward the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Buy eggs, groundnut oil, flour

loans.name: Claudine

texts.fr: V. Claudine est née le 16 Juillet 1967 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à MONBOLOHOUN Affissou, Claudine est mère de quatre enfants tous scolarisés. Claudine vit depuis onze ans de cela, au quartier Avotrou à Cotonou, avec son mari et ses enfants. C'est Affisou qui assure les charges de la famille. Il y a trois ans de cela que Claudine vend de la nourriture (riz, pâte de maïs, accompagnés de sauce) dans son quartier. Claudine s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui a déja bénéficié de trois crédits à ALIDé, crédits qu'elle a bien remboursés. Pour renforcer son activité et augmenter la quantité de repas produite par jour, afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Claudine sollicite un quatrième crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
V. Claudine was born on July 16, 1967 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Married to MONBOLOHOUN Affissou, she is the mother of four children who are all in school. For eleven years, she has been living with her husband and children in the Avotrou district in Cotonou. Affissou is the one ensuring that family expenses are met. For three years, Claudine has been selling food (rice or cornmeal mash, served with sauces) in her district. She supplies herself from Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She is a previous ALIDé client who had three ALIDé loans before, which she has repaid. To bolster her business and to increase the quantity of meals produced per day, so as to satisfy her customers further, she's requesting a fourth ALIDé loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of rice corn; drums of peanut oil; and sauce condiments

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel Angel M. M. tiene 22 años de edad. 
Vive en casa de sus padres quienes le han brindado un espacio para que habite junto a su esposa e  hija de 1 año de edad.
Trabaja todos los días recorriendo los 3 mercados de Ica ( Toledo, Huancavelica, Sto. domingo). Se dedica a la venta de verduras y tuberculos desde las 5:30 am hasta las 2:30 pm esta actividad la realiza desde hace 3 años en forma continua.
Los señores gozan de buenas referencias de parte de los vecinos. Son una pareja joven que tienen el deseo de superarse poco a poco para comprar sus bienes y mas adelante poder tener el apoyo para construir al menos un ambiente propio que permita desarrollarse mejor.
Ellos desean el financiamiento para poder invertir un poco mas en su negocio ya que cuando traen la mercadería de Lima obtiene una mejor ganancia que les permite cubrir mejor sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Miguel Angel M. M. is a 22-year old man who lives with his wife and 1-year-old child in his parents' house. He sells root vegetables and greens in all three of Ica's markets (Toledo, Huancavelica, and Santo Domingo). He travels from one market to another from 5:30am to 2:30pm everyday.Miguel Angel has been doing this work for 3 years. He and his wife enjoy a good reputation with their neighbors. They are a young couple who want to improve their situation little by little, to buy a piece of land, and eventually to build a place to better develop their buisiness.They have requested this loan to enable them to purchase more in Lima, to increase their income and help them cover their needs.

Translated from Spanish by Linda Koza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy pagnes for dressmaking

loans.name: Gift

texts.en: Gift is 32 years old, married, blessed with a two-year-old child and caring for one dependent in school. He has a restaurant and pub business where he sells soda, food and other items. He has been in this business for over four years. He will use the loan to purchase crates of sodas and different food products for his business. He is a hardworking business man whose dream is to grow his business so that he will be able to provide accommodations to his clients for better profits.

loans.use: To purchase crates of sodas and food products for his business

loans.name: Ismoil

texts.en:
Ismoil is a very hard-working and responsible entrepreneur. He and his family live in Penjikent, Tajikistan. He is married with two children. Ismoil works in the central city market selling clothing: jeans, jackets, shirts and other items. His business is characterized by stability and consistent growth. He has been working in the market for five years. Once a month he travels to the neighboring city for purchasing new goods. Ismoil likes to work for himself. His business has been the main source of income for his whole family. Today Ismoil would like to ask for a loan of $2000 USD to purchase winter clothing from wholesalers and increase the assorted merchandise in his store. We believe Ismoil’s drive for success will help this young entrepreneur succeed and thrive in business. You can be an important part of the growth of Ismoil’s business.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing new clothing for resale.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a 54-year-old, hardworking farmer who rear birds and fish to sell. She has been in this farming business for 17 years. She harvests and sells her farm products to customers at retail prices. Restaurant owners patronize her a lot for fresh fish as they use it to prepare a special delicacy – pepper soup – for their customers. Victoria also sells eggs at home and at the nearby local market. The old birds are usually sold off at the end of the farming season and new birds are purchased for the next farming season.
Victoria manages the farm business with her children in Lagos State, Nigeria. She hopes to expand her business and improve her family's standard of living. She is requesting a loan of 70,000 NGN to purchase more birds and fish to rear and sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders for their assistance.

loans.use: To purchase more birds and fish to sell

loans.name: Juana De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
Muy alegre atiende a sus clientes la señora Juana A. en el Mercado Mayoreo donde ofrece frutas y verduras de todo tipo a los clientes que visitan el mercado.

Está solicitando un crédito para ser invertido en la compra de verduras para la venta, específicamente para la compra de chayotes para comercializarlos y de esta manera generar ingresos para el sustento de su hogar ya que su familia depende de ella.
texts.en:
Juana A. very cheerfully tends to her customers at the Mayoreo market; she offers all types of fruits and vegetables to customers that visit the market. She is asking for funding to buy vegetables, specifically chayotes (alligator pear), to sell and generate income to support her family who depend on her.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables.

loans.name: Gizelle

texts.en:
Gizelle is 45 years old, married and the mother of three children. Since 2002, she has made a living by owning a chocolate shop. She produces chocolates and makes designs and decorations for all kind of ceremonies, including weddings, baptisms, engagements, births and more. She is well known across the region for delicious sweets as well as beautiful and varied designs. 

Gizelle has applied for a loan for $1,000 to redesign her shop in order to attract new clients and increase her business productivity and her family's income.

loans.use: To refurnish her chocolate shop

loans.name: Nike

texts.en: Nike sells rechargeable phone cards and office stationery at retail prices to her customers. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes to expand her business. She has been in this business for three years and is making much progress in her business. She is 33 years-old and married with four children. Her children are progressing in school and this gives her joy as a mother. Her husband is an interior decorator and he also supports their home. She is requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase rechargeable phone cards to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase rechargeable phone cards to sell.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is 42 years old and married with two children who are in school. She offers cell phone money transfer services to earn a living. In addition  she sells cell phone sim cards and credit cards. She has been in this business for a long time and has five employees. Since joining Faulu Kenya and having access to loans, she has been able to educate her children to high school level. She has requested a loan of kes 80,000 from Faulu Kenya to open another cell phone money transfer shop. She hopes to grow her business and build her family a house in the future.

loans.use: To open a cell phone money transfer services shop.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina A. is from the village of Mauswagon, Calamba. She is 52 years old, married, and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Avelina owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs to sell. Avelina has been engaged in her business for over 16 years and earns approximately 3,100 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2005, Avelina joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This loan was used as additional capital for her business. Avelina is requesting a new loan of 10,500 PHP for her hog raising business. This loan will be her eighth from PMPC. 

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: As additional capital for her hog-raising business

loans.name: Salvador

texts.es: A la vivienda del joven Salvador
texts.en: Young Salvador

loans.use: The purchase of material to build a wall around his house.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchando Por El Progreso 3 Group

texts.en:
Marcelina is the coordinator of her group Luchando Por El Progreso (Fighting for Progress), and her story is representative both of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santiago, an area known for its tobacco production, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home there in a simple rented structure with her long-term partner and three children.

Marcelina is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza because she believes that the facilities offered by Esperanza will help her move forward. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business of selling a variety of goods including shoes, sheets and clothes by purchasing more merchandise. She will use the profits to purchase a freezer for her home which will improve her quality of life. Marcelina's long-term dream is to save towards owning her home. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase shoes, sheets and clothing to sell

loans.name: Nana M’Barka

texts.fr:
Madame  Nana M’barka H.   est âgée de 54 ans, mariée  et mère  de 6 enfants.  Elle  vit chez son mari  dans une grande famille traditionnelle au 1er  quartier de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ayant abandonné l’école en classe de 9 ème année fondamentale (système scolaire Malien) pour  se marier, elle a commencé le commerce auprès de sa mère qui vendait des salons marocains. Ayant passé plusieurs années d’apprentissage auprès de cette dernière, elle mena plusieurs activités génératrices de revenus telles que la vente de jus de fruits et finit par embrasser le commerce de moquettes, qu’elle mène depuis 3 ans et jouit d’une grande clientèle. Sa force de vente est due à la qualité de ses articles qui sont souvent des importations mais également à son prix abordable.
Dans le dessein d’augmenter son fonds de commerce, afin de réaliser plus de bénéfice, elle fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est à son 1er  prêt individuel qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter, 8 moquettes. Elle s’approvisionne à Tombouctou.
Madame Nana M’barka H.  vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60 000FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permet de participer à des événements sociaux (baptême, mariage etc.…) et de se prendre en charge. 
Son ambition est de promouvoir son commerce et d’aller en avant.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nana M’barka H. is 54 years old, married and mother of 6 children. She lives with her husband in a large traditional family in the first district of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Having abandoned school in the 9th primary grade (Malian education system) to get married, she started business beside her mother who sold Moroccan living rooms. After spending several years in apprenticeship at her side, she ran several income-generating businesses such as the sale of fruit juices. She wound up taking up the trade of carpets that she has been engaged in for 3 years and enjoys a large customer base. The strength of her sales is due to the quality of her products that are often imported but also to her affordable prices. With the objective of increasing the size of her business to make more profits, she turned to Soro Yiriwaso. This is her first individual loan that she intends to use to purchase 8 carpets. She gets her supplies in Tombouctou. Mrs. Nana M’barka H. sells cash and on credit to a customer base of women and men. With this loan, she plans to make a monthly profit of 60,000 CFA francs. This profit will enable her to take part in the funding of social events (christenings, weddings etc.…) and support herself. Her ambition is to promote her business and go forward.

Translated from French by Marie-Elodie Bazy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase carpets

loans.name: Veronica Yanet

texts.es:
Al visitar al banco comunal “Nueva Visión de Rumichaca” entrevistamos a la  señora Veronica. 

Verónica tiene 34 años, es conviviente, tiene dos hijos y vive en la comunidad de Rumichaca de la Ciudad de Urubamba.  Su principal actividad económica de Verónica es la administración de  su tienda de abarrotes que se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio. Su esposa de la socia se llama Ricardo y se dedica a la carpintería y de esa forma ayuda al ingreso económico de la familia. Ya son veinte años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Verónica participa en el banco comunal y le va muy bien porque es una persona responsable y puntual al momento de pagar sus cuotas, ella requiere el préstamo para comprar arroz, azúcar y fideos para abastecer su tienda. 
     
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
We interviewed Señora Veronica during our visit to the community bank "Nueva Visión (New Vision) de Rumichaca.” Veronica is 34 years old. She lives with her common law husband and has two children. They live in the community of Rumichaca in the city of Urubanba. Her main business activity is running her grocery store, which is located in her home. Her husband's name is Ricardo, and he works as a carpenter and in this way helps with the economic income of the family. Veronica has worked at this business for twenty years, and it is going very well for her, thanks to the effort that she puts into her work. Veronica participates in her community bank, and that is also going very well for her because she is a responsible person and is punctual in making her payments. She needs the loan to buy rice, sugar, and noodles to stock her store. This community bank member is thankful for the opportunity offered through this means and also promises to make her payments according to the schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, and noodles to stock her store

loans.name: Khoeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Khoeurn M., 32 years old and she is a villager who lives in Tuol Kandal village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Thoeun Teav, are farmers who own 2.90-hectares of land to cultivate rice for a living. For this farm, Mrs. Khoeurn M. decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer, pesticide, and rice seed and to pay for hire laborers to plow the farm. Aside from farmer, Mr. Thoeun Teav is also construction worker. With both of these occupations they are able to earn a small income to support their family. This couple has two children, who all are attending in the local school. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, pesticide, and rice seed and to pay for hire laborers to plow the farm.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita G.'s main source of income comes from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables to sell. She is 42 years old, married and has five school-age children. They are from the village of Dalig Viejo. Teresita has been in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 4,200 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2008, Teresita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase seeds, seedlings and young plants to grow. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be her fifth loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Kiano Ole

texts.en:
Kiano has been rearing and selling animals in Naivasha town for four years. He is 47 years old and married to Eunice Kutenoi, and they have three children.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend, and this will be his first loan. He plans to buy 15 goats to rear and sell later at a profit. Kiano hopes to venture into real estate in the future by building rental houses in Naivasha town.

loans.use: To buy 15 goats to rear and sell later at a profit

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie T. is 33 years old, separated from her spouse and has three school-aged children. She is from the village of General Balao, a part of Solana municipality in Cagayan province on the Luzon islands. Melanie sells Avon products to the local community. She has been in business for over three years and earns approximately 4500 PHP a month.

In 2009 Melanie joined ASKI to gain access to its financial services. Melanie is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, her second loan from ASKI, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use all additional revenue to expand her business.

About ASKI:

Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc., or ASKI, is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and -women, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mark Kipkosgei

texts.en:
Mark Kipkosgei S. is a 27-year-old businessman who operates a retail shop. He is married to Esleen S. who is 22 years old, and they have a one-year-old child. He runs his business in Kapseret,10km from Eldoret town, and has been in this business for the past six years.

Mark was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and he has no other history with any MFI. He is applying for his first loan of 20,000 KES with KADET LTD with which he plans to purchase three bags of sugar and four boxes of cooking oil.

He hopes to operate wholesale stores in Eldoret town in the future.

loans.use: To purchase three bags of sugar and four boxes of cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of flour

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
Gladis tiene 42 años y  es padre y madre para sus tres hijos. Actualmente, Gladis vive en la ciudad Andahuaylillas provincia de Quispicanchis de Departamento de Cusco. Gladis se dedica a la elaboración y venta de Jora  que sirve para la elaboración de chicha de Jora. 

Gladis desde hace mucho tiempo participa en el banco comunal “La Triunfadoras”. Con su próximo préstamo que espera recibir de S/. 2000 soles, ella invertirá en comprar maíz.   

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
