Gladis is 42 years old and both mother and father for her three children. Gladis currently lives in the city of Andahuaylillas in Quispicanchis province in the department of Cusco. Gladis makes and sells fermented corn that is used to make “chicha de jora”, a fermented corn beverage. 

Gladis has been participating in the communal bank “Las Triunfadoras” (The Winners) for a long time. With her next loan that she is waiting to receive, 2000 Peruvian Soles, she will invest in buying corn.

She is grateful for the opportunity provided and commits to making her payments on time.

loans.use: To buy corn

loans.name: Oscar Alexander

texts.es:
Oscar, reside en el municipio El Transito departamento de San Miguel, tiene 23 años y es empleado, él vive con su madre y sus hermanos, es casado y también vive con su esposa y su primer hijo de un año; en la casa todos trabajan.
Su trabajo lo inicio hace 2 años, en la terminal de buses del departamento de Usulután, su horario es de las 7:00am a 4:00pm, él está en proceso de arreglar y reparar su casa, motivo que le lleva a solicitar un préstamo para invertirlo en el piso y las puertas, esta ayuda le mejorara las condiciones a su vivienda y ofrecerá a su familia un hogar más seguro y limpio.
Su aspiración es pagar este préstamo puntualmente, desempeñar bien su trabajo para poder velar por  el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Oscar resides in the El Tránsito municipality in the San Miguel department of El Salvador. He is 23 years old and is an employee. He is married, and lives with his mother, his brothers, his wife and his first child who is one year old. Everyone in the house goes to work.

Oscar started his job at the bus terminal in the department of Usulután two years ago. He works from 7:00am to 4:00pm. He is in the process of fixing up his house, and he is therefore requesting a loan to pay for flooring and doors. This will help him improve the condition of his house and provide a cleaner safer home for his family.

His aspiration is to make his loan repayments on time and do well at his job so that he can look after his family's well-being.

loans.use: To repair the floors and doors of his house

loans.name: Confiando En Dios Group

texts.es:
el grupo solidario Confiando en Dios esta formado por dos mujeres y un hombre, se conocen desde hace mucho tiempo y juntos han logrado salir adelante con sus negocios y sus familias. a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellos realizan:

la señora Asuncion Agustina F. tiene 38 años de edad, tiene tres hijos que dependen de ella, recibe ayuda economica de su esposo, Asuncion se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de golosinas. gracias  a este negocio a podido salir adelante con su familia, ademas de hacer golosinas, vende pan, tamales. Estos productos los vende en su casa de habitacion y tambien por pedidos que le hacen sus clientes para ocaciones especiales.
el credito lo utilizara para invertirlo en su negocio.
 
el sr. Carlos Agusto M. H. tiene 32 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene personas que dependan de el, actualmente vive en casa de su mama junto con sus hermanos, Carlos tiene un molino para moler maiz, atiende a los vecinos y clientes de la zona, tambien sale a vender agua en su coche en los barrios y caserios aledaños a su comunidad.
el credito lo utilizara para invertirlos en la mejora de su molino y comprarse unas nuevas porras para
el acarreo del agua.
 
la sra. Santos Francisca F. H. tiene 33 años de edad, tiene dos hijos que dependen de ella y de su esposo el cual vive en los estados unidos y le ayuda economicamente para la alimentacion de sus dos hijos, doña Santos Francisca se dedica a vender refrescos, charamuscas y frescos naturales, de esta manera saca adelante a sus hijos con sus estudios y la alimentacion.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de refrescos ya que se aproxima la navidad y las ventas se mejoran.
texts.en:
The 'Confiando en Dios' (Trusting in God) communal bank is made up of two women and one man.  They have known each other for a long time and together they have managed to get ahead with their businesses and their families.  Below we will detail the different business activities that they carry out:

Mrs Asunción Agustina F. is 38 years old.  She has three dependent children.  She receives financial help from her husband.  Asunción makes and sells candies.  Thanks to her business, she has been able to get her family ahead.  As well as making candies, she also sells bread and tamales.  She sells these products from her home and also fills orders that her customers make with her for special occasions.  She will use her loan to invest in her business.

Mr Carlos Agusto M. H. is 32 years old.  He is single and doesn't have any dependents.  He currently lives in his mother's house together with his siblings.  Carlos has a mill for grinding corn.  He serves his neighbors and customers in the district.  He also goes out and sells water in his car through the neighborhoods and villages surrounding his community.  He will use his loan to invest in improving his mill and buying some new containers for carrying the water.

Mrs Santos Francisca F. H. is 33 years old.  She has two dependent children.  Her husband lives in the United States and helps her financially so that she can feed their two children. Doña Santos Francisco sells soft drinks, 'charamuscas' candy twists and natural drinks.  In this way she helps get her children ahead with their studies and helps to feed them.  She will use her loan to buy soft drinks as Christmas is approaching and this is a time when sales improve.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, soft drinks, meat, sugar, firewood, colorings, containers, spare parts for a mill, fruit, flavorings

loans.name: Tabitha Achieng

texts.en:
Tabitha Achieng O. is 26 years old, married to David Wanyonyi, and she is blessed with two beautiful children. She sells secondhand clothes in Mitume in Kitale Town. She has been in this business for two years and gets a monthly income of Kshs.20,000

This will be Tabitha's second loan from KADET, and she plans to use the loan to buy two bales of ladies dresses worth twenty thousand shillings and two bales of T-Shirts worth twenty thousand shillings. With the income she is going to get, she plans to educate her children, buy a plot of land in the future, diversify her business, and open another business.

Tabitha also wants to educate her children to the highest level, buy a lorry, and start transport business in Kitale.

loans.use: To buy secondhand clothes for resale

loans.name: Sonnia Estefania

texts.es:
Sonnia de 22 años, por la falta de oportunidad en distintos lugares que ha ido a buscar trabajo ella decidió ser comerciante de ropa porque así pasaba más tiempo con sus dos hijos de 6 y 4 años. Vende ropa desde hace años para poder ayudar con los gastos de su casa. Vive en el Fortín de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y lomas). 

Realiza su trabajo sola desde muy temprano, aunque no tienen muchos ingresos ella sigue trabajan ya que es madre soltera y quiere darle una buen vida a sus hijos, vende blusas, camisas, pantalones. No tiene horario fijo porque vende la ropa recorriendo las calles de tierra. Una de las dificultades que tiene son las caminatas que tiene que dar para poder llegar a las casas ya que la zona donde vive hay lomas muy empinadas. 

Ella quiere el préstamo para poder comprar ropa y con las ganancias asegurar la situación económica de su hijo. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa ya que ahora es de caña y que sus hijos terminen sus estudios con éxito.
texts.en:
Sonnia, 22, by the lack of opportunity at various places went looking for work.  She decided to become a clothing trader because she could spend more time with her two children, ages 6 and 4.  She has been selling clothes for years to help with household expenses.  She lives in the Fortín de Guayaquil (a semi-suburban area with dirt roads and hills).

She does her work alone very early,  Even though they don't have much income, she continues working since she is a single mother.and wants to give her children a good life.  She sells blouses, shirts, and pants.  She doesn't have a fixed schedule because she sells clothes on the street.  One of the difficulties that she has are the walks to reach the houses because that area has very steep hills.

She is requesting a loan to be able to buy clothes so that the earnings will ensure economic stability for her child.  In the future, she wants to finish building a house that is currently made of cane and she wants her children to finish their studies successfully.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ros

texts.en: Ros S., 61, is from Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  She is married to Varin, 80.  They are blessed with six children.  Four of them are married and two are single.  Ros S. and her husband depend on their children.  Three of their children work in the garment factory and one is a civil service officer.  Ros S. has an old house that needs repair.  Due to her lack of cash, she decided to ask for a loan through Kiva, which she will use to repair her house.

loans.use: to repair her existing house

loans.name: Abel

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE TORRECHAYOC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Abel; el tiene 33 años de edad y es soltero; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo en el sector educación, el es profesor del nivel primario y también es propietario de una escuela particular en el distrito de Calca llamado Signos de Fe, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de la escuela educativa y mejorar la educación. El  socio solicita el préstamo para implementar la escuela educativa.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the community bank "Señor de Torrechayoc". The bank is located in the district of Urubamba which belongs to the province of Urumbaba and the department of Cusco.

The member is Abel. He is 33 years old and is single. He alternates his daily activities with work in the educational sector. He is a grammar school teacher and also owns a private school in the Calca district called "Signos de Fe" (Signs of Faith). He wants to expand his school and improve the education. He is requesting the loan to implement the educational school. 

The member is happy for this loan and promises to make his loan payments.

loans.use: To implement an educational school.

loans.name: Santa Teresita Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son del barrio Santa Teresita de la cuidad de Caacupé.
La presidenta del comité es la señora María Odulia G., vive con su marido y sus 3 hijos, ella trabaja como empleada doméstica en su horas libres y vende empanadas.
Las integrantes de este comité están muy satisfechas con el apoyo económico que les están brindando la Fundación Paraguaya y KIVA, con este capital las señoras están aumentando sus pequeños negocios.
El comité Santa Teresita está en el cuarto ciclo de su programa, con una antigüedad de aproximadamente 2 años.
texts.en:
The women of this existing committee are from the neighborhood of Santa Teresita in the city of Caacupé.

The committee president is Sra. María Odulia G. who lives with her husband and three children. She works as a housekeeper in her spare time and sells empanadas.

The committee members are satisfied with the financial support provided by Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva. With this capital, the women have grown their small businesses. The Santa Teresita Committee is in its fourth loan cycle in the program and has been in existence for approximately two years.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Nilben

texts.en:
Nilben M. is from the town of Banga. He is 25 years old. Nilben is married and has 1 child. To make a living, Nilben plants and harvests rice for sale.  He also plants cassavas on parts of his land.

Nilben joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI and is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from this investment to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Ros

texts.en:
In Kompong Tom, Ros K. has been spending her life cultivating crops. This is a skill she learned from her grandparents when she was young. She is now married and has kids. Her husband works in the farm fields frequently alongside her. 

Growing crops is an annual action with which she has had great success. She is able to plant the crops at least twice a year in both rainy and dry seasons. She planted rice over one month ago, but her crops are not growing well because they need more fertilizer. To remedy the situation, she would like a loan to buy a few sacks of fertilizer and some piglets to raise.

loans.use: To buy a few sacks of fertilizer and some piglets to raise

loans.name: Jaclyn

texts.en:
Jaclyn L. is from the village of Poblacion 4, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 24 years old. Jaclyn is married and has one school-aged child. 

To make a living, Jaclyn runs a general store. She has been engaged in this business for over a year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. 

In 2011, Jaclyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Jaclyn is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase rice and corn grits to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Jaclyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase rice and corn grits to sell

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es:
Basilia tiene 54 años D. edad y nació en la comunidad D. Quillabamba. Actualmente, Basilia vive en la comunidad D. Cotowincho, Urubamba, Cusco. Basilia se dedica a la venta D. verduras, ella es proveedora D. verduras D. las vendedoras del mercado D. Aguas Calientes, ella viaja cuatro veces a la semana llevando sus productos los días martes, miércoles, vieres y domingo. Basilia en esta oportunidad requiere el micro crédito para comprar verduras.

Basilia pertenece al banco comunal “Kuska Llankasun D. Rumichaca” D. la Asociación Arariwa  y trabaja con sus compañeras del banco comunal desD. hace varios años. (La comunidad Cotowincho se encuentra ubicada a 10 minutos D. la ciudad D. Urubamba donD. los socios se reúnen cada treinta días para realizar sus actividades correspondientes.)
texts.en:
Basilia is 54 years of age and was born in the community of Quillabamba. At present, Basilia lives in the community of Cotowincho, Urubamba, Cusco. Basilia is dedicated to selling produce. She is the provider of vegetables of the saleswomen of the Aguas Calientes market.  She travels four times a week carrying her products on Tuesday, Wednesday, Friday and Sunday.  At this time, Basilia requires a loan to buy vegetables.  

Basilia belongs to the "Kuska Llankasun of Rumichaca" communal bank of the Arariwa Association and has worked with her companions of the communal bank for several years.  (The community of Cotowincho is located some 10 minutes from the city of Urubamba where the associates gather every thirty days to carry out their corresponding activities.)

loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: Fredy Humberto

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SAN RAFAEL”; Este banco está ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac,  provincia de Cusco y  departamento de Cusco.

El Sr. Fredy, es conviviente y tiene 38 años de edad, el tiene 2 hijos de 6 y 4 años; el socio se dedica  ala venta de productos de consumo masivo, el socio vende y distribuye detergentes, jabones, desmanches,, desinfectantes, entre otros productos. El socio suele solicitar el préstamo para invertir en su hogar en algunos arreglo y mejoras de su casa o comprar muebles o también en la compra de productos al por mayor para vender de forma independiente. El socio solicita el préstamo para poder comprar de los mayoristas productos de limpiezas y repartirlos en forma independiente.

El socio valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "SAN RAFAEL" communal bank which is located in the district of Huanchac, in the province and department of Cusco.

Mr. Fredy is 38 years old, has a live-in partner and two children, ages 6 and 4.  He is in the business of selling and distributing consumer products such as detergent, soap, stain-remover, disinfectant and other products.  Fredy usually requests a loan for home improvement and to buy furniture, and wholesale products to sell independently.  This loan will be used to buy wholesale cleaning products for independent distribution.

He is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy wholesale cleaning products and work independently

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
Judith tiene 43 años, vive con su madre y su hija en su  casa propia.

Desde hace 9 años trabaja ofreciendo el servicio de cosmetología, ofrece este servicio a domicilio a las personas que le solicitan  un tratamiento capilar, corte, peinado, teñido de cabello, etc. Su trabajo es de todos los días y siempre esta  muy al pendiente de sus clientes ya que este trabajo lo puede realizar en cualquier horario que les soliciten, también ofrece  productos de belleza a sus clientes. Adicionalmente a esta actividad también cultiva maíz en su terreno heredado. Este trabajo le permite tener los ingresos para  los gastos familiares es por ello que se proyecta a tener su salón de belleza con todos sus equipos. 

Es su crédito número 27 que tiene un crédito con MFP, tiene amplia trayectoria de trabajo solidario en el banco comunal que actualmente integra y se siente muy orgullosa de su permanencia ya que aprendió bastante del trabajo en equipo. 

El dinero lo invertirá en la compra de algunos artículos y productos de belleza para sus ventas.
texts.en:
Judith is 43 years old. She lives with her mother and her daughter in her own house.

 For nine years, she has worked offering cosmetic services. This service is provided at the clients’ homes who request hair treatments, haircuts, hairstyling, hair dyeing, etc. She works every day and she is very attentive to her customers since she can work whenever they request an appointment. She also offers beauty products to them. In addition to this work, she grows corn in an inherited plot of land. This work allows her to have income for the family expenses and she is able to have her beauty salon with all the necessary equipment. 

This is her 27th loan with MFP. She has had significant experience of working well with her current communal bank. She is very proud of her ongoing participation since she has learned a lot from working in a group.

 The loan will be invested in the purchase of a few beauty tools and products for her sales.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products

loans.name: Emilsa Floricelda

texts.es: Emilsa Floricelda: es dueña de una tienda de productos comestibles de primera nececidad en la aldea donde vive ella es madre soltera de 48 años y tiene tres hijos ella nos cuenta que nececita este credito para la compra de productos comestibles de primera nececidad, como aguas gaseosas, frijol,arroz etc, ella nos cuenta que nececita mas capital para trabajar ya que quiere surtir mas su tienda para tene mas productos para ofrecer a sus clientes,su sueño es tener un local mas grande y poder ayudar a  sus hijas,
texts.en: Emilsa Floricelda owns a grocery store in the town where she lives.  She is a 48 year-old single mother with 3 children.  She tells us that she needs this loan to buy basic groceries such as sparkling water, beans, rice, etc.   She says that she needs more capital for her business, since she wants to have more products in her store to offer to her customers.  Her dream is to have a bigger store, and to be able to help her daughters.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell in her store

loans.name: Clara

texts.es: Clara tiene 44 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 13 años se dedica a la venta de verduras en un mercadillo dentro de su localidad y  que esta muy cerca de su casa. Es así que cada mañana empieza a vender y dura hasta el medio día. Pero generalmente sus días de trabajo empiezan desde la madrugada donde tiene que ir al mercado central mayorista, donde llegan camiones de verduras para comprarlos a un menor precio. De esta manera le resulta favorable su negocio, por que como comerciante intermediario puede aumentar el precio y llevar la mercadería hasta zonas menos accesibles donde no hay mucho comercio. El gusto por abastecerse de verduras frescas es un punto a favor para que los clientes siempre acudan su establecimiento. De las ganancias que percibe lo administra para invertir y para el sostenimiento de su familia. Por tal seguirá trabajando con el objetivo de aumentar sus ganancias y establecer su puesto de ventas; por ello espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para cumplir tal propósito. Este será su crédito número 19 con MFP,  considera que es muy favorable ser parte de su banco comunal porque le permite compartir experiencias y tener siempre a la mano un apoyo financiero. Con el crédito que solicita, podrá comprar al por mayor algunos productos de temporada  como papa, camote y yuca.
texts.en:
Clara, 44, lives with her husband their 4 children in their own house.  !3 years ago she began selling vegetables in a street market very close to her house.  Every morning she starts selling and continues until noon.  But generally her work days begin at dawn when she has to go to the main wholesale market where the trucks come with the vegetables and she can buy them at a lower price.  This is the why she has done well since as a middleman, she can raise the prices and take the merchandise to more remote areas where there isn’t much business.  

The pleasure of stocking fresh vegetables is a point in her favor since the customers always come to her.  She uses the earnings to invest in the business and to support her family.  She will continue working with the idea of increasing her income and set up a stall.  For this she is depending on each one of you to help her fulfill the plan.  This is her 19th loan with MFP.  She considers being part of a communal bank helpful because it allows her to share experiences and to always have assistance with financing.  She will use the loan to buy seasonal  products wholesale such as potatoes, yams and yucca.

loans.use: To buy potatoes, yams and yucca wholesale

loans.name: Joslyne

texts.en: Joslyne is 33 years old and she has a one-year-old child. Her husband is a businessman. Joslyne sells locally made beer.She has been selling beer for the past eight years and it has enabled her make some savings for her child and the others she hopes to have in the future. She is requesting a loan to buy more beer and hence make more profits. With the profits she plans to save for her child's school fees and meet her family's needs as well.

loans.use: to buy more beer to sell.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a 35-year-old single mother with one child who is in secondary school.  She has been in business for ten years and makes a monthly income of 6,000 KES. Pauline will use this loan to purchase beauty products for her business. She plans to save the profits from her business to pay for her son’s education. 

This is Pauline's first loan with KADET. She hopes to develop and expand her salon to become more modern. She also hopes to continue paying for her son’s education and improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: buy beauty products for her salon

loans.name: Miguel Hernan

texts.es:
Miguel Herman tiene 35 años, Es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos , en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. CIUDADELA LOS ANGELES, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto los Ángeles, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores como siembre de maíz y arroz.

Miguel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz  . Compra sus productos en Comercial Procan y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueño es aumentar la produccion.

Le gusta hacer deporte con la familia.
texts.en:
Miguel Herman is 35, married and lives with his wife and children in the Ventanas Canton in the province of Los Ríos.

The communal bank CIUDADELA LOS ANGELES is located in the community of Los Ángeles, which belongs to the Ventanas Canton.  This group is involved in agriculture, mainly growing corn and rice.

Miguel grows corn and rice, buying his supplies in Comercial Procan and selling his produce at the wholesale market in Ventanas.

He is requesting a loan to buy supplies and fertilizer so he can begin planting.  With the help of the loan he will be able to buy what he needs.  His dream is to increase production.

He enjoys taking part in sports with his family.

loans.use: To buy supplies and fertilizer for his crops.

loans.name: Ana Martha

texts.es:
La  señora Martha solicitó el préstamo para comprar insumos para la elaboración de tamales.
Gracias a los préstamos la señora Martha  ha  cambiado su negocio no solo vende tamales también, antojitos mexicanos  en las noches su esposo Jesús le construyo una ramada compraron mesas y sillas para cuando vayan los clientes a comer.
Sin embargo al tener estos gastos ella necesita dinero para poder comprar mas insumos y seguir conb su negocio de tamales y de antojitos mexicanos.
La va muy bien en su negocio sus hijos Luis Antonio de  doce años de edad y Lourdes de  veinte un años, le ayudan en ir a comprar las cosas que  necesita y en atender a sus clientes.
Esta muy contenta  por que le va muy bien en su negocio, obtiene  muy buenas ganancias y puede ayudar a sus hijos para que terminen sus estudios.
Su mejor sueño es tener un restaurante y que sus hijos terminen de estudiar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Martha has requested a loan to buy supplies for her tamale business.  Thanks to such loans Martha has been able to expand her business to include selling Mexican snacks at night.  Her husband, Jesús, built a covered area for her and they bought tables and chairs for customers to come and eat.

But because of these expenses she needs money to buy ingredients to continue with her business, which is doing well.  Her children, Luis Antonio, 12, and Lourdes, 20, help her shop for the things she needs and to attend customers.

She is content with how her business is doing since she earns a good profit, allowing her to help her children finish their education.  Her dream is to have her own restaurant and for her children to finish school.

loans.use: To buy flour, meat, chili peppers, etc., to make tamales.

loans.name: Chansit Thou

texts.en:
Chansit thou, pictured here, is 30 years old and her husband, Dyna, is 38. The couple lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1998 and have a young daughter.

Chansit thou runs grocery store at home and her husband works for bakery. She is requesting a 1,000 USD loan to buy more grocery items to sell.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to sell

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married woman with one girl who attends school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past seven years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuation of products in the market. Her major dream is to establish a retail shop in the future. 

With the 20,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) she wants to start another business of selling water, purchasing taps and water pipes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To start another business of selling water, purchase taps and water pipes.

loans.name: Karurama Group

texts.fr:
Esperance est une commerçante âgée de 30 ans qui habite la  commune de Rugombo de la Province de Cibitoke a l’Ouest du Burundi. Elle fait le commerce de produits alimentaires consommables dans un restaurant depuis 3ans. Elle a fait ses études jusqu’au niveau de l’école primaire en 6e année. Elle est mère de 2 enfants dont 2étudient. Elle  arrive au 4e cycle dans le crédit Communautaire avec Turame. 

Elle demande le crédit Kiva pour  accroitre son capital  en achetant de grandes quantités de produits alimentaires pour son restaurant et ainsi pouvoir accroitre ses économies. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  solidaire« KARURAMA»
texts.en:
Esperance is a businesswoman of 30 who lives in the commune of Rugombo in the province de Cibitoke in the west of Burundi. She has been selling consumable foodstuffs in a restaurant for three years. She studied up to the sixth year of primary school. She is the mother of two children; both are enrolled in school. She is on her fourth community loan with Turame. 

She is requesting this Kiva loan to grow her working capital by buying large quantities of foodstuffs for her restaurant so as to able to put aside more in savings. 

She is a member of the solidarity group «KARURAMA».

loans.use: to grow her capital by buying big quantities of foodstuffs for her restaurant so as to be able to put aside more in savings.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a married woman with six children, five of whom attend school while one is still young for school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past two years she has operated a retail shop, selling to neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation. She dreams of having her own wholesale business.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase bags of sugar, wheat flour and maize flour. She decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bags of sugar, wheat flour and maize flour.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 48 years old and married with eight children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell in her store.

Editha has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 10 years and also earns an income from hog raising.

Editha aspires to save money to expand her businesses.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Njuguna

texts.en:
Njuguna, a 46-year-old man, is married and has two children. To earn a living, he sells kerosene. He has been in the business for ten years. He has employed two people in his business. He also owns rental houses which earn him extra income. 

Njuguna hopes to expand his business and employ more people. He has requested 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy kerosene.

loans.use: To buy kerosene

loans.name: Puchucollo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PUCHUCOLLO” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Collpani, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Concepción. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de leche, venta de ganado, cría de ganado, venta de flores, venta de ovejas.
 
La señora Concepción,  indica que es la primera ves integra  Pro Mujer  y que ingreso por invitación de la asesora de crédito. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de crianza de ganado que viene trabajando hace años atrás, aprendo este oficio de su mamá.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra vaca lechera) que comprará la feria y posteriormente lo criará en su casa. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia pues ella es casada  y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro.
texts.en:
The “Puchucollo” communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani Center.  It has nine members led by a governing board headed by Concepción.  The members of the communal bank carry out a variety of businesses.  Among them are: milk sales, livestock sales, raising livestock, flower sales and sheep sales.

Concepción indicates that this is the first time she joins Pro Mujer; she was invited to do so by the credit advisor.  She currently raises livestock, a business she’s had for many years having learned it from her mother.

The loan she’ll take out is to increase her working capital (to buy a dairy cow).  She will buy it at the livestock exchange and then raise it at home.  This way of working allows her to generate income to provide for her family since she’s married and has a son.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the savings.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es: Teófilo, de 39 años, es un hombre singular. Vive en compañía de Nery, su esposa desde hace 20 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos: Ludina, Mary e Nicol; a los que cuidan en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Pamuri. Como todo hombre trabajador. Él se levanta muy temprano, para poder cortar el alimento para las 9 vacas que posee, según cuenta la leche que le brinda, les ayuda para la elaboración de queso. Todos los días realiza un promedio de 35 a 40 “bolillos” (quesos pequeños), ya es muy conocido, tanto así que a veces viaja a la capital del país y a la ciudad de Huancayo a vender sus productos. Por otro lado su esposo se dedica a la siembra de productos oriundos de la zona como: papa. Arveja y olluco, en sus propios terrenos, ya tiene 20 años de experiencia en esto y según afirma es lo mejor que paso, ya que tiene un ingreso extra al hogar y ayudará a su esposa en los gastos de alimentación y vestido. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Santa Cruz” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera de un pequeño préstamo para seguir con sus objetivos. Además promete ser puntual con sus cuotas. Teófilo, de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de una vaca de buena raza y un poco para su negocio.
texts.en: Teófilo is 39 years old and a remarkable man. He lives with Nery, his wife of 20 years. They have 3 chidren, Ludina, Mary and Nicol, who they take care of in their own house which is located in the hamlet of Pamuri. Like every working man, he gets up very early in the morning so as to cut the grass as food for the 9 cows he owns. According to him, the milk they give helps them with the cheese making. He makes about 35-40 "balls" (small cheeses). He is very well known now, so much so that he sometimes travels to the capital of the country and the city of Huancayo to sell his products. Alternatively, his wife plants local products, native to the area, such as potatoes, peas and olluco (a tuber) on their own land. She has 20 years experience doing this and it is the best thing that could have happened as it gives them an additional income for the household and will help her husband with clothing and food expenses. He belongs to the communal bank "Santa Cruz" and this is the 1st loan with MFP, from whom he hopes to get a small loan to reach his goals. In addition, he promises to be punctual with his repayments. Teófilo, on receiving your support, will invest the money requested to purchase a cow of good stock and use a little for his business.

loans.use: to  buy a cow.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en: Marlyn is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. Marlyn has operated a shop selling frozen food such as hotdogs, tocino (cured meat) and bacon for 4 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy stocks of frozen food to sell. Marlyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of frozen food to sell

loans.name: Edisson Alexi

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Virgen Del Rosario se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi (Portoviejo), conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. En este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes se dedican a la fabricación de botones de tagua, artesanía y comercio en general.

Aquí conocimos a Edisson, tiene 20 años  de edad, está soltero y vive en casa de sus padres. El estudia el segundo nivel de Pedagogía musical en una Universidad de Portoviejo. Lleva tres  ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos está logrando sacar adelante su carrera.

El además de sus estudios también se dedica al comercio, compra y vende de sal en grano, todos los fines de semana se desplaza hasta la ciudad de Salinas para comprar este producto, luego lo trae en un camión que alquila y lo  lleva a entregar a Manta, San Jacinto y Montecristi donde ya tiene muchos clientes a quienes les vende. Lleva en este negocio por 2 años y gracias a esto está logrando sacar adelante sus estudios ya que estos requieren de muchos recursos económicos.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar sal en grano. 

Su sueño es comprar un carro para no tener que pagar fletes y obtener más ganancias para él.
texts.en:
The Virgin of the Rosary Community Bank meets each fifteen days in Colorado del Canton Montecristi (Portoviejo). This area is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for it’s internationally and nationally known crafts. In this area, the majority of the people work manufacturing tagua buttons, crafts or they do general commercial activities. In this place we meet Edisson. He is 20 years old, single and lives with his parents. He studies music at the University of Portoviejo. He has had three loan cycles with the Community Bank. Thanks to the loans he has been able to advance his career.
In addition to his studies, he also has a business on the weekends buying and selling granulated salt. He goes to the city of Salinas to buy his product. He transports it in a rented truck. He brings it to Manta San Jacinto and Montecristi where he has many customers to whom he sells his product. He has been doing this business for the past two years. Thanks to this business he has been able to progress with his studies. His studies require a lot of economic resources. 
This loan will be used to buy granulated salt.
His dream is to buy a car so that he doesn’t have to rent transportation. In this way he will have more earnings.

loans.use: to buy granulated salt.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris is 45 years old and lives in Sinkor.  She is married and has five children, ages 4 to 27, four of which are presently in school and live at home,. For the past twenty years she has been selling fresh cassava fish in the local market.   Doris enjoys her business a lot because she has many customers.  She is requesting a loan to purchase fresh cassava fish for her business.  She hopes to send her children to quality schools in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase  fresh cassava fish for her business

loans.name: Nanci Judith

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal María Monserrate se reúne cada quince días en la ciudad de Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Nanci, ella tiene 57 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos, dos mayores de edad e independientes y los dos menores de edad aun viven con ella y estudian en colegio. Su marido es chofer. Ella es licenciada en Ciencias DE La Educación.
 
Ella trabaja de  maestra en una escuela de la localidad, pero también se dedica al comercio, vende semijoyas de Romanel y productos Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), trabaja todos los días en todas sus actividades, sus productos los vende los últimos días de la semana aunque también les vende a sus compañeras de la escuela, deja a crédito y cobra cada fin de semana, lleva en este negocio por más de 12 años y estos productos los compra en una distribuidora en Manta.

Este crédito es justamente para comprar semijoyas de Romanel como: cadenas, pulseras, collares y cosméticos de Yanbal. Está en el Banco Comunal 13 años y le gusta por los beneficios que brinda la institución. 

Sus metas son seguir trabajando y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
The communal bank María Monserrate meets twice a month in the city of Montecristi, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its handicrafts, that are recognized nationally and internationally. This is where the famous straw hats come from.

In this place lives Nanci. She is 57 years old. She is married and from this relationship she has 4 children. Two are older and independent and the two younger ones are still living with her and they are school students. Her husband is a driver. She has a degree in Education. 

She works as a teacher in a neighborhood school, but she also is a merchant, selling the brand of Romanel jewelry and Yanbal (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and ladies accessories), working every day in all her activities. She sells her merchandise at the end of the week but she also sells them to her school colleagues, giving them credit and collecting payment every weekend. She has been in this business for more than 12 years and she buys her merchandise from a distributor in Manta.

This loan is just in order to buy Romanel jewelry such as chains, bracelets, and necklaces and cosmetics from Yanbal. She has been with the communal bank for 13 years and she is happy for the benefits that the institution has given her.

Her goals are to continue working and to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy chains, bracelets, necklaces and cosmetics

loans.name: Nilo Marcio

texts.es: El emprendedor Nilo Marcio es una persona con actitud positiva, tiene objetivos y metas para el futuro, tiene  una actividad económica que es la venta de recarga, gaseosas entre otras productos que día a día a desempeña con mucho esfuerzos, este negocio lo emprendió por la necesidad de tener ingresos para la familia. Nilo ya ha tenido crédito con Fundación León 2000, en el cual ha sido un cliente excelente, el invirtió el crédito en el aumento del inventario del negocio. Nilo Marció está solicitando crédito para poder abastecerse en productos como recargas, jugos gaseosas, bolsitas y refrescos naturales entre otros productos y brindarle a sus clientes un buen servicio.
texts.en:
Nilo Marcio is an enterprising person with a good attitude.  He has goals and objectives for the future.

His business is selling cell phone recharges, soft drinks, and other products.  He puts forth great effort day to day.  He began in this business because he needed to have income for his family.

Nilo has already had a loan from Fundación León 2000.  He was an excellent client, and he used the loan to increase inventory in his business.

Nilo Marcio is requesting a loan to be able to stock up on products like recharges, juice, soft drinks, bags, natural soft drinks, and other products to offer his customers good service.

loans.use: to buy recharges, juice, soft drinks, bags, natural soft drinks, and other products.

loans.name: Maria De Las Mercedes

texts.es: La señora Maria de las Mercedes a sus 51 años, depende del cultivo de tomates y hortalizas que aprendió a hacer por sus padres y su familia. De esta actividad a podido pagar los gastos que le genera el hogar en el cual vive con sus 2 hijos. La señora Maria tiene toda su fe puesta en el cultivo de estos tomates y hortalizas para sacar a sus hijos adelante y brindarles el estudio que necesitan, sin embargo, las fuertes lluvias han amenazado con destruir los plásticos con los que cubre sus cultivos de la misma, lo que ha producido que algunos de sus cultivos se pierdan y otros no salgan de muy buena calidad. En la búsqueda de que su cultivo salga adelante, la señora Maria de las Mercedes necesita adquirir unos nuevos plásticos que impidan el ingreso de la lluvia y protejan sus cultivos para poder que salgan de buena calidad y poderlos vender a un buen precio.
texts.en:
Maria de las Mercedes at her 51 years of age depends on growing tomatoes and vegetables, which she learned to do from her parents and relatives. This work pays the household expenses where she lives with her two children. 

Maria has all her faith in growing these tomatoes and vegetables as a way for moving her children forward and providing them with the education they need. 

However, the strong rains have threatened to destroy the plastic covering she uses to cover her plants and so some of them have been lost and others have not been of very good quality. 

In search of a way to have a good crop, Maria de las Mercedes needs to buy some new plastic to prevent the entry of rain and to protect her plants so that she can have a good quality crop and sell them at a good price.

loans.use: to buy a plastic awning to cover her plants from the rain

loans.name: Alberta

texts.es: Alberta, de 30 años es una mujer sociable y trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a sus 04 queridos hijos, quienes son el impulso de todos sus esfuerzos. Los verdes campos del poblado, ubicado en la selva baja, han sido en la vida de Alberta un lugar muy agradable para trabajar, desde muy pequeña sus padres le enseñaron a cultivar café, y ahora ella tiene sus propias tierras en las que trabaja con mucho esmero y sacrificio. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así ve la calidad de sus frutos. Lleva 14 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos desde su comunidad hasta los centros de acopio situado en la ciudad de San Francisco. Con el tiempo, espera juntar el dinero suficiente para comprar nuevas tierras. Este será el crédito número 08 con MFP, sabe que tiene la responsabilidad de pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y está dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia que pone el orden a todo el grupo. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles; le servirá para comprar plantas de café y poder incrementarsu producción.
texts.en:
Alberta, 30, is a sociable, hardworking woman living in her own house with her beloved four children who are the motivating factors behind all her efforts.  The green fields in her community which is located in the low jungle have been a very pleasant place for Alberta to work in her life.  

Since childhood her parents taught her to farm coffee and now she has her own lands that she works with much dedication and sacrifice.  What she likes most about her work is cultivating the land because that’s how she sees the fruits of her labor.  She’s been in this line of work for 14 years and considers the most difficult part having to transport her crops from her community to the gathering centers located in the city of San Francisco.  In time, she hopes to save enough money to buy new land.

This will be MFP loan #8.  She’s aware that she must make all her installment payments punctually and is determined to do so.  She’s the member of the communal bank who imposes order on the entire group.  The 1000 new soles will be used to buy coffee plants to be able to increase production.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants.

loans.name: Vaghinak

texts.en: Vaghinak is 43 years old and he lives in Tsaghkunk village of Gegharkunik region. Here he lives with his two children; his son is unemployed now and he is looking for some job and his daughter is a student. Vaghinak is a farmer and all day long he is busy in his farm with various works about it. He takes care of his farm cattle (he has cows, calves, bulls, sheep and chickens). He also cultivates potato on his plot of land which brings the main part of his family income.  As mentions Vaghinak it is very hard but very important for him to provide his student daughter with all she needs and also to help his son to cover his needs until he will find some job. His farm products Vaghinak sells right from his farm to his regular customers. This loan of 700.000 Armenian drams he needs as he decided to enlarge the number of his livestock with two more calves and also he will buy fodder for all his farm cattle.

loans.use: to enlarge the number of his livestock with two more calves and also he will buy fodder for all his farm cattle

loans.name: Adjo

texts.en:
Born in 1965 in Ahavé (Zio prefecture), Ms. Adjo G. is a married mother of three children. She has been selling okra, peppers and tomatoes for 20 years. As her husband does not have a stable income and is unable to meet the family\\\'s needs, the majority of the family\\\'s expenses are her responsibility. Serious and honest in the management of her business, Adjo has proven herself to be a trustworthy woman through two loans that were obtained and repaid without incident. She deserves to be supported once again to allow her business to grow and diversify.

To do so, Ms. Adjo G. is requesting a loan of $850 to buy baskets of tomatoes, okra and peppers in order to sell them wholesale to retailers. With the income, she will be able to improve her economic situation and that of her family.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1965 à Ahavé (P/Zio), Madame G. Adjo est mariée est mère de trois (03) enfants. Elle exerce le commerce de gombo, piments et tomate depuis déjà 20 ans. Son mari, n’ayant pas de revenu fixe, n’arrive pas à subvenir aux besoins du foyer, ce qui fait que la grande partie des charges familiales se repose sur la femme. Sérieuse et honnête en matière de gestion de ses activités, Adjo a fait preuve d’une femme de confiance à travers ses deux crédits obtenus et bien remboursés sans incident. Elle mérite encore d’être soutenue pour accroître et diversifier ses activités.

Pour ce faire, Madame G. Adjo sollicite un crédit de $850 pour s’acheter les paniers de tomates, gombo et piments afin de les vendre en gros aux détaillants. Avec le revenu, elle pourra améliorer sa situation économique et celle da sa famille.

loans.use: Sale of okra, tomatoes and peppers

loans.name: Angel

texts.en:
Angel A. Angel is an exceptional guy. He came to us originally about a year ago in search of a loan to start a small bike repair shop in the Roma ghetto in Sliven, Bulgaria. He was one of our first clients and has turned out to be the one in which we have the most pride. The Roma are viewed by most ethnic Bulgarians as lazy, shifty and entirely untrustworthy; Angel has completely upended that stereotype.

When we met, Angel had worked at a bike repair shop in the commercial center of Sliven for close to 15 years. Upon the shop’s closing, he aimed to strike out on his own and start a shop within the Roma ghetto. 20,000 Roma live in the neighborhood in conditions that are shockingly below the European average. Biking isn’t the leisure activity it is for many in the West; rather, for many it is the only affordable way to get around. For the most part, bikes that the Roma ride have only one gear on a small frame.

After being denied his loan by six banks, Angel heard about our nascent program. With a loan of $850, Angel turned a part of his concrete home into his workshop, purchased metalworking tools and bought the supplies he would need. After a busy summer of work, his business slowed in the late fall with the turn in weather. However, Angel figured out a way to put his metalworking tools to work and began repairing and making doors and window frames for neighborhood clients. Six weeks ago, some of his tools broke and he needed to purchase new ones for which we made him a supplemental loan. In the process, he impressed the metalworking sales agent to the point where he became a leasing agent for the company.

Angel now has three lines of business. His achievements are remarkable and have been featured in national newspapers. Angel is a great role model for many in his neighborhood. This loan will be to cover his new equipment and provide a new line of working capital to all three of his lines of business. Angel's original posting is here:

http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=274

The photo here shows Angel in front of his shop. The sign behind him, translated literally, reads "Metalworking tools, services of leasing."

loans.use: Working capital and capital expenditures.

loans.name: Narzullo

texts.en: Narzullo S. has been trading for 7 years. He sold washing goods for two years, and then he decided to sell stationery as he liked it better. He purchases his goods in central Khujand's market. He will use his loan to buy more inventory. Narzullo is from a big family, and he has five little brothers. His parents are still alive, and he helps all of them.  Recently he helped to arrange the wedding for his middle brother. Narzullo has three daughters, and his wife also trades in the local market. They live in a small flat.  He plans to construct a house and then move there.

loans.use: Activity extension

loans.name: Dora Elia

texts.es:
"I don't feel safe in my house because I don't have protection around so I would like to build a wall in the front for my family's security." I'm asking for $1,200 to build a wall.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

“No me siento segura en mi casa ya que no tengo protecciones alrededor asi es que me gustaría levantar una barda al frente para la seguridad de mi familia”. Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para levantar una barda

loans.use: Build a wall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy products for the salon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in higher quality fabrics

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
Liz Mabel, 20 years old, is a cheerful and entrepreneurial young lady with innumerable plans and projects for her future. Despite her scarce financial resources, she decided to push herself and study a professional career in accounting in a very prestigious university in her city. In an effort to cover expenses from her university studies, she found a way to obtain an income selling cosmetics which, thanks to her persuasive skills and the popularity of her products, she offers to friends, teachers and classmates, obtaining optimal results. This young entrepreneur’s wish is to increase her investment capital, and for this she resorts to your gracious support. She is requesting a loan so that after its investment, she can accomplish her goal of one day becoming a professional and developing efficiently in her career.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Liz Mabel de 20 años de edad, es una alegre y emprendedora muchacha con innumerables planes y proyectos para su vida futura, pese a sus bajos recursos económicos, decidió esforzarse y estudiar la carrera profesional de contabilidad en una universidad muy prestigiosa de su ciudad.Para cubrir de algún modo sus gastos de estudios superiores encontró la manera de obtener ingresos económicos, vendiendo cosméticos, producto que gracias a la popularidad que tiene y a su don de persuasión le está permitiendo ofrecer y vender a sus amistades, docentes y compañeras de su centro de estudio, obteniendo resultados muy óptimos.El deseo que tiene esta emprendedora es aumentar su capital de inversión y para esto recurre a tu gentil apoyo y hace la solicitud de un préstamo que luego de su inversión le permitirá cumplir con su anhelo de ser algún día profesional y desempeñarse eficientemente en su carrera.

loans.use: Increase her capital to purchase a greater quantity and variety of beauty products.

loans.name: Masanafu (I) Group

texts.en:
Natasha is 34 years old and married with two children. She offers tailoring services but mainly sews school uniforms. She intends to take a tailoring course with the extra profits.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more sewing machines and enhance her tailoring skills

loans.name: Fortunato

texts.es:
Fortunato is a vigorous and hard-working 28-year-old. When he completed high school, he decided to leave his childhood home of Saman, Peru, in search of a better quality of life. He currently resides in Juliaca and makes a living in the moving service with his three-wheeler and is also employed by a local bricklaying business. With his efforts and tireless hours of work he has been able to purchase land to build a small home. His hope is to finish the construction and have his own roof over his head. With this goal in mind, this enterprising young man asks for your support and is grateful for your kind heart.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Fortunato, es un vigoroso y trabajador muchacho de 28 años de edad, cuando concluyó sus estudios secundarios, decidió salir de su pueblo natal, Saman, en busca de mejores condiciones de vida.Actualmente radica en la ciudad de Juliaca y para ganarse la vida trabaja brindando servicios de movilidad en su triciclo y ahora también como empleado en una ladrillera local, con ese esfuerzo y con muchas horas incansables de trabajo ha podido comprar su terreno para construir un cuartito.El deseo de este esforzado muchacho es concluir la construcción de su espacio para tener un techo propio y seguro donde vivir, con ese propósito recurre a ti en búsqueda de tu solidario apoyo y hace la petición de un préstamo.Colaboremos con la solicitud de este emprendedor muchacho, él agradece tu buen corazón.

loans.use: Purchase materials to finish building his home / Compra de materiales para concluir la construcción de su vivienda.

loans.name: Lwaba East E Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Safina M.. She is currently in the business of running a restaurant and is requesting a loan to boost business. Safina is 45 years old and is married, with a husband who is a peasant farmer for work. She has 3 children ranging from age 16 to 22 and her children go to school. Each week, Safina makes approximately UGX 10000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to start a poultry farming business.

Safina is joined in her small group by Robina K., Saida N., Salima N., and Rehema N.. Robina K. has a business selling tomatoes and wants to purchase more tomatoes from the surrounding villages. Saida N. is currently operating a business selling charcoal and wants a loan to purchase more charcoal in bulk. Salima N. operates a business selling maize and wants to add stock. Rehema N. is currently in the business selling maize and is requesting a loan to increase her capital stock.

loans.use: To add to restaurant business

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Salamatu is a married woman with five children.  Her children are currently in school. She is forty-three years old and has been preparing and selling owaakye (brown rice cooked with beans) in Mankessim for the past ten years. It is a very nutritious dish eaten by almost all Ghanaians.  It is in very high demand.
Salamatu says that prices of her ingredients like spices, vegetables, beans and rice have gone up.  She wants use her loan to buy her products in larger quantities to avoid price hikes.
She is a member of the group called St. Jude. Group members agree to take responsibility for the loans of their peers, which serves as social collateral for the loan.

loans.use: to buy more rice, beans, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Señora Maria lives with her one year old daughter in two rooms of a house in the San Pedro zone of La Paz city. Maria works as an administrator in a law office. The two rooms that she rents need to be equipped with minimal comforts to provide a sufficient home for Maria and her daughter. The loan will be used to install water and a sewage system in their house. This is the first time that Maria has asked for a loan and her credit report proves that she is well qualified. This loan is part of our Housing program in the Basic Services sector.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maria vive en dos ambientes de su propiedad en la zona de San Pedro de la Ciudad de La Paz. Con su hija de un año. La señora Maria es empleada en un bufete de abogados realizando trámites en el área legal. Las dos habitaciones que adquirió, necesitan ser acondicionadas para brindarle a ella y a su hija de una vivienda con las comodidades mínimas. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la instalación de agua y alcantarillado en su domicilio. Esta es la primera ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito. Este crédito será parte de nuestro programa de Vivienda en el Sector de Servicios Básicos.

loans.use: Cover the costs of installing water and plumbing in her home.

loans.name: Gbombaya Group

texts.en: Marie F., 40 years old and married with five children, is the Gbombaya group leader; this group has accessed loans from SMT twice previously.  Marie sells rice, palm oil and peanut butter and would like to expand her business to earn more income.  The other group members also plan to diversify their businesses and therefore are requesting a loan of $1,425.

loans.use: To purchase food stuffs, materials for tie dye production, etc.

loans.name: Emma

texts.es:
Emmas is married and has four children: Heriberto is 33 years odl and lives in the US; Olga is 36 years old and she is employed; Deyanira is 27 years old and she is a married homemaker; and, Manuel is 24 years old and works as a mechanic's assistant.

She started her business because she wasn't meeting all her household expenditures. Her husband works as a labourer and his income is not steady. She started 10 years ago after she was recommended to start a grocery store and she is seeing good profits.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of $300 US that will be repaid in a term of 4 months, to purchase merchandise. With your help Emma will be a success.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva volunteer.

Emma es casada y tiene 4 hijos: Heriberto 33 esta en E.U. Olga 36 años emplead, Deyanira de 27 años se dedica al hogar es casada y Manuel de 24 años trabaja de ayudante de un taller Inicio el negocio ya que no completaba con los gastos de la casa, ya que su esposo trabaja como albañil y no tiene un ingreso fijo. Comenzó hace 10 años su negocio, por recomendaciones empezó con sus tienda de abarrotes, obteniendo buenas ganancias.

Ella solicita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar mercancía. Con tu ayuda Emma saldrá adelante.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Karla Vanessa

texts.es:
Karla has been working as a cashier in an electronics store for a year. She is 33 and a single mother of three, with a lot of effort she has managed to raise them well, she also has the support of the father of two of her sons. She wants to give her family a good house, that’s why she will use the loan to tile the floor of her house. Later on she will improve the rooms of her house, so her children can live more comfortable. She thinks that a single woman has to endure more sacrifices, but she endures them proudly because she wants to have a stable and happy family.

Translated from Spanish by Christian Jimenez, Kiva Volunteer.

Karla es asalariada, trabaja como cajera en una tienda de electrodomésticos, tiene un año de tener este trabajo. Tiene 33 años y es madre soltera de 3 hijos, a los cuales con mucho sacrificio los ha sacado adelante, aunque cuenta con la ayuda del padre de dos de sus hijos. Desea darle una vivienda digna a su familia, por eso con el crédito le pondrá cerámica al piso de su vivienda. Y después invertirá en la mejora de las habitaciones de su vivienda para así darles más comodidad a sus hijos. Piensa que la mujer soltera tiene muchos más sacrificios, pero ella orgullosa los hace porque quiere formar una familia estable y feliz.

loans.use:
Tile the floor of her house

Poner cerámica en el piso de su vivienda

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
La señora OLGA, socia del Banco Comunal “LAS MORALINAS”, vive en la región y Provincia de San Martín, distrito de Morales. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza de la marca Esita. Olga vende  visitando las casas de los clientes, los cuales son en su mayoría amistades y personas que trabajan en las diversas entidades de la ciudad. 

Con el préstamo de S/. 800, el cual pagará en 6 meses, invertirá en la compra de productos en oferta como jabones, colonias, desodorantes, esmaltes, shampoo, etc., para tener en stock y surtir la mercadería y poder atender a sus clientes en lo que necesitan, también comprará sábanas para atender los pedidos de los clientes.

Olga tiene 37 años, vive con su esposo y sus 02 hijos. Ahora se siente más responsable, decidida  y trabajadora. Tiene como meta seguir creciendo en su negocio, para ello quiere comprar una vitrina para mostrar los productos y retomar con sus estudios y llegar a ser una profesional.
texts.en:
Olba is a membr of the communal bank called Las Moralinas. She lives in San Martin, in the district of Morales. For three years she has worked selling a brand of cosmetics called Esita. Olga sells directly to her clients in their homes. Many of her customers are friends and people who work at different businesses in the city.

With the loan, which she will repay in 6 months, she will invest in promotional products such as soap, deodorant, nail polish, shampoo, etc, so that her business is well stocked and she can better meet the requests of her customers.

Olga is 37 years old and lives with her husband and 2 children. With her business, she feels more responsible, dedicated and hardworking. Her goal is to grow her business and be able to purchase a display case to show her products, as well as return to her studies so that she can further her career as a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO PURCHASE BEAUTY PRODUCTS FOR HER COSMETICS BUSINESS, INCLUDING  SOAP, DEODORANT, NAIL POLISH, SHAMPOO, ETC.

loans.name: Nie

texts.en:
Nie Y., 49, is married with one child and lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She works out of her home as a medicine seller, making around US $3.50 each day. Her husband is a farmer who grows rice and corn and is able to generate US $2.50 each day as well.

Nie Y. is asking for a loan of US $1200 to purchase more medicine to help her generate more income. She would also like to purchase a water pump. She believes that this loan can raise her standard of living and provide valuable resources for her family.

loans.use: To purchase medicine to sell and a water pump.

loans.name: Sameth's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sameth C. is a group leader with four people, who all live in the Damank Trayueng village in Takeo province in Cambodia. She is a rice farmer, and owns 0.5 hectare that she cultivates and earns a living. This plantation faces a small problem, because the field has poor soil, which has a bad effect on her crop. Mrs. Sameth C. requests a loan to buy fertilizer to improve her field and improve productivity.

Mrs. Sameth C. is a 47-year-old widow with three children. One child works in Malaysia, another one is employed at the Sokimex Gas Station, and the youngest one works in a garment factory.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer to improve the field to make the rice crop more productive

loans.name: Rosabel

texts.es: Rosabel tiene 42 años, vive  con sus hijos. Calcula que ya hace 5 años tiene una pequeña su tienda, empezó en este negocio porque necesitaba de más ingresos para educar a sus hijos, es si que inició con poco capital y con mucho esfuerzo pudo incrementar su mercadería. Luego, pudo trasladar su bodega a un local más amplio, donde abastece  a sus vecinos de los productos principales de pan llevar. Rosabel trabaja denodadamente para seguir creciendo, aunque sabe que esto le tomará tiempo, atención y dinero, lo viene asumiendo con muchos retos para su futuro. Es la quinta vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP, durante todo este tiempo ha demostrado ser una de las más puntuales para devolver el dinero. Esta vez invertirá en la compra de mercadería, implementara su tienda con productos de limpieza personal, de belleza, detalles para regalos, entre otros.
texts.en:
Rosabel is 42 years old and lives with her children. She estimates that she has already had her small store for 5 years. She started this business because she needed more income to educate her children. As such, she started with a little money and a lot of effort and was able to increase her merchandise. Later, she was able to move her store to a larger location, where she supplies her neighbors with basic products and produce. Rosabel works tirelessly to continue growing, although she knows that this will take time, focus, and money, and she has come to take on many challenges for the future. This is the fifth time she has requested a loan with MFP. During all this time she has demonstrated that she is one of the most punctual in paying back the money. This time she will invest in buying merchandise, stocking her store with personal hygiene products, beauty products, and little gifts, among other things.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Denis Leonel

texts.es:
El Joven empresario Denis Leonel García Hernández tiene la edad de 21 años, su estado civil es casado, este Joven tiene 1 hijo de la edad de 2 años y recientemente no estudia, su compañera de vida labora de comerciante, sus propósitos son de aumentar su negocio en una variedad de productos y proporcionar variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes que en sus deseos esta realizarle mejoras a su vivienda ya que tiene que dejarle a su hijo su casa para que este no sufra necesidades para el día de mañana, también en sus propósitos esta proporcionarle a su hijo un futuro en los estudios ya que quiere darle una buena educación y proporcionarle la educación que necesita para su formación.


La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la comerciante y vende los productos como: carne de pollo, carne de res y granos básicos, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 3 años, el inicia este negocio por su familia desde muy pequeño Denis ayudaba a su familia en el negocio al paso del tiempo su familia deciden que Denis administre el negocio y es así como pasa a formar de el por lo que decide realizar financiamientos para que su negocio obtenga toda la variedad de sus productos y poderle proporcionar a los clientes lo que ellos necesitan, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que necesita aumentar su producción en sus productos de carne como lo es de pollo y de res y los grano básicos ya que en estos días festivos requieren de ambos productos necesarios para el consumo diario y agradece trabajar con la Fundación León 2000 y las organizaciones amigas que le brindan este tipo de oportunidad para que siga adelante.
texts.en:
The young entrepreneur Denis Leonel G. H. is 21 years old and married with one two-year-old son. His life partner works in commerce. Denis wants to expand his business by offering a larger volume and wider variety of products. He also wants to make home improvements, so that he can leave his home to his son someday and his son won't have to suffer from unmet needs tomorrow. He would also like to provide his son with an academic future by offering him the good education that he needs in his formative years.

Denis works in commerce selling products like chicken, beef and staple grains. He has had his business for the past three years, and originally founded it to help his family. Since he was very young, Denis has helped his family with their business, and as the years went by they decided to turn the administration of their business over to Denis. Denis then decided to start taking out loans in order to begin offering a wider variety of products and give his clients everything they need. He will use his loan as working capital to help him increase his production of chicken, beef and staple grains for the holiday season. He is grateful to Fundacion Leon 2000 and its partner organizations for offering him this opportunity to continue moving forward.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Faten

texts.en: Faten is a 37-year-old married woman with five children, living in Bourj Barajneh. To help her husband with the household expenses, she started working as a home-based hair dresser 10 years ago. Today, Faten wants to expand her small business by adding new services. Faten is asking for $700 to help her with this endeavor.

loans.use: Buy new hair-dressing equipment

loans.name: Lidia Angelica

texts.es:
La mamá de Lidia también tenía un puesto en el mercado cuando era niña, es así que ella creció en “este mundo” y con esta “visión del negocio”: en el mundo de los vendedores del mercado. A sus cuarenta  años de edad ya tiene veinte con su propio puesto en el mercado y su negocio de venta de carne.
Además, Lidia también es inversionista. Con sus ahorros ya compró otro puesto en el mercado, hace seis meses, y tres años atrás  hizo construir un tercer piso en su casa,  los dos para alquilar y de esta manera tener unos ingresos más y asegurarse su bienestar en el futuro y el de su familia. Tiene dos hijos, un chico de 18 años y una niña de 13.
Para lograr estos objetivos Lidia se juntó a EDAPROSPO hace tres años, y sobre el préstamo grupal también saca uno individual, ya que sus buenas condiciones de trabajo se lo permiten. 
Sus planes siguen creciendo: ahora está planificando comprar aún otro puesto con sus ahorros futuros, y alquilarlo asimismo como sus otras propiedades.
texts.en:
Lidia's mother had a stall in the market when she was young. As a result, she grew up in "this world" and with this "vision of business": in the world of the market sellers. At her forty years of age, she already has twenty with her own market stall and her business selling meat. In addition, Lidia is an investor. With her savings, she bought another market stall six months ago and, three years ago, she built a third floor on hour house. Both are for renting out and in this way earn more income and assure her and her family's wellbeing in the future. She has two children: an 18 year old son and a daughter of 13. To achieve these goals, Lidia joined EDAPROSPO three years ago and, besides the group loan, has requested an individual one since her good working conditions allow it. Her plans are to continue to grow. Now she is planning to buy another stall with her future savings and to rent it out like her other properties.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest capital for her business.

loans.name: Tak

texts.en: Tak L. is 26 years old and lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia with her sister. She earns a living by selling boiled and roasted corn at the market and makes $5 every day. Her sister helps with the income working at a garment factory earning $2 a day. Tak L. would like to take out a loan so that she can buy more corn to sell.

loans.use: To purchase corn.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy rents out chairs, tables and canopies. She needs the loan amount of N30,000 to purchase more chairs and canopies to sell. She is 49 years old and married with 2 children. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more chairs and canopies

loans.name: Justine

texts.fr:
C. Justine est née le 26 Septembre 1963. Justine est mariée à COUAO ZOTTI Jonas et est mère de quatre enfants tous scolarisés. Justine vend des divers (bonbons, biscuits, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, les savons de lessive, de vaisselle et de toilette, etc.). Justine achète ses articles à DANTOKPA, marché international du Bénin. C'est dans l'optique de diversifier son activité et de renforcer son capital que Justine sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé.

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
Justine C. was born on September 26, 1963. She's married to Jonas COUAO ZOTTI, and the mother of four school-attending children. Justine sells various products (candies, biscuits, cans of milk, sardines, tomatoes, sugar, pasta, laundry detergents, dish washing detergents, soaps, etc). She buys the products in DANTOKPA, an international marketplace in Benin. Aiming to diversify her business and to bolster her working capital, Justine is seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, Alidé.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy candies, biscuits, cans of milk, sardines, tomatoes, sugar, pasta, soaps, etc

loans.name: Gull Dasta Group

texts.en:
Gull Dasta is the group leader of Gull Dasta group. There are three members in this group. All of them would like to receive money for their businesses.

Gull Dasta wants to take a loan for her business of tailoring. She wants to buy a new machine for her business. Also, Nasema wants to take a loan for her husband’s business as a mechanic. He wants to buy necessary materials for his shop. And Raqya wants to take a loan for her son’s business of carpet weaving. He wants to make his shop larger.

They want to say that this loan is very useful for each one of them because this loan can provide a good chance for poor entrepreneurs to expand and become stronger in their businesses and lives. This group wants to thank this loan process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To improve and expand their business

loans.name: Sherali

texts.ru: Шерали Колтаев проживает в районе Яван. Возраст 33 года. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Шерали вместе с братом занимается земледелием. Этим видом деятельности более 4 лет. Помимо этого, он работает таксистом. Клиент хочет взять у нас кредит, чтобы закупить удобрения. В дальнейшем собрать хороший урожай лука и других овощей.
texts.en:
