Sherali K. resides in Yavan. He is 33 years old and is married with 2 children. For the past 4 years Sherali and his brother have worked in agriculture. Besides, Sherali earns extra cash as a cab driver. He would like to use the loan for the purchase of fertilizers so that he gets a good harvest of onions and other vegetables.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Apolinario

texts.en:
Apolinario S. is the father of two children: Mark Lester and Erika Mae. Managing his passenger tricycle is his daily source of income for his family while his wife, Eliza, works as a domestic helper in Dubai. They are both working patiently to have a progressive family and provide a better life for their children.

Apolinario wanted to borrow PHP 6,000 for the maintenance of his motorcycle. He will purchase parts and accessories it needs for a better transport operation. He always finds ways to help his wife earn a living and not to depend on her monthly salary abroad. He prays that Kiva lenders will provide him the financial support he is requesting and that his business will be fruitful for the welfare of his family.

loans.use: To maintain his motorcycle

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah lives in Lagos state and sells medicines retail to her customers. Sarah is 36 years old and married with 2 children. Sarah is requesting the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more medicines to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Ашурова Рано, женщина 48 лет, имеет двоих детей. Муж уже семь лет как умер. Поэтому она сама вместе с сыном занимается жизненными проблемами и семейными расходами. Рано имеет бизнес по производству шашлыка, который продаёт и изготавливает её сын. А сама Рано имеет несколько помещений, которые она сдаёт в аренду и имеет дополнительный доход с арендных выплат ей. Получив кредит Рано хочет отремонтировать столовую, которую она сдаёт в аренду одному бизнесмену. Для чего решила получить кредит. На снимке Рано в своём кабинете в день мониторинга.
texts.en:
Rano A. is a 48-year-old woman, who has two children. Her husband passed away seven years ago. This is why Rano and her son take care of life problems and family expenses. Rano has a business of making kebobs, which her son cooks and sells. And Rano also owns several spaces that she leases out and has an additional income from lease payments. Once she receives the loan, Rano wants to repair a café that leases to a businessman. This is why she decided to obtain the loan. The photo shows Rano in her office on the day of monitoring.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cafe repair

loans.name: Betty's Group

texts.en: Betty N. is the leader of her subgroup of Suubilyamukama. She is a mother of 6 children ages 10-25 and all are in school, and she cares for other orphans. She has a business selling secondhand children's clothes in the town center and because she has done this a long time she has many customers. Betty says that she started very small due to lack of enough capital but now that she has access to loans to buy more stock, she makes more sales hence more profits. She dreams of building a permanent house as well as educating all her children at the university level. She needs to buy more stock for her business to increase profitability and sustainability. Betty is a determined and hardworking lady.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her stock.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz Marina es socia del Banco Comunal “Señor de la Justicia”, ubicado en la cuidad de Puno, provincia de Puno, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 23 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos.  Estudio educación secundaria  superior incompleta (derecho). Vive en la Av. Costanera.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 4 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió para comprar golosinas.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional de S/. 1200.00 nuevos soles, con este monto ella comprará yogur, galletas, caramelos, gaseosas, alfajores, etc.

Su deseo es  culminar su carrera y ejercerla.  

A ella le gustan las facilidades y los encuentros deportivos.
texts.en:
Luz Marina is a member of the Señor de la Justicia Community Bank, which is located in the city of Puno, province of Puno, department of Puno. She is 23, single, and she has no children. She studied law in the university, but she did not finish. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for four years. She bought sweets with her first loan for 300 PEN. She currently needs a loan for an additional 1,200 PEN to buy yogurt, crackers, candy, soft drinks, and "alfajores" (a traditional cookie in Peru and other parts of South America), etc. Her wish is to finish her career studies and to practice her career. She likes the simplicity and the sports encounters (speaking of the loans and her Community Bank).

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy yogurt, crackers, candy, soft drinks, and "alfajores" (a traditional cookie in Peru)

loans.name: Normalita

texts.en: Normalita is 46 years old and married to Renato. She is a dealer of cosmetics products and RTW’s. She would like to purchase all the orders to her of her customers but her capital is insufficient that’s why she is requesting additional capital amounting to PHP5, 000 for the improvement of her business. Normalita has been blessed with three children: Reynor-25 years old and he is a college graduate; Alvin-23 years old, also a college graduate and Venus-16 years old and presently in 1st year college. She wanted that her youngest daughter could also finish her college studies and that’s the reason why she is asking financial support from KIVA, for her to continue supporting her daughter in her studies.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Rodita

texts.en:
Rodita R. is 45 years old and married to a tri-bike (a bicycle with sidecar attached to its body) driver, Angelo R.. She has four children who range in age from 4 to 25 years old. Her eldest child is a college undergraduate and now works as a supply officer for the newest and the biggest shopping mall in the province of Antique. It was not so long ago that Rodita was receiving financial assistance from her eldest child, since her businesses started just recently. Her 21-year-old second child is a high school undergraduate and is unemployed. Therefore, three of Rodita’s children are dependent on her and her husband for financial support, with two children still studying in elementary school and preschool.

Rodita’s membership in ASHI, beginning in 2001, has been a great opportunity for her to improve the economy of her family. Through ASHI, she has been able to access credit which has allowed her to enact her thoughts and skill in running her own business. With her membership and previous loans, she has started a food vending business, a pig raising business, and a tri-bike for public transportation business. The first two businesses are managed by Rodita herself. The tri-bike business is managed by her husband.

In the villages of the municipality of Hamtic, where Rodita and her family live, tri-bike is the most common means of transportation. However, this can only serve for short distance travel. For far and hilly places, tricycle (a motorcycle with sidecar attached to its body) is the municipality's other means of transportation. A tricycle is much more expensive than a tri-bike; however, owners make a bigger income. With Rodita’s present loan, she will be purchasing a tricycle for a tricycle-for-hire business to be managed by her husband. She plans to hire a driver for her tri-bike.

loans.use: To purchase a tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar)

loans.name: Bot

texts.en:
Mr. Bot N., 39, and his wife, Mrs. Rio Chhorn, 34, have been married for 10 years. They have one daughter, who attends school. They live in a small village off of National Road number Two, which is about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Bot has been driving a Tuk Tuk taxi for 3 years. His wife has been selling fruits for 10 years. Unfortunately,his Tuk Tuk taxi is broken in some parts, which upsets his business. So he is applying for a loan of US$500 to purchase new Tuk Tuk taxi to replace his old one.

loans.use: To purchase a new taxi to replace his old one.

loans.name: Susan Njoki

texts.en:
Susan Njoki N. has been running her own business, Makena Special, for two years selling used clothing. She specializes in children's clothes and ladies trousers and shoes. Her clientele is primarily women. Located in a residential area, her stall is very busy, yet she does face challenges in the form of competition and lack of capital. Susan is using the proceeds of her 20,000 shilling loan to increase her offering of ladies clothes and expand into handbags. 

Susan is married to a salesman and has two children: Doreen, age 7, and Teddy, age 3. She describes herself as having strong customer skills and she aspires to expand her offerings into new clothes and, ultimately, into a wholesale operation. Susan's life goals are to own her house and for her children to reach a higher level of education than she was able to achieve.

loans.use: To increase her stock of ladies clothes and handbags

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase food merchandise

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en: Isaac is 25 years old. He is single and has no children. He lives alone in a rented apartment in a farming dominated community in the Western Region of Ghana. He works hard to be able to provide for himself. Isaac is a butcher. He slaughters and sells pork in his community. He sells on a tabletop at the local market to food vendors in particular. Isaac procures the live animals from nearby communities. He has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy more pigs to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy livestock

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es: La Sra. Eusebia, cliente que se encuentra en su cuarta secuencia, es una microempresaria que se dedica a la venta D. edredones y colchas en la mayor parte del tiempo, al margen D. ello tambien se dedica a la venta D. varios productos según las fiestas en las ferias ambulantes, como en Navidad, Año nuevo, carnavales, semana santa etc.Ella tiene 6 hijos pero solo se encarga D. la manutención D. dos que se encuentran en edad escolar ya que los demas estan casados, el esposo es carpintero barnizador que trabaja en una empresa en Achumani, es una cliente responsable y buena, segun referencias D. los vecinos.
texts.en:
Eusebia is in her fourth cycle. She is a small businesswoman who spends most of her time selling comforters and bedspreads. The rest of the time she also sells various products, according to the holidays like Christmas, New Year, Carnival, and Holy Week. She sells these products at street fairs. She has six children, but she is only supporting two. They are school age, and the rest are married. Her husband is a carpenter who varnishes. He works for a company in Achumani. She is a responsible and good client according to her neighbors’ references.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for the end of the year fairs

loans.name: Matousiba

texts.fr: En 2005 cette dame a commencé le commerce de céréales, étant mariée et mère de 04 enfants, le revenu qu’elle perçoit de son activité lui permet d’apporter sa contribution financière à son foyer. Elle s’approvisionne à Lomé et parfois à l’intérieur du pays, elle fait face en ce moment à une baisse de stock de maïs, pour pouvoir se réapprovisionner elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 15 sacs de maïs.
texts.en:
Matousiba Y. started her cereal business in 2005. She is married and is the mother of 4 children. The profits that she earns from her business allows her to contribute to her family's financial needs. She buys her supplies in Lome and occasionally in the interior of the country. She is now experiencing a low level with her supplies of corn. To restock her inventory she is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 15 sacks of corn.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of corn

loans.name: Suzanne

texts.en:
Suzanne is a 29-year-old married woman with two children. She has worked as a home-based hairdresser since 2007. This young woman caters to a wide range of clientele in her village and its neighborhood.

Today, Suzanne wishes to rent a shop and buy specially designed barber chairs and products. In order to do so, she is requesting $1,000.

loans.use: To rent a shop and buy specially designed barber chairs and products

loans.name: Marcia Pastora

texts.es: Marcia Pastora de 44 años de edad es soltera, tiene 1 hijo de nombre Edwin de 22 años de edad el cual estudia, cuenta con el apoyo de su compañero de vida quien asume los gastos del hogar. Marcia trabaja para el MINED desde hace 23 años como maestra de primaria, muy temprano sale a la escuelita ubicada carretera a Rama para impartir el pan de la enseñanza a los niños de esa comunidad.  Esta solicitando su 7mo credito a AFODENIC esperando ser beneficiada con el fondo kiva para mejorar su vivienda levantando 3 paredes y terminar un cuarto del que ya tiene los arranques, su casita es de proyecto y necesita este cuarto para mayor espacio y comodidad de su familia. Afirma que le gusta la atencion que le brindan y que gracias a estos creditos ha mejorado las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Marcia Pastora is 44 years old. She is single and has a son named Edwin who is 22 and in school. She has the support of her life partner, who helps cover the household expenses. Marcia has worked for the Ministry of Education for 23 years as an elementary school teacher. She leaves home early in the morning for the little school located on the road to Rama, where she nourishes the children of the community with her teaching. She is asking for a 7th loan with AFODENIC, hoping to benefit from Kiva funding in order to improve her home. She would like to put up three walls and finish a room that has already been started. Her house is part of a subsidized construction project and she needs this room to give her family more space and comfort. She is thankful for the help given by AFODENIC and says that thanks to these loans she has improved her family's living conditions

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a room.

loans.name: Zepyur

texts.en:
Zepyur H. lives in Sevan. For about nineteen years she worked as a commodity researcher. Since 1993 she has been engaged in clothes selling in a rented place.

Zepyur is married and has two daughters who have their own families and live separately from their parents. Zepyur’s husband is jobless and Zepyur takes care of her family with her business profit.

Zepyur needs a 770,000 AMD loan to organize a shoe-selling business and to buy spring clothes to sell.

loans.use: To organize a shoe sales business and to buy spring clothes to sell

loans.name: Proyecto Group

texts.es:
Each of the female entrepreneurs in this group has the desire to support and better themselves. The coordinator of the Proyecto Group is Alexandra Yuliza L. P.. She has a fried food business where she sells popular food like carne asada, sliced enchiladas with cheese, and more.  She does this from her home so she can also manage her business refurnishing gates, windows, tables, and chairs.

María Auxiliadora L. González and Margina Elizabeth M. Rodríguez are also in this group. María runs a general store, and Margina sells pork which is very popular in Nicaragua.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients such as grains, meat, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Sophia Wanjiru

texts.en:
Sophia is 40 years old, married, and has two children. She earns a living farming crops and raising dairy cows, selling the milk to a local dairy society.  The dairy business provides Sophia with sufficient income to cover her family's basic needs, while crop farming provides both food for the family and fodder for the cattle. Also Sophia's husband, Lucas, is a farmer.

Sophia was introduced to KADET through a marketing initiative in Githunguri, a trading center near her home. This is her first loan with KADET, although she has already previously borrowed capital from the Farmers Society to which she sells milk. Sophia plans to use the current loan to prepare and cultivate additional land for crop farming and plant more fodder for the cows.

She hopes to be able to thereby earn enough to buy additional land for farming and build a house with electricity access for her family.

loans.use: Preparation of farmland for planting maize and fodder for dairy animals

loans.name: Monsura

texts.en:
Selling of apples and cooking oil is a business activity that Monsura really enjoys.  She hopes to grow her business so it becomes bigger and stronger. 

She loves her business because of the profits that she makes.  This is the high season for her business and she hopes to have more customers.  Monsura is 45 years old, married with 4 children.  Her husband is a commercial driver and he also supports their home.  She is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase more apples to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase more apples to sell.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.es:
Doña Jacinta es una señora de 48 años es viuda ya que hace 10 años que murió su marido y la dejo con  4 hijos de ( 21,19,17) años , pues ella tuvo que trabajar mucho para sacar adelante a sus 4 hijos  por que se quedo viuda muy joven.

Doña Jacinta vive en la ciudad de Cochabamba en la localidad de Chinchilla, en una pequeña casa que le dejo su marido , pues vive con su hijo de 21 años los otros dos se fueron a trabajar a la republica de argentina debido a que tenían muchas necesidades, su principal actividad es la producción de la leche cruda, cuyo producto entrega a una empresa que se dedica a la elaboración de productos lácteos, actualmente cuenta con 5 cabezas de ganado lechero, así como también con la ayuda de su hijo se produce maíz , papa y haba.

El credito que solicita sera utilizado para poder comprar una vaca lechera y de esta manera incrementar su produccion actual de leche. Entre sus sueños y metas es aumentar la producción de leche, y de esta manera aumentar el nivel de ingresos y mejorar el nivel de vida de ella,  de su hijo y de su nieto que apenas tiene 1 año, así como también su meta es realizar una construcción nueva de su casa ya que está muy vieja y tiene pocas habitaciones.
texts.en:
Jacinta is 48 years old and is a widow. Her husband died ten years ago and left her with three children, now aged 21, 19, and 17. She had to work very hard to support her family as she was a widow at such a young age. Jacinta lives in the city of Cochabamba in the Chinchilla neighborhood, in a small house her husband left to her. She lives with her 21-year-old son. The other two children went to work in Argentina out of necessity. Jacinta’s principal occupation is the production of raw milk, which she sells to a business that makes dairy products. Right now, she has five dairy cows. She also grows corn, potatoes, and beans with the help of her son. This loan will be use to purchase another dairy cow to increase milk production. Her goal is to continue to increase production and in this way improve the quality of life for her, her son, and her one-year-old grandson. In the future, she would like to build a new house, as hers is old and has few rooms.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena L., from the village of Mauswagon, Calamba, is 36 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Magdalena plants a variety crops to sell in the local community. Engaged in her business for many years, she earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month.

In 2007, Magdalena joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 41,000 PHP from PMPC that used as additional capital for her business, she is now requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase a motorcycle. This will be her eighth loan from PMPC.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Cristo Del Consuelo(Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El bankito Cristo del Consuelo esta conformado por 9 socias luchadoras que buscan en el día a día la manera de seguir progresando en cada una de sus actividades y así entregarles un mejor futuro a sus familias, viven en la ciudad de Cuenca en  el sector Cristo del Consuelo de ahí el nombre de su banco comunal, este sector se caracteriza por sus cabañas en donde se brinda el rico canelazo (agua de naranjilla con canela y un poco de licor), también hay una gran variedad de carnes asadas, en la cual se demuestra la rica gastronomía de la ciudad

La  señora Rosa Arévalo tiene 35 años de edad, se encuentra casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos que se encuentran de 18, 16, 14, 12 y 2, sus tres primeros hijos trabajan en una carpintería y son quienes ayudan un poco económicamente y su hijo de 12 años estudia en una escuela de la ciudad, su esposo de dedica al trabajo en la construcción como es la albañilería, gracias al sacrificio conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

Rosa se dedica al comercio de verduras actividad que la realiza hace 12 años, y se decidió por esta actividad para mejorar la economía de su hogar, labora de domingo a domingo desde las 4 a.m. hasta las 11 a.m., cuenta con un puesto propio en el mercado de la feria libre (Cuenca),  éste es su segundo crédito con su banco  comunal y fue invitada por una amiga que pertenece al bankito, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra  zanahoria, remolacha, lechuga, acelga, tomate, cebolla, etc. para seguir prosperando en su negocio, su gran sueño es que sus hijos estudien y tengan una buena profesión para que se superen en la vida.

Elvia P. es una de las socias más jóvenes de éste banco, tiene una muy buen a mistad con todas las compañera del bankito y  se encuentra en su segundo crédito, ella  se dedica al comercio de verduras  motivada a realizar este trabajo por la necesidad de salir adelante con su familia,   labora de domingo a domingo desde las 7 a.m. a  5 p.m.
Su nuevo crédito  invertirá  en la compra de más cebolla, tomate, acelga, lechuga, remolacha y otras  verduras para incrementar  su negocio.

Elvia tiene 20 años es soltera vive sólo con su madre porque su padre falleció hace diez años a causa de la bebida ayudando con los gastos de arriendo y comida en su casa. Su meta es terminar sus estudios de bachillerato ya que los ha abandonado estando en el cuarto curso por la necesidad económica.
texts.en:
Cristo del Consuelo is made up of nine members constantly searching for ways to get ahead and be able to give their families a better future. They live in the Cristo del Consuelo section of the city of Cuenca, their communal bank’s namesake. This area is characterized by its many cabanas where people toast with “canelazo” (an orangeade flavored with cinnamon and a bit of liquor). There is also a large variety of grilled meats. Rosa is 35 years old. She is married and has five children, ages 18, 16, 14, 12, and 2. Her three oldest children work in a carpentry shop and they help support their parents. Her 12 year old son attends school in the city. Her husband works construction as a mason. Thanks to their joint effort, they have managed to have a home built. Rosa has been selling vegetables for the past 12 years. She began doing this in order to improve their financial status. She works from 4:00 am to 11:00 am, seven days a week and has her own stall in the “Feria Libre” market in Cuenca. This is her second loan through the communal bank. She had been invited into the group by a friend and will use the money from this loan to invest in carrots, beets, lettuce, chard, tomatoes, onions, etc, in order to continue to prosper in her business. Her greatest dream is for her children to finish their schooling and find a good career, so that they can have a bright future. Eliva is one of the youngest members and she has good friendships with the other members. This will be her second loan. She also sells vegetables and she began doing this out of need to help her family. She works from 7:00 am to 5:00 pm, seven days a week and will use the money from this loan to buy more onions, tomatoes, chard, lettuce, beets, and other vegetables in order to grow her business. Elvia is 20 years old. She is single and lives with her mother because her father passed away 10 years ago. She helps out with the household and food expenses and wants to complete the bachelors degree that she began, but had to stop out of economic necessity.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vegetables for sale

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
La señora Juana Maria R. es madre soltera y tiene bajo su responsabilidad a tres hijos de mediana edad, ha quines les quiere dar los estudios necesario para un buen futuro.
Solicita un préstamo para poder pagar las necesidades de la escuela de sus niños, ya que el están exigiendo que pagar  las colegiatura. El problema es que no cuenta con el dinero necesario para liquidar este compromiso escolar.
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte el ingreso que obtiene de sus ventas de productos de belleza por catalogó.
texts.en:
Juana is a single mother and has three school-aged children to support. She wants to provide a good education for them so that they can have a brighter future and is asking for this loan in order to be able to pay for her children’s schooling needs. Their tuition is due and she does not have the money. She plans to repay this loan from the income she generates from her catalog sales of cosmetics.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tuition for her children

loans.name: Adrian

texts.en:
43-year-old ever-smiling and jovial B. Adrian has been selling bananas for the last twelve years and he has benefited a great deal from the fact that the foods he sells are liked and bought almost every passing day by the indigenous people in Bwahika, Ibanda. Apart from the lowest common denominators, the foods he sells, such as cassava, potatoes, beans and bananas, are really fancied by hotel (restaurant) owners.

What has gotten Adrian this far is the fact that he has this pleasantly welcoming aura that he has cultivated over the years. A smile at a customer works miracles for a business – that's if you want to borrow a leaf from Adrian's experience. This has helped him build a good rapport with most of his established and prospective clients.

Adrian is married with three children and all of them are in good schools. This is something Adrian is so proud of. He knows it’s incumbent upon him to cater for his children in whatever they need. His family's welfare has also significantly improved due to his business, from which he makes roughly 20,000 shillings a week.

With this loan, Adrian wants to pay for the overhaul of his stall. He wants it enlarged so that he can purchase crops in bulk, well knowing that if he does not sell it all, he can keep some.

loans.use: To pay the costs of refurbishing his stall into a modern one

loans.name: Adelina

texts.es: Adelina, de 28 años, es una madre de familia muy sencilla y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Eber de 34 años y sus 4 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo que realiza, es el cultivo de Café, plátano y cacao, todas las mañanas junto a su esposo, sale a trabajar en sus campos ya sembrados, sabe que el cuidado que le brindan dependerá de la calidad de los productos que cosechará y venderá al mercado de Pichanaki. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar y darles el cuidado necesario, es así que lleva 7 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que transportar sus productos, puesto que son muy pesados. Con el tiempo, desea comprar nuevas tierras para ampliar su producción. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP y esta ahorrando para pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a sus compañeros de su grupo comunal, donde se siente muy contenta. Los setecientos nuevos soles que solicita, los invertirá para contratar operarios para que limpien sus plantaciones de café.
texts.en:
Adelina is a 28 year old mother who is modest and cheerful. She lives in her own house with her husband Eber, age 34, and their four beloved children for whom she wants to provide a better quality of life. Adelina’s work involves growing coffee, bananas, and cacao. Every morning she and her husband leave their home to go work in the fields they have planted. She knows that the care she provides her crops will determine the quality of her products, which are sold at the Pichanaki Market after being harvested. What she enjoys most about her work is planting her crops and providing them the necessary care. She has been farming for seven years and considers the most difficult part to be transporting her products since the shipments can be very heavy. Over time she hopes to buy additional land so that she can increase her production.

This is her second loan with MFP. Adelina sets aside money so that she can submit her payments on time, since she does not want to cause problems for the other members of her Communal Bank. She is very happy to be part of the group. The loan of 700 PEN that she requested will be used to hire workers to clear her coffee fields.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Hire workers to clear her coffee fields

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie M. is from the village of Villa Felipa, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 26 years old. Rosemarie is married. To make a living, Rosemarie owns & operates a business selling and renting DVD's and also selling electronic cell phone loads in all networks in the local community. Rosemarie has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 6500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rosemarie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rosemarie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Rosemarie is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Rosemarie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Eladia

texts.en:
Eladia M., photographed at the front of her restaurant, is from the town of Loon. She is 66 years old. Eladia is separated from her spouse. To make a living, Eladia owns and operates a restaurant serving local foods to customers in her community. Eladia has been in her business for over 20 years.

Eladia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Eladia has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. She plans to save the additional revenue from the business as a reserve for future emergencies. 

Asenso loans are a new product offered by CEVI for clients showing strong performance in previous loans, and who need a larger loan in order to continue to develop. CEVI recognises the importance of helping people out of poverty, as well as providing continuous support and training as these clients progress. CEVI aims to provide financial services, not only to our poorest clients, but also to our developing clients who should be rewarded for the way in which they display promising business skills. Please help us provide support for these clients.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy Opina, age 35, is a vendor of fish, simsim, and groundnuts at her local market. She and is requesting a loan in order to stock more dried fish and bags of groundnuts to sell.  Lucy's husband is a businessman and they have four children, all of whom attend school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a house to offer for rent.

loans.use: To stock more dried fish and bags of groundnuts to sell

loans.name: Lafia Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe Lafia sont 3 femmes mariées et 1 veuve qui ont  une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, 4 enfants et qui vivent dans des familles polygames à KAMALEN SIRAKORO un des villages de la commune de Sikasso, (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur treizième  prêt. Les prêts passés se sont tous bien dénoués. 
Elles font la vente d’articles divers tels la pomme de terre, les tasses aluminium, les habillements avec  Kadiatou Vieux T..
Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter, 20 pièces de pagnes et tissus. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de Sikasso auprès des grossistes.
Elle vend au marché de KAMALEN SIRAKORO et à domicile, au comptant, en détail et souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 35.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Elle ambitionne avoir plus de capitaux pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et  pouvoir s’acheter des articles pour le trousseau  de mariage de sa première fille.
texts.en:
Of the four members of the Lafia group 3 are married women and one is a widow. The average age is 35 and they have four children each. The live in polygamous families in Kamalen Sirakoro, one of the villages of the Sikasso commune (the third administrative region of Mali). They all work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso (Kiva Field Partner) in order to be able to meet the clients' demands. This is their third loan. The past loans have all been repaid in full. They sell various merchandise items, such as potatoes, aluminium cups, and clothing with Kadiatou Vieux T.. With this loan she will purchase 20 wraps and pieces of fabric. She carries out her purchases from wholesalers in the Sikasso market. She sells her items in the Kamalen Sirakoro market and from her home. She finalizes her sales in cash and often in credit, selling to a clientele made up of both men and women. She plans on seeing monthly earnings of 35.500 francs, a part of which will be put away into savings and part will be used to fill the family's needs. She will also reinvest some earnings back into the business. Her ambitions are to have greater capital funds to be able to meet her clients' demands. She also hopes to purchase wedding items for her eldest daughter’s marriage.

Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing.

loans.name: Abida's Group

texts.en:
Abida lives in Lahore, Pakistan’s second largest city. She is 29 years old and sews clothes for her neighboring clients to earn income of her family. She married at an early age and has three sons. Her eldest son also does sewing work along with his mother while her younger sons are receiving their education by going to school.

Abida lost her husband five years ago which was a big tragedy and loss of her life. She was completely lost but she regained her courage and started her sewing business to spend a normal life. Currently, she lives with her mother and 2 brothers who also do different kinds of work and contribute financially to the family.

Abida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her sewing business. With the loan, she will buy an electric sewing machine which will help her to sew more clothes in less time and to earn a good income as well. She is hopeful that, with the increased income, her children will be able to continue their education.

Abida is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan. With her previous loans she has proved herself as a responsible client who always paid installments on time and never missed a meeting.

In the photo, Abida is the lady who is raising her hand.

loans.use: To buy an electric sewing machine for her business

loans.name: La Nueva Alianza Ii Groups 1 & 2

texts.es:
Juana es una de los miembros del Grupo La nueva alianza  1 y 2, son microempresarios dedicados a las ventas de ropa, productos misceláneos, zapatos, artesanía,  etc.  Sus plazas se encuentran en la ciudad de Samana, una ciudad turística en desarrollo, bordeada por las costas del Océano atlántico y rica en recursos naturales.  Está asociada de Esperanza comenzó con nosotros porque los prestamos son para la realización de un negocio, y de esta manera hay mas compromiso y crecimiento. Es casado y tiene 3 hijos. También ha estudiado enfermería y su reto más difícil es lograr ser una gran enfermera. Su actividad favorita es trabajar manualidades.

Juana  está muy emocionada de recibir su segundo préstamo en Esperanza Internacional, después de haber pagado satisfactoriamente su préstamo anterior y haber dado un paso para el crecimiento de su negocio. Ella ha tenido su negocio por alrededor de 6 meses, el cual inició con su primer préstamo que tomo en Esperanza. Va a invertir su nuevo préstamo en la compra de Ropas nuevas, en su negocio también se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogos.  Ella va a utilizar sus ganancias para reinvertir en su negocio, mientras ahorra para poder comprar un carro y construir su casa.
texts.en:
Juana is one of the members of the New Alliance 1 and 2 group.  They are micro businesspeople that sell clothes, miscellaneous products, shoes, crafts, etc.  Their sales points are in the city of Samana, a tourist destination under development along the Atlantic coast that is rich in natural resources.

This associate of Esperanza started with us because the loans are to bring about business and this way there is more commitment and growth.

She is married and has three children.  She also studied nursing and her greatest challenge is to become a great nurse.  Her favorite pastime is maK. crafts.

Juana is very excited about receiving her second loan from Esperanza Internacional after having paid back her previous loan thereby taK. an important step forward with her business’ growth.

She has had her business for about 6 months which she started with the first Esperanza loan.  She is going to use the new loan to buy new clothes. She also sells products via catalogue.  She will use her profits to reinvest in her business while saving to buy a car and build a house.

loans.use: For clothes.

loans.name: Roxana Yenni

texts.es:
Roxana tiene 32 años, es conviviente y tiene un hijo. Actualmente, Roxana vive en la ciudad Andahuaylillas provincia de Quispicanchis del Departamento del Cusco. Su actividad económica principal de Roxana es la venta de artesanía y su actividad económica complementaria es la venta de maíz.
 
Roxana desde hace mucho tiempo participa en el banco comunal “Las Triunfadoras”. Con su próximo préstamo que espera recibir de S/. 2000 soles, ella invertirá en el negocio y utilizara el dinero para comprar artesanía.
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Roxana is 32 years old and has a son.  Currently, Roxana lives in the City of Andahuaylillas, in the Province of Quispicanchis, in the Cusco Region.  Her primary economic activity is the sale of arts and crafts, complemented with the sale of corn.

Roxana has participated in the communal bank, "Las Triunfadoras," (The Winners) for some time now.  With her next loan of 2000 Soles, she plans to invest it in her business and utilize the money to purchase crafts.  

She is grateful for the opportunity that is being offered to her and she promises to fulfill the payments that correspond to her plan.

loans.use: Purchase arts and crafts.

loans.name: Ignacio Alejandro

texts.es: El Sr. Ignacio es una persona  que ha levantado su taller de enderezado y pintura con muchos esfuerzos,a el le ayudan a trabajar dos personas mas y el necesitaba el prestamo por que le hacia falta material de pintura y herramienta para asi poder sacar mas rapido el trabajo de los autos que los clientes le llevan el sr. Ignacio tiene su taller en su misma casa ya que es una persona sencilla, humilde  y trabajadora y piensa que en el futuro el podra sacar mas provecho a su taller y asi poder ofrecer mas calidad en el trabajo y espera que sus clientes al sentirse satisfechos lo sigan recomendando.
texts.en: Ignacio is a person who has put a lot of effort into building up his auto body repair and paint shop.  He has two other people who help him in his work.  He needs this loan because he is lacking painting material and tools that he needs in order to be able to work more quickly on the cars which his customers bring him.  Ignacio has his workshop in his own home since he is a simple, humble and hard-working person.  He believes that in the future he will be able to make more of his workshop and be able to offer more quality in his work.  He hopes that his customers, feeling satisfied with his work, will continue recommending him.

loans.use: To invest in his business

loans.name: Elizabeth Lourdes

texts.es:
Elizabeth de 54 años, tiene una pequeña papelería. Vive en una casa de caña que cuenta con agua y luz como servicio básico ubicada en una zona periurbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra. 

Hace 4 años comenzó a trabajar con algunos ahorros compro papelería y ubico su negocio en la parte delantera de su casa. En la actualidad tiene su negocio con papelería, cuadernos los vende a $ 1.10 c/u, plumas a $ 0.30 c/u etc. Trabaja desde las 09h00am hasta las 23h00pm todos los días. Con el préstamo quiere comprar papelería, cuadernos para surtir más su negocio. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa de cemento y hacer más grande su negocio para poder asegurar su vejez.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, 54, has a small stationery shop. She lives in a cane house that has the basic services of water and electricity. Her house is located in the peri-urban zone of El Fortín de Guayaquil, characterized by its dirt streets.

Four years ago, Elizabeth used some savings to buy stationery and set up her store in the back of her house. Today, she also sells notebooks for $1.10 each, pens for $.30 each, etc. She works from 9:00 AM until 11:00PM every day. 

With this loan, Elizabeth will buy stationery, notebooks and “fomix” (foam crafts) to stock the store. In the future, she would like to finish her house in cement and enlarge the business to provide security for her old age.

loans.use: Buy stationary, notebooks, and foam crafts for store.

loans.name: Tuamke Group

texts.fr: Hodari P. est entrepreneur, présidente du groupe Tuamke,  âgée de 34 ans, mère de 4 enfants, tous étudient confortablement. Son mari est plombier. Elle fait le petit commerce de vivres (haricots et maïs). Elle  commença son business  avec son fonds propre reçu de son mari, d’environ 50$. Il ya 4 ans, qu’elle est en activité. Plus tard, elle bénéficia de crédit de l’IMF  Hekima. Elle installe ses produits  au marché sectoriel de Majengo. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec  2 sacs de haricots vers Rutshuru, zone agro rurale du Nord Kivu. En plus, elle ambitionne construire dans ses 2 parcelles acquises déjà. La cliente Hodari P. remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe Tuamke est majoritairement fiminins.
texts.en: Hodari P. est an entrepreneur and the leader of the Tuamke group. présidente du groupe Tuamke. She is 34 years old and has 4 children, all of whom are doing good progress in their studies. Her husband is a plumber.   Her business is selling staple foods (beans and corn). She had launched this business with her own starting capital of aorund 50 dollars, received from her husband. She has been in business for 4 years. Later on, she obtained a loan from IMF Hekima. She displays her wares at the local market of the Majengo sector.  This new loan will allow her to buy two bags of beans from Rutshuru, a rural agricultural area in Nord Kivu.  In addition, her goal is to start construction works on her two plots of land already purchased. As a Hekima client, Hodari Pascalina appreciates its work in providing support to the poor who don't have access to the traditional banking system. It should be noted that the Tuamke group is composed mainly of women.

loans.use: two bags of beans

loans.name: Virgen Del Rosario Group

texts.es:
Felicia Lourdes P. M., 46 años D. edad, 2 hijos y presidenta del grupo: "Virgen del Rosario".
L. Señora Felicia todavìa tiene a su cargo a uno D. sus hijos que esta aùn en edad escolar; èl mayor D. sus hijos ya tiene familia y trabaja independientemente.
Felicia junto con su conviviente Piter R. Porras empezaron con este negocio hace 26 años. El negocio que ellos emprendieron los llevo hasta las punas D. Huancayo donD. crece L. Maca. Felicia compraba este producto para revender en los mercados locales; posteriormente les surgiò L. idea D. hacer harina D. maca, ya que D. este modo pueden ganar un mejor precio. 
El proceso D. L. Harina D. Maca: Es secar el producto bajo el fuerte sol, volteando L. Maca D. rato en rato, luego lo muelen en molinos artesanales a mano; D. allì obtienen como resultado L. harina D. Maca.
Felicia tiene muchas ganas D. superaciòn, tal es asì que, ahora piensa realizar el mismo proceso y hacer harina D. zanahoria.
El prèstamo adquirido serà para comprar Maca para deshitratar.
texts.en: Felicia Lourdes P. M., 46 years old, has two children and is the president of this group, "Virgen del Rosario."  She cares for one of her children, who is still in school.  The eldest of her children already has a family and works independently.  Felicia lives with her partner, Piter R. Porras.  They began this business over 26 years ago and operates it all the way to the Andean plateaus where the maca root grows.  Felicia bought this product in order to resell them at local markets.  Beforehand, the idea of making maca root flour was suggested because the product would sell at a higher price.  The process of making maca root flour is to dry the product under the sun, turning the maca from time to time.  Afterwards, they are crushed by hand using an artisan grinder; the result of which is maca root flour.  She has a great desire to overcome obstacles, as such she is now thinking of using the same process to make carrot flour.  She plans to use the loan that she is requesting to purchase maca root to dehydrate.

loans.use: Purchase maca root to be dehydrated.

loans.name: Hum's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hum Y. and her husband, Mr. Samoeun Horm, are farmers who own a plot of land where they grow rice and beans to sell to support their family. He also sells ice cream door-to-door. It is time for planting, but she does not have enough money to support the rice and bean field. To improve production, Mrs. Hum Y. is asking for a loan to buy rice and bean seed. She is the mother of four children: two of whom are ice cream sellers but the others are attending the local public school.

This group, which consists of five people, is led by Mrs. Hum Y. of Preaek Louk village in Kandal province. Their loans will be used in various ways to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To buy rice and bean seed

loans.name: Ivan Marcelino

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES  UNIDAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Iván Marcelino; el tiene 26 años de edad y es conviviente  y tiene 1 hijo; el socio se dedica a brindar el servicio de taxi, el trabaja todos los días por las mañanas y tardes siendo esta la única actividad que realiza por el momento y de esta forma saca a su familia adelante. El socio es una persona bien optimista y con muchas ganas de seguir adelante. 

El socio solicita el préstamo para realizar el mantenimiento de su carro y comprar algunos accesorios que le hace falta. 

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Mujeres Unidas communal bank located in Cusco district, Cusco province in Cusco district.

He is Iván Marcelino, 26, and he lives with his common-law wife and they have a son.  He has a taxi service and works daily in the mornings and afternoons.   This is his only work at the moment.  With the taxi service he is able to get his family ahead and being a very optimistic person,  he enthusiastically is working towards this goal.

Iván is requesting this loan for the upkeep of his car and to buy some accessories that he needs.

He is happy because of the loan and promises to make the payments in the established time period.

loans.use: Iván is requesting this loan for the upkeep of his car and to buy some accessories that he needs.

loans.name: Segundina

texts.es: La señora Segundina se dedica a la venta de comida en su domicilio, ya es su segundo ciclo en la institución y sigue contando con la ayuda de su hijo que le colabora con la preparación de algunos platos. Su esposo El Sr.  Eladio trabaja de noche como guardia de seguridad. El nuevo crédito que esta solicitando es para alquilar un local sobre la radial 10 ya que quiere tener una mejor atención y  para comprar un freezer, en su primer crédito demostró un buen comportamiento de pago. La Sra. Segundina es una persona trabajadora, responsable que busca la forma de superarse y seguir adelante y de esta manera mejorar la calidad de vida de toda su familia, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Senora Segundina sells food from her home.  This is her second cycle with the institution and she continues to rely on the help of her son who assists her with the preparation of some dishes.  Her husband, Eladio, works nights as a security guard.  The new loan will be used to rent a location above the tire store, as she wants to gain more attention, and to buy a freezer.  With her first loan she showed good repayment ability.  Segundina is a very hardworking, responsible person who is looking to better herself and improve the quality of life of her whole family.  She is very thankful to the institution for the support that it has given her.

loans.use: To rent a store, and buy a freezer and business capital

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet N. lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, and all her children go to school. Juliet has a business selling poultry. She has been in this business for 18 years, and she works seven days a week. Juliet sells her products at the market and from home. 

Juliet has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy chicken feed. Juliet lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity and piped water.

loans.use: To buy more bags of chicken feed

loans.name: David Kamau

texts.en:
David Kamau N. is 39 years old and married to Esther Mugure, who also contributes to the family's income. He has a carpentry shop that he has been operating for a period of three years with an income of about $244 per month. 

He has never borrowed from any other MFI (micro-finance institution) and this is his first loan from KADET LTD. He intends to use the money to buy lumber for his carpentry work. He hopes to own timberland in the future, which will increase his profits and improve his family's standard of living as a result.

loans.use: To buy lumber for his carpentry work

loans.name: Maria Theresa's Group

texts.en:
Maria Theresa D. is from the village of Simmimbaan. She is 23 years old. Maria Theresa is the leader of a six-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Maria Theresa D. Group.

Maria Theresa is married and has two infant children. To make a living, Maria Theresa plants and harvests  a variety of vegetables for sale. Maria Theresa is just starting this business.

In 2011, Maria Theresa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Maria Theresa is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the first loan taken out by Maria Theresa from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Los H. Group

texts.es:
El grupo los H. lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras estas son Darling, Leonardo y Mayra. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Darling quien se dedica a la venta de cosméticos en los cual invertirá el crédito en encargos como polvos, cremas, tratamientos, lapiz labial...etc.

Mientras Leonardo vende ropa de todos los estilos e invertira en pantalones, camiosas y trajes de baño y Mayra tiene una pequeña pulperia en la que invertira en la compra de granos básicos. 

*Don Leonardo trabaja en una empresa y le dieron permiso a cierta hora y sus compañeras no llegaron ese dia sino hasta el sieguiente por ello se le tomo la foto primero a el.
texts.en:
The H. group is composed of three hardworking people: Darling, Leonardo and Mayra. Darling is the coordinator of the group. She engages in selling cosmetics and she will invest the loan in buying products for her orders such as powders, creams, treatments, lip pencils and other items.

Leonardo sells clothes of every fashion and will invest in pants, shirts and bathing suits.  Mayra runs a small corner shop and will invest in the purchase of basic grains.

*Leonardo works at a business where he only obtains permission to leave at certain hours, and during one of these times the other group members were unable to be present for a picture, so first they took the picture just of him.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, creams and other products.

loans.name: Yader Fernando

texts.es: Yader se dedica a brindar el servicio de taxi, el es una persona muy abnegada y disfruta de su actividad económica. Esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos, por lo que ha sido una gran experiencia. Hace más de 20 años que tiene este medio de vida,  pues siempre ha sido una persona muy emprendedora y disfruta de obtener este medio de vida, ya que el siempre está pendiente de brindar un buen servicio. Este crédito es para la compra de llantas, repuesto,  entre otros productos que son necesarios.
texts.en: Yader makes a living providing taxi services. He is a very selfless man and he enjoys his work. This is not the first time that he has received financing. He has been making a living this way for over 20 years, so he has always been a very enterprising person and he enjoys this lifestyle, and he is always providing good service. This loan is for the purchase of tires and replacement parts, among other necessary products.

loans.use: to buy tires, replacement parts, and other needed products

loans.name: Solidario Tegedoras Comalapenses Group

texts.es: Solidario Tegedoras Comalapenses: Este Grupo esta conformado por tres señoras las cuales se dedican a la elavoracion de guipiles y cortes tipicos,la señora Maria Adela R. quien es la presidenta de este grupo ella se dedica a la elavoracion de guipiles,ella nos cuenta que tiene ya barios años de dedicarse a esta actividad,y dice que se siente muy contenta porque Gracias a Dios le a hido bien en su negocio ella al igual que las otras socias solicitan este credito para la compra de materia prima para la confeccion de tejidos como guipiles y cortes y asi tener mas aumento en su capital.
texts.en:
Tejedoras Comalpenses Group:
This group is made up of three women who manufacture guipiles (traditional blouses) and traditional fabrics.  Mrs. María Adela R. is group President and she makes guipiles.  She tells us that she’s been doing this for several years and feels happy because, thanks to God, she has done well in her business.  She, as well as the other group members, are asking for this loan to buy raw materials for the weaving of textiles like guipiles and traditional fabrics and thus have an increase in capital.

loans.use: to buy textile weaving supplies.

loans.name: Gerson Antonio

texts.es: EL SEÑOR GERSON LABORA COMO  RECIBIDOR Y ENTREGADOR, ES CASADO, TIENE  TRES PERSONAS  A SU CARGO, ES EL TERCER CREDITO CON CEPRODEL, LO NECESITA PARA COMPRAR MATERIALES DE CONSTRUCCION COMO HIERRO, ARENA, CEMENTO, BLOQUEY PAGAR MANO DE OBRA PARA HACER ANEXO DE UN CUARTO EN SU VIIVENDA.
texts.en: Gerson works in shipping and receiving, is married and cares for three members in his household.  This is his third credit from CEPRODEL, which he plans to use to purchase construction materials such as iron, sand, cement, blocks and to pay for labor to make needed housing reparis and to add another room onto his family home.

loans.use: to make housing improvements

loans.name: 25 De Mayo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “25 DE MAYO” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Villa Adela, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Lourdes. Los negocios de las señoras son diferentes, entre ellos tenemos: venta de calzados, venta de cosméticos, pensión, venta de verduras, carpintería, venta de CD’s.

La señora Lourdes,  indica que es el segundo ciclo que trabaja en Pro Mujer, e ingreso por invitación su amiga. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de calzados, el que aprendió vendiendo para otra señora. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su mercadería (compra de calzados), los que comprará del departamento de Oruro, de las mayoristas, y los comercializará en la avenida Litoral. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación.
texts.en:
The communal bank "25 de Mayo" will start its first loan cycle at the Villa Adela central office of Pro Mujer.  This group has 9 members, and is led by a board of directors headed by Lourdes.  The members of the group have a variety of businesses such as: selling shoes, selling cosmetics, running a home-based eatery, selling vegetables, carpentry and selling CDs. 

Lourdes tells us that this is her 2nd loan cycle working with Pro Mujer; she joined the organization at the invitation of a friend.  Now she has her own business selling shoes, a business she learned by selling for another woman.

She will use this new loan to increase her merchandise (to purchase shoes.)  She will buy the shoes from the wholesalers in the department of Oruro, and will sell them on the street on Litoral Avenue.  Through this work she can generate resources to support her family as much as possible, because she is married and has 5 children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answered that she likes the training.

loans.use: to buy shoes

loans.name: Arkadi

texts.en:
Arkadi works at the army. He lives with his wife and daughter. 

The main income to the family comes from the pig farm that Arkadi keeps. Currently, Arkadi needs to expand the business to earn additional income. Arkadi has applied for this loan to acquire two mother pigs and forage.

loans.use: to pay for pigs and forage.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.ru:
Светлане 51 год, замужем и проживает с мужем, средним сыном и снохой. Мать троих детей (три сына) - старший сын женат и живет отдельно, младший сын проживает и учится в Бишкеке (столица Кыргызстана).
Светлана родилась в многодетной и простой (5 детей) семье скотника. Она была младшей дочерью. По окончании школы Светлана поступила в техникум по специальности библиотекарь в городе Токмок (Чуйская область, Кыргызская Республика). Отучившись, Светлана приехала в родное село и начала работать в местной библиотеке, но в связи с трудным материальным положением, она устроилась в местном колхозе дояркой. Там же и работал ее будущий муж водителем грузового авто. Познакомились они в 1983 году и в этом же году поженились,  а год спустя у них родился первый сын. Так как муж Светланы младший сын в семье, он (согласно  традиционным кыргызским обычаям) остается с родителями. В 1987 году и 1989 году у семьи Онобасовых рождаются еще два мальчика. В первое время им было с мужем тяжело - с распадом колхоза Светлана и Сыязбек остаются без работы и решают начать свой бизнес: на выделенные ранее колхозом земле, они выращивают зерновые культуры и на прибыль, вырученную от продажи урожая,  приобретают скот. Сейчас в хозяйстве Светланы имеется три коровы, пять бычков, четыре телочки и  три лошади. Так как за последние годы у Светланы было много расходов, связанных с женитьбой старших сыновей и оплаты обучения младшего сына в университете, она обратилась за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) для покупки дойной коровы. В планах Светланы – дальнейшее  увеличение поголовья скота и развитие бизнеса. 
ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" предоставляет кредиты по линии Кива для социально-уязвимых слоев населения. ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" является одной из лидирующих Микрофинансовых организаций Кыргызстана. "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" – это надежный финансовый партнер, осуществляющий вклад в развитие экономики Кыргызской Республики путем предоставления доступных микрофинансовых услуг в сельской местности и городах, способствующих созданию рабочих мест и отвечающий интересам своих клиентов и инвесторов.
texts.en:
Svetlana is 51 years old, she is married and lives with her husband, middle son and her daughter-in-law. She is a mother of three sons - her oldest son is married and lives separately, her youngest son lives and studies in Bishkek (the capital of Kyrgyzstan).

Svetlana was born in a large family of a cattleman with five children. She is the youngest daughter. After graduating from school Svetlana enrolled in a technical school in the town of Tokmok in they Chuysk province of the Kyrgyz Republic to become a librarian. After she finished her studies Svetlana came back to her home village and began working in the local library, but because of the financial hardship she also got a job in the local farm as a milkmaid. Her future husband was also working there as a small truck driver. They met in 1983 and had married in the same year and a year later their first son was born. Because Svetalana's husband was youngest son in their family, according to the Kyrgyz tradition he is supposed to stay with his parents.

In 1987 and 1989 in the Onobasov family two more boys were born. In the beginning it was very hard for Svetlana and her husband - because of the collapse of the farm she and Siyazbek were left without jobs and decided to start their own business. They used the plot of land which was given to them earlier by the farm to grow cereals and used the profit gained from the sale of the harvest to buy cattle. Right now in Svetlana's household there are three cows, five male and four female calves, and three horses. During the past several years Svetlana had many expenses which had to do with the weddings of her older sons and tuition fees for her youngest son's education in the university, so she has come to ask for a loan in the amount of 40,000 soms (KGS) to buy a milk cow. Svetlana plans to further increase the headcount of the cattle and developing her business.


About Bai-Tushum and Partners:
Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas which leads to job creation and serves the interests of its borrowers and lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es: El sr. Reynaldo, es un cliente nuevo, con buena referencia crediticia, se dedica a la confección de pantalones y a la vez a su venta, su puesto es puesto fijo en una de las calle comerciales de la ciudad de La paz, por lo que se pudo evidenciar el cliente en el momento de la evaluación, fue muy atento y además cordial, El sr. Reynaldo vive en la zona Alto Chijini, también  el sr. Reynaldo lleva a vender su mercadería al interior a las ciudades de Oruro y Cochabamba y a la feria 16 de julio, es un cliente trabajador y muy dinámico, que tiene mucho entusiasmo en cuanto a su trabajo, para así con el  tiempo, comprarse una casa que este en una avenida o en una calle comercial, con el dinero del crédito comprara variedad de telas para surtir su sastrería, es una persona trabajadora agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Reynaldo is a new client with good credit references.  He makes pants to sell.  His stand is a fixed stand on one of La Paz’s commercial streets so we were able to verify his situation at the moment the evaluation took place; he was very attentive and also courteous.

Reynaldo lives in the Alto Chijini zone.  He also takes his merchandise to cities in the interior, like Oruro and Cochabamba, to sell and also sells at the 16 de Julio market.  

He is a hardworking, dynamic client who is very enthusiastic about his work hoping in time to be able to buy a house located on a commercial avenue or street.  He will use the money from the loan to buy an assortment of fabric to stock his tailor shop.  He is a hard working person who is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to stock up on fabric.

loans.name: El Tele Sur Group

texts.es: Las socias pertenecen al banco comunal EL Tele Sur Este banco se ubica en el municipio del jicaral. Hilda es la coordinadora del grupo ella es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Ella tiene su negocio que es el servicio de costura, tiene más de 7 años en su negocio es una persona muy emprendedora pues la mayoría de sus clientes llegan a solicitarle las diferentes prendas de vestir que ella elabora. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de materia prima como telas, hilos, zipper, tijeras, dedales, entre otros.  Los otros socios se dedican a diferentes negocios y con mucho esfuerzo han logrado salir adelante.
texts.en: These are the members of the communal bank "El Tele Sur."  This bank is located in the municipality of Jicaral.  Hilda is the coordinator of the group.  She is a single mother with 2 children in her care.  She has had a dressmaking business for more than 7 years.  She is a very enterprising woman; most of her customers come to her to request the different types of clothes that she makes.  The loan that she requests will be used to buy sewing supplies such as: fabric, thread, zippers, scissors, thimbles, and other supplies.  The other members of the group have different types of businesses, and with a lot of effort, they have managed to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, zippers, scissors, thimbles, and other sewing supplies

loans.name: Fares

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 37 years old, married and has three children.

Fares has been the owner of a shop for photocopying and mobiles since 2004. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs and he has a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $3000 loan in order to purchase a tornado phone unlock code. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase a tornado phone unlock code (unlocks phones remotely).

loans.name: Coumba O. Diatta Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité CoumB. O. Diatta a été crée le 23 Juillet 2011 à l'inauguration du banc villageois. Il est composé de 31 femmes toutes issues du même village et menant comme activité principale le petit commerce. 

Debout à l'extrême droite de la photo et levant la main, la responsable est âgée de 39 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants. 

Elle vend du sucre, de la cigarette et du thé. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine pour l'avoir pratiqué au moins trois ans. 

ce nouveau prêt lui permettra de s'approvisionner en sucre, cigarettes et thé pour la revente. 

Avec les intérêts générés, elle compte aider son mari dans la prise en charge des besoins de la famille et surtout des enfants.
texts.en:
The solidarity group CoumB. O. Diatta was created on July 23, 2011 when the Banc Villageois was inaugurated. The group comprises 31 women all from the same village. Their main work involves small businesses. 

Standing with her hand raised at the far right in the photo, the group's official is 39 years old, married, and the mother of three children. She sells sugar, cigarettes, and tea.  She has good experience in this domain for having worked in it for at least three years.

This new loan will enable her to stock up on sugar, cigarettes, and tea to resell.

With the profits generated, she plans on helping out her husband in meeting the needs of the family and especially those of the children.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (sugar, cigarettes, and tea)

loans.name: Abibumbiyehamwe Group

texts.fr:
Daphrose  est une commerçante  âgée de 47 ans . Elle habite  la localité de Mweya en province de Gitega.  Elle vend les produits alimentaires dans un restaurant depuis 16 ans et fait aussi la broderie.Elle est aussi cultivatrice. Elle a fait les études jusqu’en 6e année primaire.Elle est divorcee et a 8 enfants dont  4 étudient avec 1 qui est a l’ecole secondaire .
 Le crédit de Kiva de 80000 Fbu va  lui permettre  d’augmenter  le capital  afin d’acheter beaucoup  de  produits  alimentaires comme la farine et des fils pour sa broderie dans le but de realiser de grands bénéfices. 
Elle est membre du groupe communautaire  “ABIBUMBIYEHAMWE”
texts.en:
Daphrose is a merchant, 47 years old, who lives in the town of Mweya in Gitega Province. She has been selling food in a restaurant for sixteen years, as well as embroidery. She is also a farmer. She went to school through the 6th grade. She is divorced and has eight children, of whom four are in school with one in middle school. 

The Kiva loan of 80,000 Fbu is going to enable her to increase her capital to buy a lot of supplies, such as flour and thread for her embroidery, with the goal of making a large profit.  

Daphrose is a member of the community group “ABIBUMBIYEHAMWE”.

loans.use: to increase capital to buy a lot of grocery items, such as flour and thread for her embroidery, with the goal of making a large profit

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa sells plantain and gari at Kukwa market near Abura. She is widow and has 4 children. She sees to the well-being of her home. Her loan will be used to buy more plantain and gari for sale. Gari is a Ghanaian staple – a type of flour made from cassava. To prepare the gari, she gets raw, fresh cassavas from the market. She washes and peels the cassavas, and then sends them to the mill to be milled into dough. She puts the dough in a sack and places heavy stones on it. The stones are placed to drain the starch out of the dough. She leaves the dough for a day or two depending on the weight of the stones. After this process, she stirfries the gari in a pan on a fire. The gari is then left to cool and bagged into small bags for sale. 

Gari is a starchy food in Ghana that is mostly enjoyed by students and large families. Students eat gari a lot because it is a quick and easy food to prepare. They soak gari mix with condensed milk and water, and sometimes add peanuts. Some students also prepare gari in the form of dough and eat it with pepper sauce and sardines. Families also eat gari for lunch or supper, usually served with soup or pepper sauce. The soups that are mostly accompanied with gari are okra soup, groundnut (peanut) soup, palm nut soup, and vegetable soup. Various sauces can also be used to accompany gari such as pepper sauce, curry sauce, and tomato sauce. The variety of the sauce served with the gari depends on the family’s preferences. Any kind of meat or fish can be eaten with these soups and sauces.

Yaa hopes to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: to buy more plantain and gari to sell.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en: Gayane lives in the Shirak region of Armenia in the village of Arevshat.  She is married with two children – an eight-year-old daughter and a seven-year-old son.  Gayane has a high school education and has been a sole entrepreneur for the past twelve years.  She supports her relatives in the city with agricultural products.  Gayane would like to expand her business with a loan to purchase wheat seeds.  Planting the seeds in autumn, Gayane expects the family income to increase by fifteen percent in the spring.  She likes living in Arevshat and is surrounded by her relatives and close friends.

loans.use: to purchase wheat seeds

loans.name: Anne

texts.en: Anne is married and blessed with two children who are still in school. For the past ten years she has been managing a cereal shop to earn a living. She works hard in her business so as to provide for her family. In the next 5 years, she wants to manage a wholesale business. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 KES to buy a weighing machine. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to access loan to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy a weighing machine.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty wants a loan to buy milk for resale. She is a 34-year-old widow with four children living in Masindi, Uganda. She operates a retail shop selling milk and other milk products. She has owned this business for seven years. Betty’s dream is to own a dairy farm.

loans.use: to buy milk for resale

loans.name: Julia Maxmiliana

texts.es:
Julia Maximiliana sigue participando en el banco comunal “Qorichaska del Cusco” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas de la Asociación  Arariwa. Julia Maximiliana sigue dedicándose a la venta de cosméticos,  ropa y zapatos. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que hace cuatro meses atrás apertura un bar - restaurante.   

Julia Maximiliana con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien y pudo obtener buenos beneficios y por ese motivo desea otro préstamo pues le ayuda mucho. 

Julia Maximiliana requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercedaria como arroz, azúcar, carne, cereales, menestras, verduras y otras cosas más. 


Julia Maximiliana se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Julia Maximiliana continues to be a member of the communal bank "Qorichaska del Cusco" at the Arariwa Association's microfinance unit.  She sells cosmetics, clothing and shoes for a living.  She is an enterprising woman and opened a bar-restaurant four months ago.

Julia Maximiliana's previous loan was of great help and she was able to obtain a good profit, therefore she is requesting another one.  She plans to use it to buy goods such as rice, sugar, meat, cereals, vegetables and other items.

She is grateful for this opportunity and committed to paying back the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy goods such as rice, sugar, meat, cereals, vegetables and other items.

loans.name: Obadias

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Guija, Província de Gaza, Sul de Moçambique, casado e pai de 4  filhos destes  2 ainda frequentam escola. Fez a 4ª classe e não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e naõ sustenta mais ninguem para alem da sua familia. 

Saiu de Gaza para o Distrito de Boane a procura de melhores condições de vida, trabalha numa empresa de extração de pedra compo responsavel de arrebentamento das minas de pedra ha mais de 19 anos e tem um salario de 7.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimos noutros bancos conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de um amigo colega que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu quinto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 16.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para melhorar a sua casa (areia, cimento, portas, sanitas e outros). Os emprestimos anteriores foram de 4.200.00mt, 9.200.00, 10.000.00, 11.000.00 e  14.000.00mt, todos aplicados na construção da sua casa .
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende terminar a obra da sua casa e comprar mobiliario, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
