texts.en:
He was born in the district of Guija, province of Gaza, southern Mozambique. He is married and has four children, two of which still attend school. He completed 4th grade and didn't continue for lack of financial conditions. He lives with his family in a house he owns and doesn't support anyone else other than his family.
He left Gaza for the district of Boane in search of better living conditions. He has worked for a stone quarrying company for over 19 years. He is responsible for breaking in stone mines and earns a salary of 7.000mt a month. He uses it to pay for home expenses and saves part of it in his bank account.
He has never had loans in other banks. He first heard of Hluvuku through a friend and co-worker who is also a client of this institution. This is his fifth loan with Hluvuku. It is for 16.000mt, which he intends to use to purchase construction supplies in order to make home improvements (sand, cement, doors, sanitary ware, etc.). The previous loans were for 4.200mt, 9.200mt, 10.000mt, 11.000mt and 14.000mt, and all of them were used to build his house.
He promises to repay according to the schedule. In the future he plans to finish building his house and to purchase furniture. For that purpose he intends to request more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies in order to make home improvements (sand, cement, doors, sanitary ware, etc.).

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria nació en la  ciudad de Sicuani al sur de la ciudad del Cusco. Actualmente, ella radica en la antigua ciudad del Imperio de los Incas (Cusco). Gloria tiene 32 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene un  hijo. Gloria desarrolla sus actividades cotidianas y económicas en la ciudad del Cusco.   

Gloria trabaja en una agencia de viajes en la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son cuatro años que se dedica a este trabajo y le va muy bien gracias a al empeño que pone sus funciones laborales.  Su esposo de Gloria tiene un estudio contable en la misma ciudad y de esa forma su esposo ayuda con el gasto familiar. 

Gloria pertenece al banco comunal “Ñahupacman Purisun” de la Asociación  Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Gloria requiere el préstamo para implementar la oficina de su esposo ósea desea comprar materiales de escritorio como por ejemplo papel, cuadernos, hojas, lapiceros y otras cosas más. 

Gloria se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en: Gloria was born in the city of Sicuani to the south of the city of Cusco. She currently resides in the ancient imperial home of the Incas (Cusco). Gloria is 32 years old, married and has a child. She has worked at a travel agency in Cusco for the past four years, and it is going well thanks to the hard work she puts into her job. Her husband has an accounting office in the same city, and in this way they support each other with household expenses. Gloria belongs to the “Ñahupacman Purisun” Community Bank of Kiva partner Asociación Arariwa in Cusco. She is requesting the loan to set up her husband's office by purchasing writing materials such as paper, notebooks, page sheets, pens and other items. Gloria is grateful for the opportunity provided through this medium and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase more writing materials, such as paper, notebooks, page sheets, pens and other items.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal ”VIRGEN CONCEBIDA DE ARIN”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Arin en la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es el Sr. Juan;  El socio tiene 45 años de edad, El socio es soltero, El socio es agricultor el socio tiene terrenos de cultivo de maíz, papa, hortalizas, también cría animales menores tales como cuyes, conejos, pollos, en esta ocasión el socio desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de 20 cuyes para criar y de 30 pollos tiernos. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de 30 pollos tiernos y de 20 pares de  cuyes.

El socio agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the "Virgen Concebida de Arin" communal bank. The bank is located in the Arin district of the Calca province, Cusco department.
This is Mr. Juan. He is 45, single, and works as a farmer. He sows corn, potato, and other vegetables. He also raises small animals such as guinea pigs, rabbits, and chickens. He wants to invest this loan in the purchase of 20 guinea pigs to raise, as well as 30 young chickens. He is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of 30 young chickens and 20 pairs of guinea pigs.
He is grateful for this loan and promises to repay his quotas as planned.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of 30 young chickens and 20 pairs of guinea pigs.

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es:
Rosmery, de 27 años, es una mujer buena y amable, esta casada y tiene tres hijos de 7, 2 años y el menor de 10 meses, ella junto a su esposo y sus hijos vive en una casa propia en donde comparten todos los días la alegría de ver crecer a su familia. El trabajo de Rosmery consiste en la venta de comida, ella muy temprano sale al mercado en busca de los mejores ingredientes ya que le gusta brindar lo mejor a sus clientes, una vez que tiene todos los ingredientes seleccionados por sus mágicas manos, comienza a preparar los platos que ofrecerá, al terminar su preparación lleva todo lo preparado a los aserraderos de la ciudad en donde comienza a vender, tiene el gusto de atender solo a pedidos ya que su exquisita sazón hace que tenga muchos clientes. Se inició vendiendo de a poco hace tres años ya que tenía la necesidad de aportar económicamente al hogar.
Esta muy contenta con su trabajo ya que le permite tener muy bueno ingresos, lo hace sola y le da tiempo de descansar tranquila y brindar el tiempo a su familia, tiene muchos planes para su futuro pero el que es mas a corto plazo es el de poner un restaurante para no tener que estar yendo a lugares lejanos a vender, pero sabe que es algo que tendrá que hacer con mucho capital y por ello trabajara mucho para poder juntar e iniciar con su proyecto. Este será el primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá mas segura de avanzar con lo que hace, además se compromete a realizar el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el  monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará ingredientes e insumos para seguir con su trabajo, además de algunas verduras y productos no perecibles.
texts.en:
Rosmery, age 27, is a good and friendly woman. She is married and has three children, ages 7, 2, and, the youngest, 10 months. She lives with her husband and children in their own house where they share happiness every day in seeing their family grow.

Rosmery’s work consists of selling meals. She leaves very early for the market where she looks for the best ingredients since she likes to offer the best to her customers. Once she has all the selected ingredients her magic hands begin to prepare the dishes she will offer. Upon finishing her preparation, she takes everything she has made to the saw mills in the city where she begins to sell. She has the pleasure of serving only based on orders since her exquisite flavor makes her have many customers. She began selling about three years ago since she needed to contribute economically to the household.

Rosmery is very happy with her work since it permits her to have very good earnings. She does her work alone, and it gives her the time to rest peacefully and offer time to her family. She has many plans for the future, but for the short term her plan is to have a restaurant so that she doesn’t have to sell at places far from home. She knows that this is something for which she will need a lot of capital, and that’s why she will work hard in order to bring it together and begin her project.

This will be her first loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she will have financial support since she will feel more certain of progressing with what she does. In addition, she promises to make all her payments in a timely fashion. With the sum applied for (1000 soles) she will buy ingredients and resources in order to continue with her work, including some vegetables and nonperishable products.

loans.use: to purchase basic materials for preparing food, including vegetables and nonperishable products.

loans.name: Mirian Gladis

texts.es:
Mirian nació en la ciudad de Calca y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, ella tiene 47 años edad y es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos, ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con su pequeño trabajo, ella trabaja en el cafetín  de la universidad de la ciudad de Calca y la pueden encontrar desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde de lunes a viernes. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. Mirian en sus horas libres se dedica a la venta de maíz y habas y también se dedica a la preparación de comida. 

Mirian en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más insumos como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos y verduras. 

Mirian es integrante del grupo “Virgen de Asunta de Calca” lo conforman 15 socios que viven en la ciudad de Calca de la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco, Perú.
texts.en:
Mirian was born in the city of Calca where she still lives.  She is 47, married and has two children.  She divides her time between taking care of her home and running a coffee shop at the university in Calca.  Her work hours are from 7:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m., Monday through Friday.  She has been in business for several years now and it has done well.  In her free time, Mirian sells corn and lima beans and also makes food.

Mirian is requesting a loan to buy goods such as rice, sugar, pasta and vegetables.

She is a member of the communal bank "Virgen de Asunta de Calca" which is comprised of 15 members who live in Calca, in the province of Calca and department of Cusco, Perú.

loans.use: To buy goods such as rice, sugar, pasta and vegetables.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: La señora Luz Marina posee un negocio de sala de belleza y venta de productos para uso personal en su casa desde hace cinco años, gracias a la ayuda de su familia quien la apoyo económica y moralmente para iniciar su negocio. Con esta actividad puede generar los ingresos suficientes para suplir sus necesidades y aportar para su hogar. Con el fin de mejorar su surtido y ventas, la señora Luz Marina necesita de la compra de nuevos productos para ofrecer a sus clientes. El sueño de la señora Luz Marina es ampliar su negocio y mejorar la calidad de vida de sus padres.
texts.en: Luz Marina has had a beauty salon business and has sold beauty products from her house for the past 5 years, thanks to the help from her family who supported her economically and morally to start her business. With this business she can generate sufficient income to supply her necessities and support her home. With the goal of bettering her selection and sales, Luz Marina needs to buy new products to offer to her clients. Luz Marina's dream is to enlarge her business and improve the quality of life of her parents.

loans.use: to buy beauty products such as perfumes and creams

loans.name: Aydee

texts.es: Haydee, de 28 años de edad, es una mujer sencilla y muy trabajadora, esta casada con Edison de 30 años y tienen 03 hijos en etapa escolar y juntos residen en su propia morada donde reina la armonía. Haydee trabaja arduamente desde hace 13 años se dedica a la venta de abarrotes. Con sus ahorros acumulados abrió una tienda en donde ofrece variedad de productos de primera necesidad. Su negocio le genera buenas ganancias económicas,y cada día ella desde muy temprano lo abre en espera de sus primeros compradores. Menciona que la clave de captar consumidores es atender amablemente y apoyarlos en sus compras. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es quedar bien con sus clientes, ya  lleva seis años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer de pie  todo el transcurso del día. En su negocio le va muy bien ya que gracias a ello pudo adquirir mas terreno para cultivar, siendo su esposo quien lo trabaja. Con el tiempo, espera poder ampliar su vivienda y así agrandar su  bodega. Este es el crédito número 06 con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que contará una vez más con el apoyo de los financistas para seguir creciendo. En su banco comunal es una socia participe y muy puntual en las reuniones. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles, comprará mercadería como: sacos de arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, etc.
texts.en:
Haydee, 28, is an unassuming, very hardworking woman who is married to Edison, 30; they have three school age children and they live together in their own house where harmony reigns.

Haydee has been working hard for 13 years selling groceries.  She used her accumulated savings to open a store where she sells a variety of basic staple items.  Her business generates good economic profits and every day she opens up expecting her first buyers.

She mentions that the key to capturing customers is to tend to them kindly and support their purchases.  What she most likes about her work is to satisfy her customers.  She’s been in business six years and considers the most difficult part of it to have to remain standing all day.  She does well in her business because thanks to it she was able to buy more farmland for her husband to work.  In time she hopes to be able to enlarger her house as well as her store.

This is MFP loan #6 and she is very happy to know that she can once again count on support from lenders to continue growing.  She is a very participative, punctual member of her communal bank’s meetings.  She will use the 3000 new soles to buy merchandise like sacks of rice, sugar, oil, detergent, etc.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, sugar, oil and detergent.

loans.name: Willington Rubén

texts.es: El cliente reside en Libertad.  Empezó vendiendo refrescos en su casa y de a poco fue vendiendo productos de primera necesidad hasta que pudo juntar dinero suficiente para montar su propia tienda.  Su trabajo lo realiza junto con su esposa todos los días.  Su esposa se ocupa tanto de las labores del hogar como de ayudarlo atendiendo la tienda.  Tiene hijos, son menores de edad y estudian en la escuela fiscal de su localidad.  Desearía poder tener su propio local comercial en el sector donde vive.  Por ahora requiere el préstamo para la compra de arroz, azúcar, confitería y otros productos para su negocio.

loans.use: Compra de víveres

loans.name: Vivogbe Group

texts.fr: Le groupe VIVOGBE est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans la même maison.  Elise, la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 34 ans est mariée à un électricien du nom de Rigobert. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Elise vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les différentes charges de ménage sont supportées par Elise et son mari. Elise n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face aux charges de la maison depuis sept ans, Elise prépare de la nourriture(riz, pâte de maïs accompagnés de sauce) dans sa région. Elise s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Elise sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe VIVOGBE un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter du riz, du haricot, du maïs et des cartons de poissons.

loans.name: Mahude 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUDE 1 est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Hounzangbè Rosaline est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Hounzangbè Rosaline est âgée de 56 ans et est mariée à un certain Albert. Le couple a six enfants, tous scolarisés et quatre à leur charge. Hounzangbè Rosaline vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Hounzangbè Rosaline supporte ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges familiales. Pour y parvenir, Hounzangbè Rosaline prépare de la nourriture qu'elle vend dans sa région Hounzangbè Rosaline vend aussi divers produits (sucre, lait, savon etc) dans sa région. En plus de cette activité, Hounzangbè Rosaline vend également du charbon de bois. Hounzangbè Rosaline mène cette activité depuis cinq ans. Hounzangbè Rosaline achète ses produits dans un marché du Bénin. Hounzangbè Rosaline désire satisfaire un plus grand nombre de clients par ses produits, mais Hounzangbè Rosaline ne dispose pas suffisamment de moyens financiers pouvant lui permettre de rehausser le niveau de son activité. C’est pour ce faire que Hounzangbè Rosaline sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUDE 1.

loans.use: Acheter des sacs de riz, de haricot et divers produits.

loans.name: Clenia

texts.en:
Clenia is 68 years old and lives in Villalin, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with 3 children now at their adult age. 
Clenia is engaged in agricultural activity particularly rice production and mini botanical garden cultivation. She’s been doing this for 8 years already.  At present, she is enjoying her monthly pension as a retired public teacher. She earns approximately PHP4,000.00 each month doing this type of business activity.  She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing commercial fertilizers, foliar and pesticides for her rice production and botanical garden cultivation. 
Clenia has been a member of PMPC just this year. In the future, Clenia hopes to expand her business by developing all her available areas of land into a botanical and floral garden.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing commercial fertilizers, foliar and pesticides

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly is 40 years old, married with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Merly has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines. Merly requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stock of charcoal to sell.

Merly has been in this business for four years. In the future, Merly would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Kadiatou's Group

texts.fr:
Inauguré en Septembre 2013, ce banc villageois est composé de femmes du groupement du village qui ont adhéré dans le programme afin de rendre les activités dans le petit commerce plus rentables. Une bonne ambiance anime les rencontres du groupe. 

Madame Kadiatou, âgée de 23 ans (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants dont 02 garçons et 01 fille. Elle s’active dans le commerce en bétail. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés régionaux.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 05 chèvres et 02 moutons les engraissées et les revendre au bout de 3 à 4 mois en détails.

Ses bénéfices sont destinés à appuyer son mari dans la dépense quotidienne et à la scolarité de ses enfants.

loans.use: acheter 05 chèvres et 02 moutons les engraissées et les revendre au bout de 3 à 4 mois en détails.

loans.name: Osman Andres

texts.en:
My name is Osman Andres. I am a businessman and operate a business of new clothing and other things, located in the transportation terminal in my city. For many years I have dedicated myself to this type of business, along with my wife. It has given us income to cover our family expenses and commitments. Through the blessings of this business we have bought a house and are improving it, little by little.

Translated from Spanish by Ruth, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi Nombre es Osman Andres, soy comerciante y cuento con un negocio de venta de ropa nueva y otros, ubicado en la terminal de transporte de mi ciudad, cuento con varios años de dedicarmen a este tipo de negocio junto con mi esposa, el que nos genera ingresos para cubrir nuestros gastos familiares y demas compromisos, con las utilidades que nos da este negocio hemos comprado una casa la que poco a poco iremos mejorando.

loans.use: To purchase clothing, including slippers, jackets, underwear, shirts and blouses, and dresses.

loans.name: Lamo

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the eight women of the Kawral association, led by Lamo S.. In their loan application, the group described their business as follows:

“ Our business strategy depends on the capacity of the group to stock enough farm products [e.g. millet, yams, peanuts] to establish our own fund dedicated to the periodic replenishment of our stock of quality food products at good prices, to be sold in the bi-weekly markets. Our business activities will consist of purchasing the goods when their price is very low (strong supply), store them, and sell them in the local markets.”

Original French business description:

« Contexte du projet : Avec toutes les conséquences néfastes liées à la production agricole inadaptée, la destruction massive des sols et autres phénomènes liés à la désertification ;le département de M’BACKE se retrouve avec un déséquilibre

Objectif général : Augmentation durable des revenus agricole

Objectifs spécifiques

• Lutter contre la pauvreté du milieu rural (communauté rurale de DENDEYE)

Stratégie

Elle repose sur la capacité du G I E à stocker assez de produits de première nécessité pour constituer un fond Propre destiné au renouvellement périodiques des denrées de qualités à bons prix destinées à la vente dans les marchés hebdomadaires (LOUMA)

Activités

Il s’agira d’acheté de la matière première au moment ou le prix est très bas. ( forte offre ) et de les stocker et d’organiser des actions de commercialisations dans les marchés locaux.

Activité 1 : achats matières premières

Activité : commercialisation»

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines. Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. The SEM Fund works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

loans.use: Purchase of farm products; transportation to market for retail sale

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Ricardo is a clothing and garment salesman who has more than thirty years of experience as a retailer. He not only sells to individuals, but is also a distributor to other salespeople in the area.  Most of his clients buy on credit because of their lack of liquidity. Ramon is a very good collector because of his experience. He works diligently from 8 am until 7 pm. Although he is 65 years old, he plans on working for much longer. He feels the need to help his four sons establish themselves and start businesses of their own. He will invest the money in wholesale purchases of new products.

Ricardo’s first loan was a success by all measures. He repaid on time and his business grew as well. He now works closely with one of his sons who has become involved in his trade. He feels proud that he not only has a flourishing business but also that his family is taking part in it. He is optimistic about his second loan with Kiva and Mifex.

loans.use: to invest in inventory

loans.name: Aracely

texts.es:
Aracely is married and lives in San Nicolás in Nuevo León. A year ago Aracely decided to start selling clothes from catalogues in order to help her husband to build a better future for their children and to offer them economic stability. She started selling to neighbors and family members but soon had many more clients thanks to her good service and her easy going personality.

Araceli is now asking for a loan of $475 which she will use to buy merchandise in order to meet her clients’ demands and to offer them a better service. She promises to repay this amount over a period of 6 months. You can be an important part in the growth of this business. Aracely thanks you for the opportunity that you can offer her.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Aracely es casada y vive en la localidad de San Nicolás en Nuevo León. Para ayudar a su esposo a construir un patrimonio para sus futuros hijos y ofrecerles una estabilidad económica, desde hace un año Aracely se dedica a la venta de calzado por catálogo, comenzó vendiendo entre sus vecinos y familiares pero pronto ha logrado ganar más clientes gracias al buen servicio que ofrece y a su carácter que le facilita relacionarse con las personas.

Ahora Aracely está solicitando un crédito por $ 475 dólares que destinará a la compra de mercancía para surtir los pedidos que tiene y ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte importante en el crecimiento de este negocio, Aracely agradece mucho la oportunidad que le brindas de mejorar.

loans.use: To buy merchandise/Compra de mercancía

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en: Mustafa K. is twenty-seven years old with three children.  He has been running his business for 9 years, even continuing during the civil war.  Married with three children, Mustafa had no opportunity for education.  He is therefore determined to provide a good education for his children.  With his previous loan, he was able to increase his stock and his profit.  He would like to involve his wife in his business and therefore is requesting a loan of US$ 200, to expand the business.

loans.use: Increase his clothing inventory so that he can expand his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase her business.

loans.name: Aquilina

texts.es:
Aquilina has always been devoted to work and thus acquired a useful piece of knowledge, that she now applies to her life and teaches to her children as well. With great diligence and creativity, she has seeked the way to create businesses and provide services that have helped her advance in life. When she was young, she used to travel to different cities to sell several items, such as clothes and cosmetics. When she got married, she had to stay at home, so she decided to offer her products to her neighbors. When her husband died, the need became pressing and pushed her into a worrying financial crisis, as she was burdened with the responsibility of providing for her little children on her own. In spite of this situation, she continued performing different crafts, as opportunities presented themselves. She was often forced to accept work that required great physical effort. After putting up a tough fight, Aquilina is satisfied to see her children have become people who can stand for themselves and face critical situations of need. She presently lives with only two of her daughters, both single mothers. The wish of this hardworking mother, who spends long hours doing laundry for her clients, is to acquire a laundry machine, in order to reduce the physical effort and soon be able to open a laundry to offer services to the whole community.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Aquilina siempre ha estado dedicada al trabajo y adquirió una enseñanza de valor que ahora aplica en su vida misma e impulsó a que aprendan sus hijos; así, con mucha diligencia y creatividad, busca la forma de crear negocios y servicios que la ayudan a sobresalir. Desde su juventud viajaba a distintas ciudades para vender diferentes artículos tales como prendas de vestir, cosméticos, etc. Cuando se casó ya no pudo dedicarse a este negocio de la misma manera, por lo que decidió ofertarlos a sus vecinas; sin embargo, la necesidad fue aún más apremiante cuando su esposo falleció y tenía la responsabilidad de velar por sus pequeños, ahora sin ayuda y compañía. Este hecho la condujo a una crisis económica muy preocupante; a pesar de ello, siguió ocupándose en diversos oficios y labores según se presentaban las oportunidades, aceptando muchas veces trabajos que requerían gran esfuerzo físico. Aquilina, después de su ardua lucha, puede ver con satisfacción a sus hijos convertidos en personas que pueden valerse por si mismos y preparados para enfrentar situaciones críticas de escasez. Hoy sólo vive con dos de sus hijas, que son madres solteras. El deseo de esta trabajadora madre, que dedica interminables horas a lavar las prendas y frazadas de otras personas, es adquirir una lavadora a fin de aminorar su esfuerzo y pronto establecer una lavandería para ofrecer sus servicios a su comunidad entera.

loans.use: Purchase of a laundry machine.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience is into the sales of drinks. She is 36 years old and married with three children. She is the leader of her Union. She is from Edo State. She learned this business for a year. She asks for the loan of $450 to buy more drinks to sell. She has been in business since 2002.

loans.use: To buy more drinks to sell

loans.name: Yesica

texts.en:
With many hopes and dreams to form a home full of love and affection, Yesica decided to join Roger, a young motivate musician. She is 21 years old and is from the Sandia province but due to work she now lives in Juliaca. Since she began her family 9 months ago she began to dedicate herself to knitting beautiful outfits. She learned this artistic skill from the instruction of her sister-in-law Begilia, who taught her with much patience and diligence. Yesica would like to concentrate fully on this work and therefore needs to purchase more variety of materials (wool) for the creation of her products. With this intent, she requests from you your help to fulfill her dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Gabriel Santamaria, Kiva Volunteer.

Con muchas ilusiones y la esperanza de formar un hogar donde reine el amor y el cariño, Yesica, decidió unirse con Roger, joven emprendedor dedicado a la música. Ella tiene 21 años de edad y es natural de la provincia de Sandia pero por circunstancias de trabajo radica en Juliaca.Desde que formó su familia hace más de 9 meses decidió dedicarse al tejido de hermosas prendas de vestir, bello arte que aprendió gracias a las instrucciones de su cuñada Begilia quien le transmitió con mucha paciencia y diligencia sus conocimientos, que ahora Yesica con agilidad y habilidad desempeña.El deseo de Yesica es dedicarse completamente a esta labor es por eso que requiere comprar gran cantidad y variedad de materia prima (lana) para la elaboración de su mercadería, con este propósito recurre a ti en búsqueda de tu ayuda.Con vuestra ayuda Yesica cristalizará sus deseos.

loans.use: Purchase a larger quantity and variety of materials.

loans.name: Huram

texts.ru:
Huram Umarovich M. lives in the Shahrinov region. He is 42 and is married with 4 children. He has a secondary education. He is involved in animal husbandry. He raises livestock and then sells them. He buys young animals at the regional market, feeds them for 30-40 days and then sells then at a higher price. Huram has been in this business for 14 years. This business is the main source of his family’s income. The development of his business allows Huram to supply local market with fresh meat. Huram wants to receive a loan to purchase young sheep and goats. He plans to repay his loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Jamilya & Keith Leitich, Kiva Volunteers

Малаев Хурам Умарович проживает в районе Шахринау.Возраст 42 года. Женат имеет 4 детей. Образование среднее. Занимается животноводством. Разводит мелко-рогатый скот для перепродажи их на мясо. Покупает товар на рынке района, откармливает около 30-40 дней , а затем перепродает по более выгодной цене. Занимается этим видом бизнеса клиент уже 14 лет. Этот бизнес является основным источником дохода его семьи. Кроме того развитие данного сектора позволяет обеспечивать рынки свежим мясом.Клиент хочет получить кредит для того чтобы закупить молодых овец и коз. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 6 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase small cattle

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James C. sells drinks and other food items. He is a single parent with four dependents. He is managing with the little income he generates from his sales. He wants to increase sales so as to increase his income to enable him meet the needs of his family.

He is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to buy more goods to sell.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more food and drink items to sell

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr:
Mariam N’KASSAÏ was born on December 31, 1970 in Sokodé in central Togo. She is married and the mother of eight children, who all go to school regularly. She has been in the charcoal business since 1998. She usually stocks up during the season of plenty and sells in times of shortages. The first loan that she is requesting will allow her to buy thirty bags of charcoal in the village of Assrama and to sell them to middle-men in Lomé. Thus, she will be able to help her husband support their children.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Madame N’KASSAÏ Mariam est née le 31 décembre 1970 à Sokodé dans la région centrale du Togo. Elle est mariée et mère de huit (8) enfants qui fréquentent tous. Elle exerce le commerce de charbon de bois depuis 1998. Elle a l’habitude de faire le stock en saison d’abondance et de les vendre au temps de pénurie. Le premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter trente (30) sacs de charbon de bois dans le village d’Assrama et de les revendre aux semi-grossistes à Lomé. Ainsi elle pourra aider son mari à supporter les charges de leurs enfants.

loans.use: To buy and sell charcoal

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es:
Mrs. Candida is 36 years old, lives in the neighborhood Villa Reconciliacion, is single and has a one year old son. The business of Mrs. Candida is the selling of cosmetics and tortillas. She has six years of experience and started her business with financial help from her family.

She needs the loan to invest in capital, in the purchase of cosmetics, corn flour mix and firewood. This will strengthen her business and make her able to always have the products for her customers. In the future, she plans to increase her sales, improve her living conditions and educate her son.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Candida tiene 36 años de edad, habita en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, es soltera y tiene un niño de un 1 año. El negocio de doña Candida es venta de cosmético y tortillas, tiene seis años de experiencia e inició con ayuda monetaria de parte de su familia.

El préstamo lo necesita para invertir en capital, en la compra de cosmético, maseca y leña para poner sólido su negocio y ofrecer a sus clientes siempre los productos. A futuro es incrementar sus ventas, y mejorar el nivel de vida y darle educación a su hijo.

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics and raw materials for the making of tortillas.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia began her business when her husband's hot-dog cart did not bring in enough income. She decided to help him with another cart so that they could earn a little more money. She began more than five years ago. Her husband has many years experience working his own cart, and this business has done well since people in their area go out at night and buy their food. Also, weekends are generally when they earn good money.

Lidia needs a loan of US $600, which she will repay in six months, so that she can purchase ingredients to make the hot dogs. She would like to keep her cart well-stocked. With your help, she can get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Lidia inició el negocio ya que su esposo tiene un carrito de hot-dogs y con el que el manejaba no le alcanzaba así que decidió ayudarle con otro carrito afuera de su casa para poder sacar un poco mas de dinero. Comenzó hace mas de 5 años cuando puso su propio carrito, su esposo lleva muchísimos años trabajando el suyo y les ha ido muy bien ya que la gente de la colonia va por las noches a comprarles y hay ocasiones por lo general el fin de semana es cuando sacan buenas ganancias.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $600 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar materia prima para hacer los hot-dogs y le gusta tener bien surtido su carrito. Son tu ayuda ella saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients.

loans.name: Edth

texts.en: Mr. Edth T. is a construction worker in Sre Sa Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. His wife, Mrs. Nom Phaly, is employed in a garment factory makes a small salary. They have a child who is too young to work or study. Since their living conditions are poor, they would like to start a cow breeding business as a way to improve their life. Mr. Edth T. has decided to request a loan in order to begin the business. Previously, Mr. Edth T. had obtained a loan to buy a cart for use in daily life and he has succeeded in paying the loan back.

loans.use: To buy a cow to start a cow breeding business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of materials and products for her small salon

loans.name: Abdul Karim

texts.en:
A. Karim is married. He has worked for a private company as a security guard for two years. He lives in a rental house, and two months ago he bought some land where he could build a house. He started working on the house, but he has faced some economical problems, so he has applied for an individual loan. When we asked Karim how he would repay the loan, he said “After building my house with this loan, I will charge house rent and pay back the loan.”

Now he is happy with this loan process. He wants you to know that this loan can make big changes in the life of a worker in his country. He wants to thank all lenders around the world for thinking of others in these poor countries.

loans.use: To build his house

loans.name: Nasreen M.sabir Group

texts.en:
Nasreen baji is a wife of M. and lives in the city of Borewala, Pakistan. She owns a two room brick house and has been living in this city for the past 35 years. She has one 22 year old son named M. Ishtiaq. He has been running a CD shop for the past 3 years. He buys CDs from a famous market, Shahalmiu, in the city of Lahore. Nasreen bajius husband has a book stall where he sells different kinds of books (religious and story books). Nasreen baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family.

Nasreen baji has successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). She is now applying for a loan to buy more CDs for her sons CD shop. She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Khalida baji is requesting a loan to buy additional animals (goats and sheep) for her animal selling business. Mafi baji is requesting a loan to buy goats for her meat selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in their own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible for repayment.

loans.use: To purchase CD's for CD shop

loans.name: Biova Hervé

texts.fr:
Monsieur A. Bioava Hervé est né en 1985. Il est un jeune célibataire avec plein d’énergie pour travailler. Depuis qu’il a quitté les bancs d’écoles il est rentré dans le commerce de portable dans son quartier.
Il a commencé cette activité en 2007 et a déjà des clients potentiels.
Ce premier crédit qu’il sollicite lui permettra de faire le stock pour pouvoir bien vendre et tirer de bon bénéfice.
texts.en:
Mr. Bioava Hervé A. was born in 1985. He is young, unmarried, and full of energy for work. Since he quit school, he has been doing commerce in mobile phones in his neighborhood. He started this business in 2006 and already has potential customers. This initial loan he is requesting will enable him to build an inventory to do well in his sales and to derive a good profit.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell mobile phones

loans.name: Govana Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Govana Elizabeth tiene 29 años de edad, pertenece al Banco comunal Unidas para un Futuro Mejor II y vive en el distrito de Florencia de Mora, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió secundaria completa, pero no continuó estudiando porque se caso a los 21 años. Tiene 2 hijos, una niña de 8 años y un niño de 3 años.
Tiene una bodega donde vende golosina, gaseosa y cerveza, se ubica en su casa.
Con el primer crédito de S/. 300, cancelado en 4 cuotas, compró gaseosas y galletas.
Con este crédito de S/. 1,700, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, invertirá en cerveza, gaseosa y gelatina para las fiestas de Navidad.
Govana sueña con tener una tienda muy grande.
texts.en:
Govana Elizabeth is 29 years old and belongs to the United Communal Bank for a Better Future II. She lives in the Florencia de Mora district in the province of Trujillo in Libertad, Peru. She finished secondary school but did not continue studying because she got married when she was 21. She has 2 children, an 8 year old girl and a 3 year old boy. She has a store in her home where she sells candies, soda and beer. She paid her first loan of 300 soles in 4 payments and used it to buy soda and cookies. With this loan of 1,700 soles, which will also be paid in 4 payments, she will buy beer, soda and jello to sell during the Christmas holidays. Govana dreams of having a really big store.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beer, soda and gelatin to sell

loans.name: Akouwavi

texts.fr: Akouwavi K. est âgée de 29 ans, célibataire sans enfants. Elle tient depuis 2 ans une boutique d’alimentation générale à Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Avec ce crédit elle souhaite accroître la capacité de son activité en alimentant sa boutique. Elle compte sur cette opportunité afin d’améliorer les conditions de sa vie.
texts.en:
Akouwavi K. is 29 years old, unmarried, and without children. She has had a grocery store for two years in Lomé, the Togolese capital. With this loan, she would like to grow the capacity of her business by supplying her shop. She is counting on this opportunity to improve her living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for resale

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
A sus cincuenta y ocho años, Estela no se limita cuando de pensar en implementar un nuevo negocio se trata. 

Hace diez años por la mañana vende abarrotes y pollo en un mercado improvisado muy cerca de su casa. Por la s tardes se dedica a manejar su tienda ubicada en su misma casa. Aunque empezó con su tienda, se animó a vender también en el mercado ya que había mucho mas movimiento de clientes y posibilidad de vender más.

No obstante, la tarea de ganar un espacio en aquel mercado no fue fácil, pues al inicio, ese lugar, estaba lleno de basura. Gracias al permiso de la municipalidad, ellas y unas socias, pudieron limpiarlo y ser acreedoras de un puesto. En un futuro quisiera construir su puesto con material de concreto y abrir una juguería

Todos sus esfuerzos lo hace con el fin de darle una mejor calidad de vida a su última hija de doce años, quien padece de retardo mental.
texts.en:
At fifty-eight years of age, Estela does not limit herself when thinking about a new business. Since ten years ago, in the morning, she sells groceries and chicken in an improvised market very close to her home. In the afternoon, she tends to her store located in her own home. Even though she started with her store, she decided to also sell in the market because there were more customers and gave her the possibility to sell more. However, the task of gaining a space in that market was not easy, because in the beginning that place was full of trash. Thanks to the permit from the municipality, she and some associates, they were able to clean it and get a space. In the future, she would like to have her own stand made out of concrete and open a juice stand. The goal of all her efforts is to be able to offer a better quality of life to her twelve-year-old daughter, who suffers of mental retardation.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying vegetables, pasta, and milk for her business

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace A., a 30-year-old resident of Kisumu, has been in business for seven years selling kerosene to supplement the income of her husband, a civil servant. She is requesting a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchsae kerosene for her business.

loans.name: Carlista

texts.en:
Carlista sells second hand clothes. She has been in business for the past eight years.

Carlista lives in Ilogbo and she has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past three years.

Carlista is 39 years old and married with two children. She is requesting a loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more second hand clothes to sell. Carlista says thanks.

loans.use: Purchase more second hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Abosede

texts.en: Abosede F. is 43 years old and married with 4 children. She sells planks for roofing and making furniture. She is requesting the loan amount of 50,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more planks to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria S. is a farmer. She grows rice a short distance from their house. She is 47 years old and has two children. Her husband, Jose S., is also a farmer. He is the one managing the farm. Maria worked previously in Manila as a salesclerk. She stopped working there because she was paid less by her employer.

She is asking a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and other farm necessities. The loan will truly help her increase the yield of her farm. She is looking forward for the upcoming harvest once she can purchase the things she needs for her farm.


CEVI is reaching out to more people to help them grow their business. It provides credit assistance, training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs like fertilizers and herbicides

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is thirty-six years old and married with six children. She sells provisions to her customers at her retail grocery store.  She wants a loan to purchase more provisions to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more provisions to sell

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn A. is from the city of Cagayan de Oro. She is 56 years old. Merlyn is married and has 3 school-aged children. Merlyn owns & operates a specialized retail store selling fruits & vegetables. Merlyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Merlyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Merlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Merlyn is requesting a new loan of PHP 11000 which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Merlyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the fruit & vegetable retail business.

loans.name: Sobirchon

texts.ru: Арипов Собирчон проживает в районе Курган-Тюбе. Возраст 29 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Собирчон более 10 лет занимается торговлей. Он имеет торговую точку на рынке, где торгует продуктами питания. Клиент просит кредит, для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Sobirchon A. lives in the Qurgan-Tube district. He is 29 years old, married and has 3 children. Sobirchon has been involved in sales for over 10 years. He has a retail store, where he sells food products. Our client is requesting this loan to increase product turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing product turnover

loans.name: Hun

texts.en: Hun C. is twenty-five years old and has been involved in her weaving business since 1999 at her village in Takeo Province.  Her typical income is $3 a day.  The Cambodian method of weaving requires hard work and a long time to create the best products for competitive pricing at the markets. Therefore, she has to work very hard and pay close attention to this task every day.  Although weaving has been their primary income to ensure a comfortable standard of living, Hun really wants to take out a loan of $1000 to purchase a machine for her husband to charge batteries for his villagers. There is no electrical service in the village yet.

loans.use: To buy a machine to charge batteries

loans.name: Judith's Group

texts.en:
T. Judith is a very hardworking lady, who mainly sells bananas. She is a divorced mother of three children, ages 3 – 12 years, and she cares for 2 orphans. Her business is mainly situated in Ishaka town. Her main business challenge is debtors who buy on credit.

Her start-up capital was about 300,000 shillings two years ago, but she now has capital of 5,000,000 shillings. Judith hopes to one day move from retail sales to wholesale. She wants to educate her children up to the highest level using profit from her sales and with the help of loans. At the moment, she needs to add more capital to her business so that she can save for her children’s school fees.

loans.use: To buy more produce for resale

loans.name: Divino Niño Group

texts.es:
Divino Niño es un comité  lleva ya un año trabajando con créditos de la Fundacion Paraguaya. Cuenta con 20 integrantes de las cuales podemos hablar de dos integrantes del mismo.

La Sra Julia G. posee un pequeño kiosko que inicio hace seis meses con la ayuda de su marido. Ella vende golosinas jugos gaeosas,comidas frias etc ingreso en el comie con la idea de ampliar su pequeño negocito.
La Sra Margarita R. es una mujer muy sacrificada ella es vrendedora de hamburguesas empanadas y bebidas por las tardecitas hasta muy tarde de la noche y de dia tiene ventas de ropas por los alrededores de su casa.
Es un comité nuevo pero con ganas de superarse espremos lo logren. Las demas intengrantes se dedican a las siguientes actividades:


Julia Azucena G. 	Vta de comestibles
Margarita R.	Vta de merceria
Neide C.	costurera
Romina R.  	Peluquera
Pablina R. 	Vta de comestibles

Maura P.	Vta de articulos de limpieza 
 Carmen F.	Limpiadora
Mari C.	Decoradora
Juana C. 	Venta de ropas
Virginia V.	Modista
Elvira A.	Venta de ropas
Maria R.	cocinera
Selva Pintos	Vta de articulos de limpieza
Maria V. R.  	Peluquera
Deysi O.  	Vta de cosmeticos 
Petrona R.	Vta de Comestible
Antonia R.	Vta de lenceria
Maria Luisa R.	Vta de comestibles
Mercedes V.	Vta de ropas
Edy Graciela B.	Vta de art. de limpieza
texts.en:
The Divino Niño Committee has been working with loans from Fundación Paraguaya for one year. The group has 20 members and we were able to speak with 2 of them.

Sra. Julia G. has been operating a small kiosk from home for the past six months with the help of her husband. She sells candy, sodas, juices, frozen foods, etc. With her loan, she hopes to expand her small business.

Sra. Margarita R. is a self-sacrificing woman. She sells hamburgers, empanadas, and drinks in the early evenings until very late at night. She also sells clothing in the neighborhoods around her home.

This is a new committee that hopes to grow and succeed. The other members are engaged in the following activities:

Julia Azucena G. sells groceries Margarita R. sells sewing supplies and clothing Neide C. is a seamstress Romina R. is a hairdresser Pablina R. sells groceries Maura P. sells cleaning supplies Carmen F. offers cleaning services Mari C. is an interior designer Juana C. sells clothing Virginia V. makes dresses Elvira A. sells clothing Maria R. is a cook Selva Pintos sells cleaning supplies Maria V. R. is a hairdresser Deysi O. sells cosmetics Petrona R. sells groceries Antonia R. sells lingerie Maria Luisa R. sells groceries Mercedes V. sells clothing Edy Graciela B. sells cleaning supplies

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise & supplies

loans.name: Bunthai

texts.en:
Mr. Bunthai K., age 39, and his wife, Mrs. Sokyoeun Samrit, age 29, were married in 1999 and just have one daughter who attends school. The family lives in a small village off of National Road number Two about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Bunthai has been a plumber and electrician for 11 years. His wife has been selling grocery for one year. Nowadays, there is a pond behind his house and he wants to eliminate the pond by filing it, but he doesn’t have money. That’s why Bunthai is asking for his first loan of US$1,000 in order to use for the purpose.

loans.use: To eliminate a pond behind his house by filling it in.

loans.name: Miguel Juliao

texts.pt:
Miguel Juliao M. nasceu em Inhambane tem 27 anos de idade, vive maritalmente é pai de dois filhos o primeiro de 5 anos e um recém nascido de apenas 1 mês. para alem dos seus filhos não responsabiliza se por ninguém e consegue poupar por mês 500.00MT.

Miguel sai de inhambane para Namaacha na companhia do seu tio e consegue um emprego no mesmo distrito. Miguel trabalha como guarda a mais de 9 anos, cuidando e vivendo em casa do seu patrão ganhando mensalmente 3.500.00MT.

Na tentativa de aumentar a renda familiar, com o fundo que havia colectado, ele inicia com a criação de pintos na capoeira que foi cedida pelo patrão, mas devido à reabilitação das mesmas teve que parar e dar inicia de uma outra actividade (venda de roupas adquiridas na áfrica do sul nomeadamente mantas, calças, blusas e alguns utensílios domésticos), mas como aproxima se o verão tem tido muitas encomendas.

Este e o terceiro empréstimo de Miguel na Hluvuku e primeiro com Kiva no valor de 10.000,00mt para compra e venda de roupa. Vai fazer pela primeira vez. O primeiro de 8.000.00MT foi usado para comprar pintos e ração para o negocio de criação de frangos, o segundo de 10.000.00MT para aumentar o volume de criação de frangos. 
Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo para concluir a sua obra.
texts.en:
Miguel Juliao M. was born in Inhambane and he's 27 years old. He is married and has two children, a 5 year old and a newborn. Besides his children, he is not responsible for anyone else and is able to save 500.00MT every month. Miguel has been working as a security guard for the past 9 years, and lives at his employers house. He makes 3.500.00MT per month. In the attempt of increase the family's income, he used his savings to start raising chicken at the piece of land given him by his boss, but while the land was being reabilitated, he had to put his chicken business on hold and started selling clothes from South Africa, like pants and shirts, as well as kitchen utensils. With summer coming up, Miguel has been getting a lot of orders. This is his third loan with Hluvuku and the first with Kiva, in the amount of $375, to buy more inventory for his clothing business. The two first loans were used to start his chicken business. He is confident that he will be able to pay it back soon, and then ask for another one to finish building his house.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Nabihan

texts.en: Navihan is 50 years old and lives with his wife and two children, a daughter aged 23 and a son aged 18, in a house in the Bayan-Ulgii province of western Mongolia. His wife is unable to work because of a serious illness she contracted while working at a local mining company. Navihan, along with his daughter, operates a retail clothing business from a rented stall at the local market. Navihan’s daughter was unable to go to university when she graduated high school because of the high cost of tuition. Navihan began his business in 2004 so that he could provide a better life for his wife and children. Since then, the business profits have enabled him and his family to build a new home. Navihan not only wants to expand his clothing stall into a large clothing shop, but he  also wants to be able to pay for both of his children to go to university so that they can get a good education. Navihan is requesting a 3,000,000 tugrug (~2100 USD) loan to both purchase more clothes so that he can offer more products to his customers, and to help pay for his children’s tuition fees.

loans.use: to help pay for his children’s tuition fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock palm oil

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr:
Madame  Mariam Koné est âgée de 35 ans, mariée et mère  de 3  enfants.  Elle  vit avec son mari et ses enfants dans une famille traditionnelle avec plusieurs autres ménages dans le quartier Hamdallaye de la ville  de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Mariam n’a pas fréquenté l’école moderne, elle fréquenta plutôt la medersa qu’elle abandonna  en classe de 7ème année (système éducatif Malien) pour apprendre le métier tailleur. Elle  commença  auprès d’un maître tailleur, après avoir fait 5 ans d’apprentissage et riche de cette expérience empirique, elle évolue seule et mène cette activité depuis 10 ans. Elle jouit d’une grande notoriété et clientèle. Sa force de vente est due à son enthousiasme, surtout à sa ponctualité sur le délai de livraison. En plus du métier de tailleur, elle fait de la teinture.
Dans le souci  d’augmenter son fonds de commerce, afin de réaliser plus de bénéfices. Elle a fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est  à son 1er prêt individuel, qu’elle compte utiliser  pour acheter une machine à coudre de marque CORNA. Elle s’approvisionne sur place. Madame  Mariam Koné vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40 000FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permet d’aider son mari et de participer aux événements sociaux (baptême, mariage etc.…). 
Son ambition est d’ouvrir une boutique de prêt-à-porter.
texts.en:
Ms. Mariam Koné is 35 years old, married, and the mother of three children. She lives with her husband and children in a traditional family with several other families in the Hamdallaye district of the city of Ségou (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Mariam didn’t have modern schooling. Rather, she went to a medersa, which she quit in the 7th year (education system of Mali) in order to learn tailoring. She started off with a master tailor. After five years of apprenticeship, she is rich with practical experience, and she is advancing on her own and has been running this business for ten years now. She enjoys a good deal of distinction and a large customer base. Her selling power is due to her enthusiasm, especially her punctuality in fulfilling orders. In addition to her tailoring trade, she dyes cloth. Concerned about increasing her business capital in order to realize more profits, she turned toward Soro Yiriwaso. She is on her first individual loan, which she intends to use to buy a CORNA brand sewing machine. Her supplies are gotten locally. And sales are made in cash or on credit to customers composed of women and men. With this loan, she envisions realizing a monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA. This profit allows her to help her husband and to assist with societal events (baptisms, marriages, etc.) Her ambition is to open a ready-to-wear clothing store.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
La señora Consuelo es socia del Banco Comunal “Azangarinas Valientes” del distrito D. Azángaro D. la Región Puno; tiene 64 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada, tiene 06 hijos D. los cuales 2  están a su cargo.  Estudió hasta el 1er grado D. primaria.
Consuelo  viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 5 meses, su préstamo inicial fue S/. 500.00 (nuevos soles) el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio D. pasamanería.
En la actualidad requiere D. un préstamo D. S/. 600.00 (nuevos soles), el cual le permitirá comprar ahujas, hilos,palillos, pasadores, etc.
Su mayor deseo es progresar y aumentar su capital D. trabajo. 
Referente a su Banco Comunal, ella manifiesta que le gusta la puntualidad y responsabilidad D. las socias.
texts.en:
Consuelo, 64, is a member of the “Azangarinas Valientes” communal bank, which is located in the Azángaro district, Puno region. She is married and has 6 children, of whom two are still under her care. She finished first graD.. She has been cooperating with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the last 5 months. Her initial loan was for 500 new soles which she used to capitalize her decorative fringe-making business. Currently she is needing 600 new soles to buy needles, thread, pins, safety-pins, etc. Her greatest desire is to get ahead and increase her working capital. With respect to her communal bank, she states that she likes the punctuality and sense of responsiblity of the members.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials used to make decorative fringe.

loans.name: Sartasiñani Group

texts.es:
Sartasiñani” es el nombre elegido por este grupo de nueve socias que han dedicado ya gran parte de su vida al comercio de todo tipo de mercadería según la temporada, lo que hace que la proximidad de las fiestas de fin de año, se convierta en una gran oportunidad de generar importantes recursos para ellas y sus familias.
Tienen un  compromiso con la institución demostrando responsabilidad, están seguros que lograran realizar una buena inversión en sus rubros para beneficio y mejora de la calidad de vida  de todas ellas y sus familias.El grupo en su totalidad comprara mercaderia.
texts.en:
Sartasiñani is the name chosen by this group of nine members who have dedicated part of their lives to the trade of all kinds of seasonal merchandise. The coming Holiday Season is a great opportunity to generate income for the members and their families.

They have a commitment with the institution and have shown themselves to be responsible. They are certain that they will make a good investment in the items they plan to purchase. Their aim is to improve their quality of life and that of their families. The group will use the total of the loan to purchase inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: PURCHASE OF INVENTORY

loans.name: Esteria Ngithi

texts.en: Esteria Ngithi N. runs Bessy hardware, where she sells goods like paints, engine oils, plumbing materials, nails and spare parts to new and frequent customers.  Her business challenge is low demand from customers, hence making small sales.  She plans to use the proceeds of a KES70,000 loan to restock the hardware in her store.  Her lifetime goal is to open another branch.  Esteria is married and has three children ranging from 9 to 16 years old.  She describes herself as hardworking and honest.

loans.use: To buy engine oils, nails, spanners and paints.

loans.name: Flora Isabel

texts.es:
Flora Isabel M. es socia activa del Banco Comunal Avenida del  Ejército en la ciudad de Portoviejo, ella es oriunda del cantón Junín en la provincia de Manabí pero se radicó en esta ciudad,  está casada y tiene tres hijos,   ella junto al esposo tienen  una volqueta que la alquilan para hacer fletes de arena, ripio y piedras recorriendo varios lugares dentro y fuera de la provincia desde hace diez años.
 
Para ella lo más importante es que la familia esté unida,  y su sueño  es poder compararse otra volqueta para seguir trabajando e incrementar su negocio, por ahora no ha quedado mal con los pagos a la Fundación y espera poder seguir siempre así.

Con el  préstamo solicitado a  la Fundación va a  invertir en el mantenimiento de su volqueta, cambio de aceite y compra de  llantas.
texts.en:
Flora Isabel M. is an active member of the Avenida del Ejército Communal Bank in the city of Portoviejo. She is from the Junín canton in the Manabí province, but she settled in this city. She is married and has three children. She and her husband have a small truck, which they rent out to take loads of sand, stone chips, and rocks. They travel to various places in and out of the province, and they have been doing so for ten years. The most important thing to her is that the family is united. Her dream is to be able to buy another small truck to keep working and increasing her business. Up until now she has done well with the payments to the Foundation, and she expects to be able to always continue this way. She will use the loan she is asking the Foundation for to invest in maintenance on her truck, change the oil, and to buy tires.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance on her truck, change the oil, and buy tires

loans.name: Rosibel Maria

texts.es: Rosibel Maria tiene la edad 59 años, su actividad económica es la venta de tortillas. Hace más de 30 años que se dedica a este negocio ella dio inicio a esta actividad por lo que es una mujer muy luchadora a pesar de la edad que ella tiene, la forma de obtener ingresos para mantener a su familia en lo necesario. Su actividad económica es la venta de tortillas y frijoles cocidos, en su vecindario ella ha obtenido la fama necesaria pues la mayoría de personas sus clientes son sus propios vecinos, ella disfruta mucho de su actividad económica ya que es el único medio de vida que tiene. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de maíz, leña y frijoles. Su deseo es mejorar la calidad de sus productos como son las tortillas y proporcionarles las condiciones adecuadas a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Rosibel Maria, 59, makes and sell tortillas. She has been in this line of work for over 30 years. She began this work because she is hard-working and wants to produce income to support her family. Despite her age, she continues with this work; she sells tortillas and cooked beans. She is famous in her neighborhood; her customers are her neighbors. She enjoys her work very much since this is her only source of income. The funding requested will be used to buy corn, firewood and beans. Her wish is to improve the quality of her tortillas and to provide her home with adequate living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood, corn and beans.

loans.name: Aoua

texts.fr:
Née le 10 Juillet 1968 à Sikasso, Aoua Traoré est une femme mariée mère de 2 enfants qui vit dans une famille polygame avec son époux, sa coépouse et leurs enfants dans la famille paternelle de son époux à Kaboïla II au centre ville de Sikasso.(troisième région du Mali)
Secrétaire Dactylo de formation, elle est issue d’une famille de teinturière  ce qui témoigne de son attachement  et dextérité pour cette activité qui lui rapporte gros.  
Madame Aoua Traoré est en relation avec Soro Yiriwaso il y a  trois  ans. Elle est à son deuxième prêt individuel, le prêt précédent a été correctement remboursé. 
Elle sollicite ce prêt pour acheter, 15 pièces de bazin blanc, 20 sachets de soude caustique et 20 boîtes de teintures de couleurs différentes.
Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako en matières premières (bazins blancs, soude caustique et teinture) pour les mettre en couleur et ensuite les revendre soit au comptant ou à crédit. Elle a pour  clientèle potentielle, les revendeuses de bazins teintés, les couturiers, les femmes de son quartier, etc. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 200 000 FCFA qui lui permettra de couvrir l'essentielle de ses dépenses personnelles, contribuer à celles de son foyer en aidant son époux, payer les intérêts de son prêt et renforcer son activité de teinture.
texts.en:
Born on July 10, 1968, in Sikasso, Aoua Traoré is a married woman and the mother of two children. She lives in a polygamous family with her husband, his co-spouse, and their children, in her husband's paternal family in Kaboïla II in the center of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali). Trained as a secretary and typist, she comes from a family of dyers, which shows her bond and dexterity to this profession, which earns her quite a lot. Mrs. Aoua Traoré has been associated with Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, for three years. She's seeking her second individual loan, and the previous one was repaid without problems. She's seeking this loan to buy 15 lengths of white Bazin fabric, 20 sachets of sodium hydroxide, and 20 boxes of dyes of different colors. She gets her supplies (white Bazins, sodium hydroxide and dyes) in Bamako, and then dye them before selling them, for cash or on credit. Her potential customers are women who resell dyed Bazins, tailors, women in her neighborhood, etc. She intends to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 200'000 (ca US$ 400) which will enable her to pay for most of her personal expenses, help her husband with the family expenses, repay the loan, and strengthen her business.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy Bazin fabrics, dyes, and sodium hydroxide

loans.name: Jorge Martín

texts.es:
Jorge Martín Z. C., tiene la edad de 39 años, está en unión libre, tiene 2 hijos, pero vive solo con la esposa. El crédito lo quiere para comprar materiales y remodelar la porqueriza, además, de comprar algunos cerdos para la cría y la alimentación de los mismos. La idea es darle el adecuado mantenimiento a los cerdos para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Jorge tiene muchos años en este negocio de cría de cerdos. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Jorge Martín Z. C., 39, lives with his life partner. He has two children but he only lives with his wife. He needs funds to buy supplies and remodel his pigsty. In addition, he wants to buy some pigs to raise and feed for them. The idea is to provide proper care for the pigs so that they will produce the best possible sales price when they are sold. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the loan terms given. Jorge has been in the business of raising pigs for many years. He hopes to provide his family with better cuality of life and economic stability in the future and to continue to develop both as a person and as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs and make improvements to the pigsties.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose D. is a 47-year-old woman from the region of Diourbel, Senegal. She is married and is the mother of five children.

Rose has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" NGASCOP for four years and has always paid back her loans on time.

Rose's main activity consists of selling cosmetics products and cloth. Besides this, she also raises pigs to increase her revenues. This loan is used to buy new perfume and fabrics which she will sell.

The revenues generated by this activity allow Rose to pay for the medical and school expenses of her children.

loans.use: To purchase perfume and fabrics to sell

loans.name: C2352 Twisungane Group

texts.en:
T. Ester is 30 years old and is married with five children aged between 3 and 15. Her husband is driver and they both work hard for their family.

T. is the group leader of five members, all of whom have different businesses, mostly fruits and vegetables. T. owns a small shop which sells different kinds of products such as toothpaste, cosmetic products, juice and so on. She employs one person as a helper so that her business runs well. The hours of her shop are from seven in the morning to six in the evening, every day except Sunday. This her 3rd successful year in her business.

T. and her group are requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their businesses through purchasing more products to sell. With this loan, T. and her group hope to increase their monthly profits which will allow them to sustain their businesses.

loans.use: To buy additional products for her shop
